Job Description:
Job description/Person specification
Job Description
> This is a new opportunity for an experienced Network Engineer to join a team of dedicated IT professionals to deliver new and exciting IT systems into the Defence environment.
> The candidate shall have in-depth experience of installing and configuring Cisco Routers and Switches, and ideally have experience of Firewall products and network virtualisation technologies (e.g. VMWare NSX)
> Working under a Senior Engineer or Architect, the candidate will lead smaller tasks and take responsibility for the task’s technical output. The applicant will work with the technical management team to identify resources required for the task and provide regular progress updates.
> The applicant will be at ease working within a small to medium sized team and be comfortable taking on new tasks outside of their skill set as required by the business.
> The applicant will be expected to uphold quality and deliver solutions to budget and time constraints. Solutions must be delivered fully documented so a high standard of written work is expected.
> The team support projects across a range of QinetiQ sites, so mobility is a key requirement of the role. Although based in Portsmouth, the candidate will be expected to work at other QinetiQ sites as required – with travel & subsistence provided.
> SC Clearance (or be eligible/willing to undergo), with aim of gaining DV clearance.

Position Requirement
> Proactively work with solution architects and aid in the production of (and/or contributions to) proposals for work (preparation/justification of work programmes/plans/resource estimates)
> Lead tasks to ensure delivered solution follow the defined design process and QinetiQ governance procedures and processes through design reviews
> Keep abreast of industry trends and advancements in information technology
> Build and enhance relationships with peers and QinetiQ’s infrastructure services
> Be responsible for undertaking project work across the team as required – participation in reference groups, training and research on new functionality etc.
> Working towards becoming recognised as a Network expert within QinetiQ
> Willingness to travel within the UK and potentially overseas

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Required
> Practical experience in network design, implementation, configuration and testing (ideally CCNA Qualified) – practical experience of routing protocols (BGP, OSPF), compression and acceleration techniques
> Specific skills in network security design, implementation, configuration and testing: Firewalls, Guards, Intrusion Detection, IPSec VPN, Computer / router IA lockdown, IP encryption, VOIP
> Knowledge of JSP 604 and 440 and associated JSPs would be desirable.

QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Why don’t you join some of the world’s finest scientific and technical minds and help us make tomorrow work today?

Location: Roy Shaw Centre (3-5 Cressy Road) with some home working

Starting salary: £46,756

Contract Type: Permanent, Full time, 36 hours per week, Full time, 36
hours per week

Alternative flexible working options available/open
to discussion

Click
HERE
for information on Camden’s flexible working options

Camden is changing
on the inside to make life better for everyone. Because we’re not just home to
the UK’s fast-growing economy. We’re home to the most important conversations
happening today.And we’re
making radical social change a reality, so that nobody gets left behind. As a Lead Network Engineer, you’ll provide
a high-quality desktop support service for the whole council, which will
improve the future for all of us.

Camden are
seeking a Lead Network Engineer to take responsibility for the design,
specification, development and day-to-day operations of the Camden network
infrastructure.

We are going
through exciting new changes, which require the need for Lead Network engineers
who can redesign, architect, document and implement an innovative network. In
this role you will deliver a high quality and efficient network service,
supporting staff and officers working from a variety of council offices, mobile
and remote locations, exploiting network technologies and management support
systems.

You will be
CCIE qualified and MUST attach your certificate to the application. BSc in
relevant discipline, or equivalent industry experience is also required. Hands
on Palo Alto firewall and global protect is desirable.

A strong
understanding of the IT / IS infrastructure, operating systems, configurations
and the IT applications and service processes. Proficient in the frameworks and
principles on which networks, systems, equipment and resources are based along
with an understanding in telecommunications protocols.

You will also
have good communication skills, with the willingness to work extra hours when
required.

This role is
also subject to a DBS Enhanced Check.

We’re ready to
welcome your ideas, your views, and your rebellious spirit. Help us redefine how we provide IT support
at Camden, and we’ll redefine what a career can be. If that sounds good to
you, we’d love to talk.

About Camden

Working for Camden you’ll receive
a host of great benefits, Click HERE to see full details.

To discover more about Camden and
our commitment towards diversity, equality and safeguarding, please visit our recruitment website

How to
apply:

To apply for this job please
follow the "Apply" link. In the ‘Why you?’ section of the application
form you will be expected to explain how you meet the key requirements for this
role noted in the Job Profile. When explaining how you meet each of the
requirements, please give examples that clearly demonstrate your skills,
knowledge and experience. When writing your examples give a brief description
of the situation or task but focus on the actions you took and the result of
your actions.

Closing dates for applications: Sunday
22 November, 23:59

Interviews to be held: w/c 30
November 2020

Please quote
reference: 200000CA

Job Title: NETWORK ENGINEER
Hours: 37.5 PER WEEK (OFFICE OPENING HOURS 08:30 – 18:00)
dbfb is leading the way in Northampton and Milton Keynes by providing the most innovative communications & technology solutions to local businesses.Our mantra is simpler; better, faster communications. Our goal is to support our clients through their technology & connectivity needs, providing a flexible service which grows and changes with them. We future proof businesses and allow companies to work in a way which benefits them, and their customers. Our clients rely on dbfb to be a trusted advisor, guiding them to a better future, through technology.
As a Network Engineer for dbfb you are accountable to the Head of Technology, your roles will include, but not limited to, the following five main areas;
1. 2nd/3rd Line Support both Internally and Externally, including appropriate diagnosis, tracking, documentation and resolution of network incidents.
2. Creation of technical project scopes through survey and recommendations, delivery and installation of solutions on site.
3. Preparation and configuration of network equipment for customers, documenting setup extensively in our Technical Documentation tool.
4. Appropriate maintenance, documentation and knowledgebase creation of our internal monitoring and troubleshooting toolsets. Proactive identification of issues through available tools, logging and troubleshooting as well as variable adjustments on monitoring tools.
5. Creation and generation of reporting for technical tools to highlight issues, provide customer feedback, in-life Account Management reporting and finding solutions to recurring problems.
Key Supportable Technologies:
· Routing & Switching
· Firewalls & Edge Technologies
· Network Security & Management
· Wi-Fi
· VPN & Cloud Networking
Key Tasks:
· Maintain all network monitoring systems and provide reports on the status and performance of such. Identification of improvement opportunities.
· Ensuring updates are delivered to customers on issues, and effectively managing time.
· On site installations, surveying, and creating supportable solutions for customer requirements.
· Assist with the scoping exercises alongside our pre-sales technical teams to ensure alignment in viable solutions.
· Liaise with Project Managers to ensure delivery of projects on time and within required budgets.
· Clear mapping of site surveys to ensure projects and installations team understand requirements and deliverables.
· Comprehensive documentation of all installations to sign off to in-life support.
General -
· Development of knowledge and skills in networking technologies.
· Collect and review performance reports for various systems, and report trends in hardware and application performance to assist senior technical personnel to predict potential issues or outages.
· Document all actions in accordance with standard company policies and procedures.
· As a fast-moving organisation, it is essential to have a good degree of time management and expectation setting.
· For this role we do have a requirement for the applicant to have some good working knowledge in networking, this can be through both experience and academic, but will be required to hit the ground running in this role.
PERSON SPECIFICATION
Core Standards:
Dbfb measure our staff on the following core standards of behaviour.
· Customer Centric/Focused
· Accountability
· Time Keeping
· Team Working
· Additional Responsibilities
· Influential Communication
· Change Management
· Business Acumen
· Strategic/Commercial Appreciation & Behaviour
· Business Development
· Manages Results
Experience:
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a technical or practical Networking role
Understanding of network monitoring concepts and management tools.
Previous experience of a managed service-based organisation
Qualifications:
Cisco CCNA or vendor-neutral equivalent qualifications are required.
A degree in a technology field is also desirable but not essential.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £35,000.00-£40,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Company events
Company pension
Employee discount
On-site parking
Wellness programmes
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
COVID-19 considerations:
Temperature taken every morning, social distancing enforced, hand sanitiser provided.
Work remotely:
Yes, temporarily due to COVID-19

Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells high-performance distributed systems that make the business of trading and transacting money (and other financial assets) easier, faster, safer, and smarter for everyone involved. Our technology makes it simple to create, combine, and extend large-scale, high-performance intelligent systems in ways that were never before possible.

As pioneers within our industry, we hire top talent and strive to build the next generation of thought leaders. People who are naturally compelled to figure out what works and why - enthusiastic crafters, outside-the-box thinkers, and brilliant self-starters. No stuffy corporate office. No dress code or business attire (unless that’s your thing). No endless meeting schedules. We build amazing software that solves real-time problems with some of the greatest thinkers around the world, and we love doing it.

Broadway Technology is looking for a sharp Senior Network Engineer who has experience designing resilient, mission-critical trading networks infrastructure for global trading organizations. Past experience in low-latency network design and management is a must.
Broadway is a leading provider of high-performance trading solutions. We've delivered some of the world’s most advanced systems to a who’s who customer list that includes the largest global banks. Our software manages billions of dollars in transactions daily.

Responsibilities
Manage Broadway’s global trading network. Identify and resolve network failures on both switches and servers and network performance within both the trading environment and corporate network.
Ensure the security of the trading and corporate networks. Remain current on information security best practices. Recommend and implement security tools, policies and procedures.
Configure multicast networks, including Multicast PIM Sparse/Dense and IGMP.
Collaborate with customers and partner with technical teams to make changes to network connectivity.
Create and maintain documentation for network environments and user documentation for utilizing network services.
Leverage and expand use of automation across all actives to build operational scale with use of Puppet and/or Ansible.
Manage short and longer term projects while owning day to day issues to resolution, keeping stakeholders informed of the issue status.
Lights out management, maintenance, and administration of HPE servers
On call work and weekend work may be required.
Requirements
Very strong knowledge of IP routing, VLANs, Access Control Lists and Network Address Translation.
Exceptional knowledge on scripting/automation using Python, Bash and Ansible
Exceptional knowledge on Unix systems and how to utilize Low Latency applications
Exceptional problem-solving skills in networking.
Unrelenting commitment to quality and exceptional attention to detail.
Outstanding analytical and organization skills.
Knowledge of, and experience implementing, best practices to enforce network and system security e.g. ISO 27001.
Demonstrated expertise in process and system documentation.
Excellent verbal/written communication.
Strong collaborative nature and the ability to support internal and external clients.
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in telecommunications, computer engineering, or a related field.
Nice To Have
Windows or Linux administration (specifically RedHat and Centos) and troubleshooting skill sets
Active Directory management
Experience
At least 4 years of experience in a senior role, managing switches and other network equipment at L2/L3, connecting international data centers, customer sites and market partners.
At least 4 years managing production systems across multiple, global sites.
At least 3 years securing edge infrastructure with firewalls, IDS/IPS products and configuration of VPNs to 3rd parties
Network routing inside, outside and between the company and external partners.
Expertise in multiple vendor firewall, switching and routing technologies like Arista, Fortigate, Cisco or A10 Networks
BGP & BFD setup as well as demonstrated experience troubleshooting.
Analyzing network data captures with tools such as Wireshark.
VPN: between sites using IPSec as well as between users and sites.
Past experience with maintaining network configurations with version control systems.
Penetration testing experience is a plus.
Python scripting or similar.
About Broadway Technology
Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells low-latency distributed systems, primarily for use in financial applications like trading bonds, fiat currencies, and cryptocurrencies. Our software has powered the world’s most critical systems at top financial institutions and controls well over $125 trillion in business annually across five continents. Our proprietary software platform is an open, flexible, complete solution for screen and automated trading operations of any size and complexity.

Founded in 2003, Broadway has nearly 200 employees worldwide with offices in New York, Austin, London, Waterloo, Toronto and Christchurch. Our founders are industry-recognized innovators (as well as MIT and Cornell alum) with advanced CS/engineering degrees and 15+ years leading high-tech ventures.

We take a rapid, methodical approach to development; and we focus on creating solutions that solve our clients’ immediate needs, yet can evolve and scale as needs change. We believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed.

This is an exciting opportunity for an ambitious network engineer looking to develop their career within a highly successful, growing tech company.
We are looking for a confident and self-motivated individual to take control of our server network to ensure our continued growth and to improve the security of our server infrastructure.
You’ll be responsible for maintenance and monitoring as well as planning and implementing improvements to extend automation, segment our network and increase capacity.
You’ll join our Infrastructure team of 7 who are located in Brighton and Kyiv, Ukraine.
The role will require some travel to and work from our data centre location in Maidenhead, Berkshire as well as occasional travel to our head office in Brighton, East Sussex.
Requirements
Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware
Ability to think through problems and visualize solutions
Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices, including firewalls, routers, switches, controllers
Knowledge of application transport and network infrastructure protocols
Ability to create accurate network diagrams and documentation for design and planning network communication systems
Provide specific detailed information for hardware and software selection
Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources
A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a team environment
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Dependable and flexible when necessary (some out of hours work will be required)
Network security experience
Extensive experience in Linux/Unix system administration
Great To Have
Experience with system automation tools, such as Ansible or Puppet
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From £40,000.00 per year
Additional pay:
Bonus scheme
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company pension
Private medical insurance
Sick pay
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
COVID-19 considerations:
Our office is currently closed and most staff are working from home in line with government recommendations.
Work remotely:
Yes

The Senior Support Engineer is responsible for providing day to day technical support to all business users and monitoring, maintaining and optimising the ‘run’ elements of the core IT Infrastructure.

Key Accountabilities:
Using ITSM processes, provide in depth technical support to business users, IT colleagues, team suppliers and partners/sponsors across the broad IT Services and Systems.
Proactively manage and monitor the “run” elements of our core IT infrastructure. Identifying and addressing faults and issues before they impact service availability.
Act as a mentor and senior escalation point for 1st and 2nd level support personnel.
Transition new services into early life support, ensuring handover plans and all supporting documentation is relevant and regularly kept up to date.
Proactively look to improve and add efficiency to current process and exercise judgment in the decision-making process in order to provide excellent customer experience.
Working with all areas of the IT Team with regards to planning and implementation of Changes and major project work.
Contribute to knowledge tools and communities, and ensure learnings are shared for reuse.
Be part of a team providing out of hours support via an on call rota.
Technical Skills:
Extensive Windows Client and Server OS setup, configuration, deployment and management.
Advanced Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Group Policy.
Azure and Office365 Configuration.
Microsoft Core Platform/Back Office Server Technology (Skype, SQL, SCOM, SCCM).
VMWare ESXi.
Enterprise Storage Solutions – SAN, NAS, Replication.
Data Backup and Data Retention Services (Backup/Restore/Archive).
Core Networking (LAN/DC/WIFI, Switching, Routing, Firewalls).
Mobile device deployment, support and management.
Scripting, PowerShell, Chef.
Person Profile:
Confident, self-motivated and passionate about the customer experience.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, oral and presentation communication skills.
A methodical and structured approach to problem solving, selecting and effectively utilising appropriate methods, procedures, tools, equipment and standards, to meet all targets set.
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a high pressure environment and consistently deliver to deadlines.
Used to working and adhering to the ITIL Framework for Service Design, Transition and Operation.
Display behaviours in line with the Team’s behaviour framework.
Benefits:

In return for your work and commitment, we offer a competitive package including bonus, life assurance, private medical cover, 25 days holidays, subsidised restaurant and on-site gym facilities.

DevOps Engineer
Netduma are a rapidly growing, award-winning tech startup developing innovative software for networks. Our unique router operating system, DumaOS, is licensed to NETGEAR, the world’s largest router vendor, and Telstra, the largest ISP in Australia.
As a DevOps Engineer, you are responsible for maintaining and improving our development & release infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to design and develop creative, compelling, fault-tolerant and cutting-edge networking systems that support our mission.
You will be involved in various stages of each product's lifespan and work with a combination of in-house (on-prem) technology and Cloud systems. This is an ideal role for someone who is looking to get more exposure to cutting edge tools and Devops methodologies.
What you will get to do:
Creating and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for multiple environments
Partnering with developers to create instrumentation to monitor, troubleshoot and resolve issues related to the health of software services
Maintaining/creating operations documentation
Collaborate with engineers to manage code releases and deployments
Build pipelines, scripts, and documentation to improve the way we deploy
Architect the overall DevOps CI/CD design, development, testing, and release of new capabilities and features
Writing scripts to automatically deploy all types of applications
Creating tools to analyze and visualize system health
What we are looking for:
Essential Experience
Command line Linux / Bash
Python
Docker (or some other container technology)
Git
Build Systems e.g. Makefiles
Automation tools e.g. Jenkins
Desirable Experience
C
Buildroot, Yocto or OpenWRT
Building Linux Kernel
Wireless and Linux network stack
CMake
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
DevOps: 1 year (Preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Job Title: Lead UC Engineer - Bournemouth or Remote
Job Description:
Help us shape the future of telecoms as a Lead Unified Communications Engineer.
We have and continue to turn the telecoms world on its head. We've developed unique products and services which have seen excellent growth and interesting work and challenges appear. As we move into the next phase of our plan, we’re looking for a Lead Unified Communications Engineer to join us remotely or in our Bournemouth office. This is a role with great autonomy to lead and shape the UC platform with an ever increasing user base we are expecting to grow hugely over the next few years.
Why Join Us?
We know that the key to our success is the people we work with, which is why we’ve put together a benefits package that’s amongst the best in the industry. The benefits that make us stand out are:
An annual training budget of £4,000
Salary of up to 65K
30 Days holiday from day 1 (38 incl bank holidays)
High spec laptop and iPhone/Google/Samsung phone
Weekly free team breakfast or lunch if office based
The Culture
We are a fast growing tech company and it’s a great bunch of people to work with. The culture is supportive, relaxed and high-trust. We have great new offices in central Bournemouth, casual dress, a fully stocked fridge with food and drink and host events for the Bournemouth digital community.
What would I be doing?
Act as subject matter expert for the day-to-day development, management, monitoring and maintenance of our Unified Communication Platform.
Run the Platform team including line management and work distribution.
Responsible for the day to day running of the Platform adhering to SLAs.
Accountable for the capacity planning of the Platform.
Accountable for the implementation of ongoing maintenance and upgrades to the Platform.
Designing and implementation/maintenance of the platform Security Strategy.
Operational testing strategy and implementation.
Accountable for implementing policies (security, change, release, configuration, DR) and processes of Platform.
Accountable for change release & configuration management of the Platform.
And what do I need?
Good Understanding of Voice and Data Networks.
Good understanding of various Voice and Video protocols.
Good understanding of Unified Communications platforms in general.
Experience in working on various SME routers and networking gear like DrayTeks, Cisco, Netgear etc.
Experience with Linux, Broadworks, Broadsoft, Wireshark and SIP would be beneficial
Getting here
4com are based in brand new offices in the centre of Bournemouth. We are within walking distance from Bournemouth train station, bus stops and we offer a free park and ride based in Boscombe with regular shuttles to and from the office (ave. journey time is approx. 5 minutes). If you prefer to walk, jog or cycle to work we have undercover bike shelters and showers.
4Com technologies is committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment. Any job applicants will receive equal treatment in the recruitment process and 4Com technologies will not discriminate unlawfully. Recruitment processes are conducted on the basis of merit, abilities and qualifications. Any requests for feedback should be made and will be responded to in writing.

Company description
Blueskytec is an exciting, rapidly expanding, high-tech start-up focussing on industrial cyber-physical security. We develop and supply industrial cyber security hardware for the protection of complex systems (I-IoT, ICS & SCADA) across many market verticals in the Critical National Infrastructure using our Quantum derived crypto-technology. These market verticals include: Space, Land, Sea & Air, oil & gas, Renewable Energy, Smart Cities.
Job description
This role is part of the senior management team that will oversee the
design and delivery of our new range of cyber-physical products. The
Engineering Manager and Technical Manager will work together as the top
team in the business to support the Technical Director in the design,
development and delivery of the company products. As the Technical
manager you will report directly to the Technical Director, and you will
be responsible for all the technical aspects of the products that the
company produces.
Job description:
Embedded Linux expert
C/C++/Java
Dockers and Containers
Network skills - including setting up IT systems
Systems Engineering experience using Agile etc.
Windows
Experience:
You should have experience of technical management in the development of
a hardware product (not just a software or SAS project). You should be
able to lead the team through daily stand-ups, target setting and setting
packages of work in conjunction with the Engineering Manager. You should
have experience of the software development process under Linux -
including uBoot and driver setup.
You will be expected to support the Technical Director and Engineering
manager in report writing, including URD, SRD, SDD, WBS, EBS, Schedule.
Location:
The role is based in Bath at our engineering facility, but homeworking can be undertaken when deemed appropriate. The role will involve travel to visit customers & manufacturers, so a clean UK Driving Licence is required, but a car is not essential. There may be times when development is required at customer premises – in the UK & US but not for extended times.
Security
All candidates need to be eligible and willing to undergo SC level security clearance.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £55,000.00-£65,000.00 per year
COVID-19 considerations:
We are allowing staff to work from home on a temporary basis. Our aim is to gather the team together at the office in Bath by the beginning of January, but this will be kept under review.
Experience:
Software Engineering: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Work remotely:
Yes, temporarily due to COVID-19

Company Description
Are you interested in making a difference with technology? We make differences. Big ones, and small ones. Version 1 proves that IT can make a real difference to our customers’ businesses. As a recent finalist for the Microsoft Partner of the Year Data Estate Modernisation Award, we are more than just another IT services company - we are leaders in implementing and supporting Oracle, Microsoft and AWS technologies. With over 20 years’ experience, we are trusted by global brands to deliver IT solutions that drive customer success.

Our greatest strength is balance in our efforts to achieve Customer Success, Empowered People and a Strong Organisation, underpinned by a commitment to our Core Values. We believe this is what makes Version 1 different and more importantly, our employees agree; we were delighted to have been officially recognised as a Best Large Workplace in the UK, Ireland and Europe this year.

Job Description
Benefits include profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for course relevant to your role. We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events, summer party and Christmas parties!

In this current role, you will be working with a major central government department on one of several projects we are delivering.

Your main responsibilities will be:
You will be customer-facing (when we are able) and will entail liaising with customers to enhance current systems, plan and deliver projects.
The role is varied in scope, technology and can entail the development of innovative solutions in the cloud, delivering cloud migration projects, and supporting development teams with DevOps technologies (CI/CD pipelines, config management, etc.)
Documentation of solutions (e.g. configuration and setup).
Working within a project management/agile delivery methodology in a leading role as part of a wider team.
Provide effective knowledge transfer and upskilling to relevant customer personnel to ensure an appropriate level of future self-sufficiency.
Assist in the transition of projects to Version 1 Managed Services teams.

Qualifications
Essential criteria:
Experience is needed n Kubernetes(AKS), Ansible, Terraform, Docker, Linux Sys Admin (RHEL, Ubuntu, Alpine), Azure Networking, Azure Application Gateway, AzureDevOps, CI/CD and Jenkins
Demonstrable experience with the following technologies:
Microsoft Azure Platform As A Service ( PaaS ) products such as Azure SQL, AppServices, Logic Apps, Functions and other Serverless services
Understanding of Microsoft Identity and Access Management products such including Azure AD or AD B2C
Microsoft Azure Operational and Monitoring tools, including Azure Monitor, App Insights and Log Analytics
Knowledge of PowerShell, Git, ARM templates and deployment automation
Preferred criteria:
Experienced in the design and delivery of enterprise-level Highly Available solutions

Additional Information
Sayem Chowdhury
Version 1 Talent Acquisition Team
We are an equal opportunities employer and we are open to locations outside of London near an existing Version 1 site, this includes Redditch (Birmingham), Knutsford (Manchester), Edinburgh and Belfast.

VPN: between sites using IPSec as well as between users and sites.
Past experience with maintaining network configurations with version control systems.
Penetration testing experience is a plus.
Python scripting or similar.
About Broadway Technology
Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells low-latency distributed systems, primarily for use in financial applications like trading bonds, fiat currencies, and cryptocurrencies. Our software has powered the world’s most critical systems at top financial institutions and controls well over $125 trillion in business annually across five continents. Our proprietary software platform is an open, flexible, complete solution for screen and automated trading operations of any size and complexity.

Founded in 2003, Broadway has nearly 200 employees worldwide with offices in New York, Austin, London, Waterloo, Toronto and Christchurch. Our founders are industry-recognized innovators (as well as MIT and Cornell alum) with advanced CS/engineering degrees and 15+ years leading high-tech ventures.

We take a rapid, methodical approach to development; and we focus on creating solutions that solve our clients’ immediate needs, yet can evolve and scale as needs change. We believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed.

Join us today and make a difference in people's lives!

The Senior Backend Engineer is a unique opportunity and an exciting time to join a pioneering company at a critical time in its growth. LivaNova is a global medical technology company built on nearly five decades of experience and a relentless commitment to improving the lives of patients around the world. Our disruptive technologies and breakthrough treatments provide meaningful solutions for the benefit of patients, healthcare professionals, and healthcare systems.
We are a global leader in cardiovascular solutions with an established leadership position in heart-lung machines and recognition as the world’s #1 cardiopulmonary bypass company. Plus, as a global leader in neuromodulation and as pioneers of the VNS (Vagus Nerve Stimulation) Therapy® system, we continue to advance medical device solutions for people affected by treatment-resistant epilepsy, depression, heart failure, and other chronic disorders.
About Epsy Health
Epsy is a leading digital health platform empowering patients, caregivers and healthcare providers: we give the world a better way to live with seizures and epilepsy.
Come work with us and build something that matters – we provide patients and physicians with tools and insights that help to accelerate the pathway towards better outcomes. We do this by bringing together the best people, the latest technologies, user-centric designs and state-of-the-art data analysis.
We are solving a large problem as epilepsy affects more than 65 million people and is one of the most common neurological diseases.
We operate as an independent startup within LivaNova. This gives us unique advantages: we move fast and drive growth, while we benefit from the corporate umbrella for excellent funding and resources. Epsy Health is headquartered in London (UK) and Houston (Texas, USA), and our team has fully embraced remote work for the long-term.
We’re looking for skilled and ambitious developers which are:
genuinely interested– motivated, as well as open to change and new challenges
eager to cooperate – able to work in a group in order to achieve collective goals
strive towards professionalism – focus on the highest level of their performance
effective – able to handle complications and take advantage of beneficial circumstances
product and customer oriented – care about long-lasting and rewarding relationships, are able to listen to and meet the expectations of our users
Your role :
work as a member of the team at every stage of software development life cycle - being capable of designing solutions, writing and testing application code and finally manage the deployment (with automated pipeline)
research and innovate during your day to day work – gather and share knowledge
provide input and influence discussions around best practices and new technologies, helping us to develop an effective basis for future developments
You will work on:
modern microservice architecture fully build on AWS stack with dozen of components like EventBridge, API Gateway, DynamoDB, Cognito, Amplify and AppSync etc.
data pipeline for gathering and processing high volume of the data collected from global network of IoT sensors – including customer electronics
our Machine Learning platform implementation, build together with our Data Science engineers
global infrastructure managed with terraform and CloudFormation
our high performance internal and external APIs build with Serverless, Flask and Amplify frameworks
Required Skills and Experience :
5+ years of Python experience, building API powered solutions
good understanding of microservice architecture
experience with at least few common Python frameworks and libraries (flask, pyramid, bottle, celery, tornado, pandas...)
familiarity with API gateways, configuration, rate limiting
experience with client-server architecture using REST and GraphQL protocols
good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
building, testing and deploying applications using Docker container on AWS ECS platform
building and deploying cloud native solution with AWS using SQS, SNS, EventBridge, Kinesis, API Gateway, Cognito just to name a few
understanding of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) tools and systems (ideally if you can participate in continuous improvement of our delivery pipeline)
Desirable Skills and Experience :
managing AWS with infrastructure as code using terraform and CloudFormation
building and deploying services with Serverless framework (both APIs and async services)
multi-region, geo-distributed applications with performance, privacy and compliance management
web application security best practices (OWASP), nice to see some security testing experience
other backend / data processing languages knowledge – Node.JS, TypeScript, PHP, GO, R
experience with designing and building distributed, event based solutions using message brokers and enterprise integration patters
experience in big data processing from set of IoT devices using AWS tech stack
If you would like to see what we use to power our amazing platform please visit: https://stackshare.io/epsy-health/epsy-health
Why work for Epsy?
Join our growing team of motivated and innovative individuals. Our friendly team encompasses experienced designers, app developers, product managers, marketeers, customer success managers and data analysts. At Epsy we pride ourselves on our all-team collaborative approach and actively encourage learning, whether it be in your speciality or simply an area you might like to learn about (examples include talks about Hedge Fund management and wine!). If you are looking to develop as a candidate in a supportive team who actively want to better the lives of millions of people, then Epsy is the place for you.

Engaging and multicultural work environment

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
LivaNova values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.
Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, color, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.
Background Checks at LivaNova:
Upon successful completion of the hiring process an offer may be extended. Please note, LivaNova reserves the right to conduct background investigations and/or reference checks on all its potential employees, where permitted by local legislation. This offer therefore, is contingent upon a clearance of such a background investigation and/or reference check, and can be rescinded, where permitted by local legislation, based upon data received in the background check and/or refusal to cooperate with or any attempt to affect the results of this check. This process is not currently valid in Germany.
Notice to third party agencies:
Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Process Engineer
Salary Up to 32000 + Bonus + superb benefits
Wiltshire
This highly successful international organisation who manufacture, engineer and install specialist products and equipment, are seeking to recruit a Process Engineer to support their production team at their long-established site based in Wiltshire.
Their extensive experience crosses all markets from telco, broadband and wireless to electric utility, OEM enterprise and private networks.
Responsibilities
As a Process Engineer you will be responsible for -
· To support production team in manufacturing at the Wiltshire site.
· Process Engineering for all manufacturing processes related to cable production.
· Continuous Improvement Activities based on the assigned Design Projects and development activities.
· Training of shop floor operatives on new equipment, processes and procedures.
· Implementation and maintenance of Environmental Health and Safety Policies.
· Maintaining kpi’s for the Process Engineering area.
· Instruct and support the production staff and set the standard for the level of work by example.
· On rota provide support on a call-out basis after normal hours of work to resolve process issues.
Qualifications and Experience
· Qualified to minimum degree level in a mechanical or manufacturing engineering related discipline.
· Minimum of 5 years shop floor experience in a manufacturing environment operating Lean manufacturing methodologies – (Kaizen, 5S, SMED, JIT, kanban etc.).
· Extrusion processing and process troubleshooting – essential – at least 2 years’ experience.
· Excellent communication skills. Able to present complex information at all levels. Computer literate and fully conversant with Microsoft Office components.
· Experience of working within ISO9000 Environment preferred and ISO14001 and/or ISO18001 an advantage
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly respected, well established and successful international manufacturer who are undergoing substantial capital investment, and who can offer long-term personal and career progression.

Job Description:
QVC is so much more than a retailer. It’s a broadcast network. It’s an ecommerce leader. And it’s a great place to work! Come discover why QVC is like no other business in the world. Be part of a team that’s reimagining shopping, entertainment and social as one.
Job Description Details
QVC are looking at building a strong advanced analytics team across our international markets and one of these Key roles is The Data Engineer.
Your main responsibilities:
Creating data models, data pipelines, providing the right format and structure for the use case solutions
Perform data cleansing and feature engineering
Participate in early data modeling and testing for use case development
Identify relevant data sets by researching, interacting with business stakeholders
Collaborate extensively and frequently with data scientists and IT leadership
Ensure that data science team has access to the required data sets
Own the structural elements of data, e.g., data storage, data piping
Provide technical support related to data structures, data models and meta data management
Participate in early data modeling and testing for use case development, provide input on how to improve proposed solutions and implement necessary changes
Extract relevant data to solve analytical problems; ensure Data Scientist team has the required data
Interact with the business to understand all data requirements to develop business insights and translate them into data structures and data models
Collaborate extensively and frequently with data scientists and IT leadership
Liaise with IT on the infrastructure, data pipelines, and productionalization of models
Document data, data structure, and data models
Research best practices, technologies, tools, and trends
The ideal candidate will have:
A Master's degree (preferably with PhD) in computer science, statistics or another quantitative discipline
Expertise in advanced data management systems (such as Spark, Hadoop, Oracle DB, MySQL, PostGresQL, SQL Server, etc.)
Profound expertise in data modelling and structuring
Advanced SQL knowledge as well as knowledge of the limitations of SQL and where alternative tools and programming languages should be used
Knowledge of ETL tools and cloud technology stacks (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience in dealing with large amounts of data
Very good knowledge of at least one scripting language Python (preferred), R and also knowledge of container platforms such as Docker
Very good knowledge of data structures, data models and large data volumes
A detailed working method and the ability to critically analyse existing and new methods as well as to think conceptually
The competence to simplify work processes and to communicate complex concepts in an understandable way
Strong interpersonal, written and communication skills in (German- advantageous) and English
ability to work in a team
IND_HP
About Qurate Retail Group
Qurate Retail Group comprises seven leading retail brands — QVC, HSN, zulily, Ballard Designs, Frontgate, Garnet Hill, and Grandin Road — all dedicated to providing a ‘third way to shop,’ beyond transactional ecommerce or traditional brick-and-mortar stores. Globally, Qurate Retail Group is #1 in video commerce, reaching approximately 370 million homes worldwide via 16 television networks and multiple ecommerce sites, social pages, mobile apps, print catalogs, and in-store destinations. Qurate Retail Group is #3 in ecommerce in North America and #3 in mobile commerce in the U.S. (according to Internet Retailer). Qurate Retail Group combines the best of retail, media and social to curate products, experiences, conversations and communities for millions of highly discerning shoppers - bringing joy, inspiration and humanity to shopping. Qurate Retail Group also curates large audiences, across multiple platforms, for thousands of brand vendors. Headquartered in West Chester, Pa., Qurate Retail Group has 27,000 team members in the U.S., the U.K., Germany, Japan, Italy, France, Poland and China. For more information, visit www.qurateretailgroup.com. Qurate Retail, Inc. (NASDAQ: QRTEA, QRTEB) includes the Qurate Retail Group portfolio of brands as well as other minority investments.
EEO

In order to ensure reasonable accommodations for individuals pursuant to applicable law, individuals that require accommodation in the job application process for a posted position may contact us at CareersUS@QVC.com for assistance.

Build a meaningful career
At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 6,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.

LifeWorks
LifeWorks supports the total health and well-being of over 35 million lives worldwide with our clinical expertise, global presence and digital well-being platform, LifeWorks by Morneau Shepell. We empower healthier, happier, and more productive employees by combining our award-winning Employee Assistance Program with proactive wellness solutions in a digital ecosystem that helps them prevent and manage issues and concerns about family, health, life, money, and work.
As a Global Employee Engagement Platform serving tens of thousands of companies and millions of employees worldwide, LifeWorks by Morneau Shepell uses innovative technology and mobile-first user experience to deliver a Total Wellbeing Solution that people and companies - such as Aviva, Burberry, Walgreens, Expedia, Intel and Nestlé Canada - love to use.
Morneau Shepell employees have access to the same high-quality well-being support and resources provided to our customers. We pride ourselves on providing a work environment that inspires innovation, connection and collaboration while also supporting your growth and development both personally and professionally. We value difference-makers, and individuals and teams who bring high energy, passion, and a relentless commitment to excellence to their roles.

Summary
As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll be working with our talented team on an AWS to evolve and improve a framework for multi-region architecture, global applications deployment, and automation optimization.
You will have the opportunity to build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations; and will troubleshoot and resolve issues in our development, test and production environments.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for provisioning services on AWS, inventory management and decommissioning of environments.
Manage all code deployments and infrastructure changes to deployment environments in a controlled and auditable manner.
Provide and maintain logging and monitoring systems, automate dashboard creation and set up alerting.
Collaborate with internal and external, technical and non-technical teams to build and support development platforms.
Work with relevant teams to setup best practices with the ability to define operational processes, implement DevOps, SRE, deployment checklists and more.
Participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle as part of a feature team.
Collaborate with relevant teams to define and update LifeWorks data flow, security improvements, identify high risk areas and development feasible mitigating solutions.
Support client efforts to integrate to the platform by providing technical subject matter expertise.

Succeeding as a DevOps Engineer will require the core qualifications and skills:
BSc in Computer Science or degree in relevant field.
Ideally, previous software development experience.
Good knowledge of traditional Ops areas of expertise, including Linux, Networking, VPNs.
Experience with configuration management tools (Ansible or similar).
Knowledge of software design patterns (microservices, APIs, messaging, distributed architecture).
Experience designing, developing and evolving multi-region architecture, and deployment of business software at scale in cloud.
Over 4 years’ experience of using AWS in production; familiarity with core services such as S3, EC2, ELB, ASG, Lambda, RDS; Container ecosystem experience: Docker, ECS and EKS.
Experience with IaC tools, including Terraform and CloudFormation.
5-10 years’ IT industry experience as a software delivery engineer, manager, system development engineer or developer support engineer.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL DB.
2+ years’ experience with event-driven architecture or microservices.
2+ years’ hands-on experience with Serverless technologies or working with technologies such as Lambda, API Gateway, SNS, SQS, MQ and/or Step Functions.
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments, such as large enterprises and start-ups.
Experience working within the software development or Internet industries is highly desired.
Experience using logging and monitoring tools, such as DataDog, or similar.
Experience with Azure is desirable.

INDSS
Job Grade: MS3
Fulfilling work that matters
Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours.
We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.
We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.
At Morneau Shepell, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. We are excited to connect with you virtually, and look forward to receiving your application.

Job Summary
We are passionate technologists who believe in making a difference to the lives of those living in emerging markets. We aim to change the landscape of finance and remittance.
Our development team is a group of skilled self-reliant engineers that have the ability to work together to solve complex problems and provide simple solutions for our customers.
We are looking for a Technical Lead to join our rapidly growing team in one of our offices. This role is open to candidates in either London, Dakar, Lagos and Nairobi and the post holder will report to the Software Engineering Manager.
The post holder will work remotely
How your skills and passion will come to life at AZA
Working closely with the CTO and Engineering Managers to aid with architecture decisions for the application and supporting infrastructure.
Innovate, develop, maintain and contribute to the existing AZA codebase and its associated applications.
Mentor, train and support engineers in order to develop our in-house engineering skills.
Improve our overall system development process via process improvements.
Optimise application performance and test coverage.
Deliver presentations demonstrating application feature delivery.
Work with our product team to refine product requirements.
Feasibility and effort estimations.
Provide support to our customers including triaging any issues.
Requirements
What we are looking for
Seasoned professional with at least 10 years of experience in software engineering.
Preferably someone who has worked as a Technical Lead for 3-5 years in a financial ecosystem or Fin-tech or financial institution.
Minimum 3 years of providing leadership to the team.
Significant experience in a similar role
Good knowledge of working with Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
Working knowledge of Javascript specifically React and JQuery.
Good knowledge of using automated testing frameworks such as RSpec and Cypress.
Good knowledge of source control using Git.
Familiarity with the agile development methodology specifically Scrum.
Familiarity with deploying and managing applications on the cloud.
Good knowledge of software deployment tooling and orchestration.
Good knowledge of databases systems, especially PostgreSQL.
Confidence in refactoring and working with both new and existing codebases.
A strong and flexible work ethic.
Excellent communication skills.
Desired
Preference to participate in pair-programming and using GitHub pull requests to review code of others.
Familiarity with container frameworks, especially Docker and Kubernetes.
Benefits
Compensation
A competitive salary and benefits package.
Global / regional network / exposure in FinTech / Blockchain industry.
One of the hottest, fastest scaling startups in Africa.
Casual work environment.
Great work -life balance.
We value autonomy.
Opportunity for growth for all employees.
Opportunity to work hard and play hard.
…… and more!!

Description
We are seeking to recruit a Principal Fire Safety Design Engineer to join our Rail building services team based in London. Experience in delivering building services projects within rail is a must.

About Arcadis:


At Arcadis, we never lose sight of what’s most important. Because look beyond our projects and programmes and you’ll see it’s about human stories. From remaking public spaces that bring people together, to making cities easier to navigate, we’re focused on making an impact where it matters most – and improving quality of life.

It’s a big challenge. And why we need people committed to bringing their best, who deliver on their promises. People who value different perspectives, build sustainable relationships and dare to shape the future. People who seize the experiences available to transform their world – and the world around them.


It’s a shared goal amongst 27,000 Arcadians. And one we can only achieve by working together and applying our skills and expertise across design, consultancy, engineering, project and management services. It’s how we’ll find solutions to our clients’ most complex challenges. And how we’ll deliver exceptional results, today and tomorrow.

About The Role:


Reporting to the Associate Director, you will provide the technical solution for assigned projects ensuring successful delivery. As we operate in such a diverse marketplace, we can safely say that you will gain an experience of working on a wide and varied portfolio of projects which will enhance your skills and test your technical knowledge.

You will be responsible for assisting in the delivery of project to meet budget, time-frame and quality targets, meeting or exceeding client expectations, promoting and marketing all facets of Arcadis’ services during interfaces with clients and other sectors and disciplines, contributing towards the achievement of the divisional business plan and to build networks within the industry.

We will ensure that we offer personal development which will allow you to progress your career and give you the best possible chance of success.

Responsibilities:
To undertake fire system design on UK and international projects with a good understanding of regulatory requirements and relevant standards
Delivery of allocated technical assignments including authoring Fire Strategy, Fire System design including detection, alarm and hydrant
To undertake consultancy assignments and providing advisory support to Clients and contribute to formulation of design concepts and approaches.
To undertake design checks and reviews before issue
Provide technical leadership to the assigned project/s
Maintain good relationships with client’s key representative, and contribute to the marketing/networking of the company to potential customers
Contribute to the overall team development and growth through strategic inputs, bringing market intelligence, skill development, mentoring and bringing required talent
Design management, team leadership / mentoring and client relationship skills
Rise/promote the level of technical excellence relating to fire engineering within the team
Ensure consistent high-quality design delivery
Help generate repeat business from both internal and external client
Cross sale Arcadis wide capabilities to the clients
Essential Experience:
Extensive fire safety design experience in design consultancy environment
Proven experience in authoring Fire Strategy including balance recommendation of passive and active provisions to achieve compliant and safe solution
Hand-on experience and knowledge of Fire System design including detection, alarm and Fire hydrant. The sprinkler and gaseous system design experience will be added advantage
Good understanding of the legislations (incl FSO, Building Regulations etc), London Underground, Network Rail and British Standard including BS EN 9999, BS 5839, BS 5306, BS EN 12845, etc
Experience in working with the rail environment is essential. Aviation and data centre experience will be added advantage
Be a competent user of office IT and design tools i.e. NBS/NES, AECOSim, Revit etc
Stakeholder management skills and a can-do attitude
Able to make decisions, act on own initiative and operate in proactive way
Capable of working under pressure and on several projects simultaneously
Experience of working in a multidisciplinary environment and bring value from assimilated wider knowledge of other disciplines
Able to see wider picture outside own discipline in project and business context, is essential
Financial awareness is essential for the role
Good report writing skills, experience of making presentations to and attending meetings with clients is essential
Able to understand and express technical concepts in written and verbal language
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Be willing to be mobile, travel within the UK and abroad for project related work when required
Why Arcadis?


At Arcadis, you’ll have the opportunity to build the career that’s right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations, their own career goals. And, as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business, it’s why we’ll take the time to listen, to understand what you want from your time here, and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions.
Wherever you join us, you can look forward to a competitive reward package that includes an attractive starting salary, opportunities for career development and being part of a sociable community. We have a performance-related bonus scheme and an employee recognition scheme. Other beneﬁts include membership fees to join your relevant professional body, employer contribution pension scheme, ﬂexible working and a flexible holiday scheme.

We believe that by working together diverse people with different experiences develop the most innovative ideas. Equality, diversity and inclusion is at the heart of how we improve quality of life and we work closely with our people across six ED&I Workstreams: Age, Disability, Faith, Gender, LGBT+ and Race. A diverse and skilled workforce is essential to our success.

Qualifications
Qualifications:
BEng/BSc Degree qualified in Fire / Electrical / Mechanical / Building Services Engineering; MEng / MSc preferred
Chartered Engineer (CEng)

At Gearset, we build a cutting-edge DevOps solution for the millions of developers building applications on Salesforce, the world's biggest enterprise PaaS. In only a few years Gearset has become the DevOps solution of choice for some of the world's biggest companies, including IBM, McKesson, and even Salesforce themselves.

As a Gearset DevOps Engineer you will work collaboratively using a pragmatically-chosen tech stack (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, .NET) to help Gearset run a scalable, secure and reliable service, and enable development of the solution to scale with the growth of the company. We're proud of the strong DevOps focus that we've had since starting the company but we know there is so much more that we can do to help deliver Gearset to ever larger audiences.

Joining the team you'll contribute to building out our multi-tenant infrastructure from a single region to multiple across the globe, help scale for an ever growing user base, and support a team developing an increasingly sophisticated web app utilising more and more of the power of AWS. Throughout Gearset we believe to our core in delivering value as early and as often as possibly. You'll be involved in building and maintaining the automation that allows us to do things such as release the product to our users multiple times per day, and improving how we operate across the board.
You'll be a good fit if you:
Have 5+ year of experience working in a similar role
Have in-depth practical experience working on AWS (VPC networking and security, IAM, EC2, Postgres RDS, S3, EKS)
Are well-versed in working on production infrastructure which requires maintenance with (little to) no downtime regardless of the complexity of the task
Have good knowledge of Linux
Previously have worked with infrastructure-as-code and immutable builds
Are passionate about getting your hands dirty in both supporting a growing development organization and maturing our ops
Enjoy working with a collaborative team of varied disciplines, including developers, designers, marketers and salespeople
Our ideal candidate will have experience with:
Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS EKS
Terraform
.NET/C#
Postgres
Working on a hosted, multi-tenant product
Working in an agile development team with a focus on delivering value early
Benefits:
You'll work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, in our Cambridge office
Salary is £40k - £60k, depending on experience
Bupa health care
Flexible working hours
Free lunch
Discounted gym membership, etc.

Job Description
We currently have great opportunity for a Field Service Engineer to join us and assist in our ongoing expansion in the Luton, Bedfordshire area.
About the Company
Impact are the sole UK and Ireland distributor for some of the world’s leading Materials Handling brands including Cat Lift Trucks and Konecranes heavy duty Lift trucks and provide materials handling solutions to our customers via our extensive network of local Depots.
Our wide customer base covers all market sectors and are reliant on the equipment we provide to move their products 24/7. Service Support is therefore a vital aspect of our customers’ supply chain so it’s no overstatement to say that our Service Engineers are a valued and key part of our business.
As a Field Service Engineer your key duties will include:
Carry out routine maintenance and repairs to all machines.
Carry out routine maintenance; quote all service/repairs in conjunction with the Service Manager/Supervisor.
Ensure fork lift trucks are serviced to the standards as directed by the manufacturers’ recommendations.
Be proactive when maintaining trucks ensuring that all repairs are carried out in a safe, timely and cost effective manner.
Fault find machinery on customer’s site and work with the Service Coordinator to resolve the issue safely, and to a high standard.
Organise and install all parts for customers and liaise with Service Control Department
Work without supervision by using your own initiative for the majority of the time, in a safe manner as laid down by the Health and Safety at Work Act, advising your Manager if you need assistance.
Ensure that all Service Reports (and supporting documentation) are completed correctly and sent into the Service Office immediately.
Requirements and Qualifications
Ideally you will have a formal qualification such as an NVQ Level 3 or City & Guilds and/or a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a Service Engineer in the Forklift Industry.
Applications are also welcomed from engineers with a Plant, HGV, Agricultural, Automotive background.
If you have a Military background a minimum of 3 years experience as a Vehicle Mechanic
Good communication skills with a customer focused approach
Highly organised, punctual with flexible time management skills
Benefits
Salary of £23,000 - £28,000 dependent on experience + Overtime
40 Hours per week (Monday to Friday 08.00am to 4.30pm)
23 days Holiday (increasing with service) + Bank Holidays
Company Pension Scheme
Life Assurance Cover
Health Cash Plan

Job Title: Lift Engineer (Service, Call Out & Repairs) Located in the Crawley Area
Job Description:
RJ Lift Services Ltd is one of the top UK Leading Independent Lift Company that specialise in all aspects of lifts, including servicing, repairs, refurbishments and new installations. We have been established over 30’ Years and our growth is due to our highly motivated, courteous, professional and well trained personnel, which all have an emphasis on exceptional customer service.
Our customer network is vast and diverse and we are looking for Service Engineers’ in the Crawley Area with the passion and ambition to join our well-respected Company. This role would suit someone open to develop their skills further within the industry.
Customer Service is Paramount to our Business. We're therefore looking for applicants with a positive attitude, wanting to develop relationships with our customer base and able to deliver an excellent customer journey.
What we are looking for:
Self-motivated organised Service Engineer, with the willingness to learn.
An NVQ 3 in Lift Servicing, Engineering & Maintenance or J-Module equivalent qualifications.
At least 3 years’ experience in the routine maintenance and servicing in Lifts.
A full UK driving license.
The Role, (Main Duties and Responsibilities):
Provide outstanding customer service and communication skills
Able to carry out Service Maintenance and minor repairs in a safe, timely and thoughtful manner to ensure equipment functionality and efficiency.
Self-motivated with excellent time management
Must be flexible and able to work to an out of hours call out schedule (typically 1 in 4/5 weeks)
Carry out and organise allocated repairs tasks.
Ability to carry out minor to major repairs at site.
Attend breakdowns and rectify faults with minimal assistance (we offer internal 24 hour support)
Good technical reporting and communication skills
The salary and package for this role offered includes;
Flexible working; Monday to Friday. Typically shifts of 8am to 4 pm. Paid Door to Door.
Paid 37.50 per week, with 30 mins lunch breaks.
All travel time paid (we pay door to door).
Company Phone.
Unlimited overtime opportunity and rates of pay available.
23 days’ annual leave plus all UK Public Bank Holidays.
Internal training opportunities provided at the company’s own training facility.
Company pension scheme.
Discounted Gym Membership.
Company vehicle which may with permission be used for personal use.
A company fuel card to cover travel expenses.
Ringo, Congestion Fees and Parking Apps – paid for by the Company
Company Trade Cards
Paid Annual Events.
Much, much more…
If you are an experienced and fully qualified Lift Engineer, who is willing to travel for the right role and remuneration package, please apply accordingly with your up to date CV.

Job Description:
About the business
It’s no secret that we are a rapidly expanding population and that we need to preserve our food production systems, whilst reducing our environmental impact. At Better Origin, we have developed insect rearing and processing systems to convert our organic waste into insect biomass, an alternative protein source that is highly nutritious yet has a low environmental impact. Feeding insects to livestock improves their health and welfare, resulting in happier and more sustainably farmed animals.
Job summary
We’re looking for hard-working, passionate individuals who love to drive change, want to drive positive impact, and thrive in a start-up environment to join us in Cambridge and help us deliver the best possible insect farming solutions. This specific role will be fundamental in the success of our flagship product, the Better Origin X1 modular insect mini-farm.
Better Origin is offering the right candidate a full-time role, focused predominantly on designing, managing and improving the control systems of our insect mini farms located throughout the UK. You will have the opportunity to take on a role within the Engineering Team, supporting and enabling the technical success of the Better Origin insect mini-farms. You will work with, and be supported by a highly innovative passionate team.
Candidate duties
You will take on ownership for the automated insect facility control system design, programming, and its maintenance
Instrumentation and Sensor selection that goes into X1s
Updating and developing design documentation, user support manuals, troubleshooting guides
Providing support to customers, mostly remotely but on-site visits will be required from time-to-time
Proactively identify and implement improvements to the control system
Innovate and drive simplification and improvement agenda
Work within the broader Engineering team in delivering enabling insect farming and processing technologies
Essential Experience/Skills/Qualifications:
Degree level qualification within a relevant engineering discipline
3-5 years experience in an automation or control systems engineering role
Experience of working with and programming PLC-based systems (Siemens, Allen Bradley, Eaton)
Knowledge of process instrumentation and sensor selection
Experience of working with HV/LV electrical systems, electrical system design
Knowledge and understanding of control system networking over protocols such as Modbus, Profinet, TCIP/IP
Knowledge and understanding of process safety system design using instrumentation and control, along with relevant standards such as IEC 61508 & 61511
Full driving license & access to a vehicle (occasional on-site visits)
Desirable Experience/Skills/Qualifications:
Hands on experience working with and programming Siemens S7 PLCs in the TIA Portal environment
Hands on practical experience with instrumentation, electrical and control system installation
Experience in agricultural, feed/food processing and/or manufacturing sectors
Experience of more general software programming (C, C++, Java, Python etc)
Experience in a role developing concepts into prototypes and working solutions is desirable
Food waste, animal welfare, food security, climate change – there are so many challenges facing our planet. But there is a solution; the solution is nature and using insects to fix the broken food system, and Better Origin is bringing that solution to market.
Better Origin is an innovative and exciting Cambridge-based SME working to improve our food chains.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:
Monday to Friday

driving (Required)

Must be flexible
