Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Network Engineers at Facebook are hybrid software/network engineers who ensure that Facebook's network and related services run smoothly and have the capacity for future growth. Data Analytics, network (re)design, and automation are keys to meeting our demands; you will be responsible for conceiving, developing, and deploying software and network systems and tools that improve reliability and efficiency in our global network. Do you want to work on one of the most dynamic, fast-paced networks in the world? Do you want to develop innovative solutions to our challenges and ship them into production? Then a role on one of our network engineering teams is for you!Competitive Salary including the following benefits apply:* Medical* Dental* Vision* Pension* Life assurance* Childcare* Gym* Transport* Laundry* Posted: 21st August 2020* Closing date: 18th September 2020
Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex networks and systems in the world
Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents
(Re)Design, deploy, manage and maintain multi-vendor, multi-protocol data center, backbone and edge networks
Define and develop optimized network monitoring systems
Design and deploy new network and tooling architectures
Analyze data to diagnose and identify root causes to network issues
Partner alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around - the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by billions of users all around the world
Engineering degree, or a related technical discipline or equivalent experience
Experience coding in higher-level languages (e.g., Python, C++, Go, etc.)
Experience in configuration and maintenance of network devices and NMS systems, or applications such as web servers, load balancers, relational databases, storage systems and messaging systems
Experience learning software, frameworks and APIs
Experience developing and understanding network device configuration for at least one vendor (Juniper, Cisco, Arista, Brocade, Ciena, Infinera, Linux, etc.)
Experience understanding and mitigating network hardware and topology failures
BS or MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Expert knowledge of TCP/IP and IPv6
Understanding of routing and switching - hardware design and knowledge of forwarding and data planes
Understanding and development of Load Balancing and Peering in CDN Architectures
Protocol experience in one or more of BGP, MPLS, ISIS or similar routing protocols - understanding of typical configurations and performance
Working knowledge of ROADM, coherent transponders and long-haul operation optical networks
Working knowledge of offensive or defensive security solutions for systems and networking
Understanding and execution of data modeling and system performance analytics
Understanding operations research, combinatorial optimization, stochastic optimization, machine learning, queuing theory, probability theory

Job Description

Role Summary

At Citadel Securities, a leading global market maker, our team of Network Engineers are responsible for the design, administration and troubleshooting of global network infrastructures in a fast paced, latency-sensitive environment.

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Sydney, Austin

Objectives
Design, engineer, and troubleshoot for the global network infrastructure in an aggressive, latency-sensitive environment
Provide technical expertise to both internal and external users
Work closely with other team members to build best in class technology platforms
Facilitate communication and collaboration between business users and peer technology teams
Skills and Preferred Qualifications
Strong knowledge troubleshooting Layer 1, Layer 2 and Layer 3 issues
Knowledge of TCP/IP, OSPF, BGP, MSDP, PIM (SM and DM) protocols
Experience with Cisco (Routing, L3 and L2 switching, Firewalling (FWSM, PIX and ASA) and VPN (Site-to-Site IPSec)
Experience with provisioning and maintenance of Coarse and Dense Wave Division Multiplexing (DWDM)
Experience setting up co-location and working with co-location providers
CCNP certification or better
Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Engineering or equivalent experience
Strong written and verbal communications skills
About Citadel Securities


Citadel Securities is a leading global market maker across a broad array of fixed income and equity securities. Our world-class capabilities position us to meet the liquidity demands of our diverse group of institutional clients in all market conditions. In partnering with us, our clients, including asset managers, banks, broker-dealers, hedge funds, government agencies and public pension programs are able to gain a powerful trading advantage and are better positioned to meet their investment goals.

The team makes its mark every day from our offices around the world: Chicago, New York, London, Hong Kong, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Dublin.

QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Why don’t you join some of the world’s finest scientific and technical minds and help us make tomorrow work today?

Job description/Person specification
QinetiQ are currently in the process of modernising and automating the monitoring of service and machine data using Splunk IT Service Intelligence. We are looking for an individual to provide Splunk Systems Engineering and Administration expertise, supporting the monitoring of QinetiQ's information and business services.

Key Accountabilities

Internal and external point of contact for the opportunity on all technical/engineering aspects and assurance for Splunk
Devising of solution concepts which capture the problem to be solved and/or essential features of the outline solution
Engaging with customers, other stakeholders, suppliers, and other technical disciplines to help develop an appropriate understanding of the problem and to form the basis of viable solutions
To contribution to the wider QinetiQ digital transformation strategy in Analytics, Military Intelligence and AI
Point of escalation from the tier 2 support function for Splunk related issues
Sharing of knowledge and experience
Supporting of DevOps processes and promotion of Agile ways of working
Applying security measures as required
Key Capabilities/Knowledge

Administration of an Enterprise Level distributed Splunk implementation. i.e. Search Head and Indexer Clustering.
Onboarding a wide data sources. need to be able to write your own TA’s for custom data feeds and make them CIM compliant as well as be confident in tweaking Splunkbase TA's.
Splunk IT Service Intelligence Administration. Design and Creation of services and their associated KPI, alerts and correlation searches.
Linux Centos/Redhat for Splunk Administration.
General IT systems engineering design and implementation. Need to have a decent overall understanding of Enterprise IT systems. Networks, Platforms, Infrastructure.
Ability to manage and resolve complex issues relating to Splunk capability.
Able to communicate effectively, think creatively and working collaboratively with the wider IT Team.
Strong core splunk skills. Searching, Reporting, Alerting, making dashboards etc.
Experience & Qualifications
Security Clearance at a minimum of SC.
ITIL v3.0 Framework Certificate or equivalent experience of an ITIL Service Management Implementation.
Knowledge of ISO 27001.
Working with adaptive thresholds, correlation searches, metrics and metrics analysis, alerting and such.
Splunk Enterprise Security operation and management
Business Systems Services and Requirements. I.e. non IT Data, not all pie charts are about hard drives.
Experience in working in agile teams, DevOps environments and processes
Automation processes, systems and tools like Ansible.
Modern documentation practises.
Location: Farnborough, Hampshire, South East England, England

Job Description:
Gamesys Group is one of the world's leading gaming operators, with millions of players and 1300+ employees. We believe passionately in what we do. Quite simply, we craft entertainment with care, building trusted brands and creating great experiences that always put the player first.

Our award-winning brands – including Virgin, Jackpotjoy, Monopoly, Heart and Vera&John – are some of the best known in the industry. Join us and you'll be joining a big, international group with some great brands and an exciting future. You'll feel part of one global family, working with smart people, and delivering a great experience for our players. There's one thing we expect from you, over and above everything else. Be yourself. One of the values in our DNA is 'stay wonderfully weird' – and that applies to all of us.

We are looking to hire an experienced Senior Network Engineer to help manage and maintain our company's enterprise network. Reporting to the Enterprise Infrastructure Manager you will be working as part of a team of 10 Engineers responsible for all the aspects of Corporate IT Infrastructure. This will include networking, servers, virtualisation, storage, applications, SaaS and PaaS. As a Senior Network Engineer, you will be focused on networking. You will be driving projects, handle advanced support issues and mentor Junior Engineering staff. It is expected that you will take technical ownership of the corporate network infrastructure shortly after joining.

Key responsibilities:
Technical ownership of company's back-office network that include datacenter, offices, PaaS, user VPN, etc.
Design new solutions and drive improvements to the existing ones.
Manage day to day network administration and act as a last level of escalations in the networking domain.
Oversee and work with junior network engineers to deliver projects in a timely manner.
Proactive monitoring of all the network infrastructure
As a part of wider Infrastructure team, collaborate, work on BAU and projects that sometimes may be outside of the networking domain.
Manage lifecycle of network equipment.
Research, develop and implement new technology initiatives.
Actively participate in the decision process for the introduction of new systems and infrastructure related projects.
Mentoring more junior members of the team.
Liaising with other teams within Group IT for cross functional collaboration and solution delivery.
Communicate with users when needed
Key Skills:
At least 5 years of experience as an Architect/Senior engineer level in a mid-size organisation, being technically responsible for the network in a mid-size or large organisation.
Experience in leading and delivering successful network projects in an enterprise environment of 500+ users
Technologies:
PaloAlto firewalls
Panorama
Juniper switches and SRX
Cisco firewalls and switches
Checkpoint firewalls
Meraki Wi-Fi.
Experience in designing and implementation of highly available solutions is a must.
Experience with networking in one of the PaaS is desired.
Experience with Splunk is desired.
Very strong understanding of Cyber Security (beyond networking)
Excellent knowledge of network management practices and procedures, including understanding of "why" and the ability to drive change to get to a higher maturity level
Systems Administration experience (Windows / Linux) would be desirable
Excellent communication skills - analytical and direct when communicating with stakeholders
Prior experience in mentoring junior members as well as managing small-mid sized teams
Strong organisational and planning skills, be driven and result oriented.
Benefits:

We believe this process works both ways, so what can we do for you?

We offer some of the most competitive benefits in the market including continued personal growth, career development plans and performance bonus. We also believe in providing an environment where employees can flourish – you'll be working in a very modern work environment – and we will make sure you will also have enough time to unwind with our monthly massages, office events and team-building activities.

This is Gamesys Group and we're here to make gaming everything it should be. You'll have fun making fun every day, and that's a promise.

Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly's edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers' applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly's customers include many of the world's most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.

We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.

Staff Network Engineer

Members of Fastly's Network Operations (NetOps) team operate and help build the platform that makes up over 100 Tbps of connected global capacity spanning across more than 70 points of presence. You are responsible for an extensive global network that serves a significant proportion of the content delivered to internet consumers across the planet, with customers ranging from online media streaming services, to e-commerce, to open source projects, nonprofits and more. We take this responsibility seriously!

We're looking to add Network Engineers that possess extensive knowledge of how global networks function at scale, and who carry personal pride and desire to work on a critical platform that directly contributes to making the internet better.

We want folks to bring their expertise and opinions to help craft the future of Fastly's network.

What You'll Do
Operate and maintain a continually growing global network footprint
Work multi-functionally with teams in support of accurate rapid expansion to provide resiliency and stability to our global network
Partner in the development and iteration of tools and automation systems that improve how we operate the network
Mentor other specialists and internal teams on the complexities of global routing in an anycast-heavy environment across multiple interconnect partners and peers
Respond to and lead significant traffic events, of both the legitimate and nefarious kind, regional or global in nature, scheduled and unscheduled, using techniques grounded in routing and DNS expertise in support of automation systems
Continual deep-dive of performance based analytics and close involvement with partner teams to maintain a performant global network
Participate in a follow-the-sun on-call rotation shared with a globally distributed team
What We're Looking For
At least 7-10 years experience operating, building, and/or crafting big networks with a sound understanding of how CDNs work and their position in the global internet
Strong IP routing knowledge, with a focus on solving for BGP at a global level and with a deep understanding of TCP/IP, and the potential pitfalls of anycast
Comprehensive experience that relates to relationship complexities involving well-known global transit providers, peers, regional carriers, clouds, and DNS service providers
Ability to analyze traffic patterns across multiple dimensions using flow-based tools
Familiarity with the Arista switch platform or similar
Can work in a Linux environment, understanding of the Linux network stack, and familiarity with software/automation workflow tools
Validated scripting abilities in a common language such as BASH, Python, etc
Why Fastly?
We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
We love distributed teams. Fastly's home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA.
We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).
We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful -- every day.
We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.
We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit please apply!

Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.

*Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Fastly collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see our privacy notice for job applicants.

Company:
Nominet
WHAT DRIVES US...

Maybe you know us, maybe you don't. Even though you probably use our services every day. So we would like to share more about what we do at Nominet, and why we do it, so that you can help us to

build the right team.

We are proudly at the heart of the UK's critical internet infrastructure. Leading the charge in cybersecurity, as we explore and pioneer new tech. We do this to enable connectivity, inclusivity, and security for our world - and create a vibrant digital

future.

That's what drives us - and the kind of people we want to work with.

PERKS

Competitive salary depending on experience, plus excellent benefits including a 10% bonus, 28 days holiday, Healthcare, Pension Scheme, Life Assurance, Wellbeing allowance, Flex benefits, and onsite fitness classes and studio.

As Network Engineering Manager you will lead and manage the Network Engineering team to provide critical IT system support to the technical team, business, and wider internet community.

We need you to proactively understand and manage both the hardware, software, and people to provide best-of-breed technical build and support to the Nominet business. You will deliver network projects in line with a technical roadmap across multiple technologies and platforms to protect UK critical national infrastructure against cybersecurity threats and DDoS.

Job Responsibilities
Provision of highly resilient, critical Network services
Provide expertise in both infrastructure configuration & management and a thorough understanding of commonly used network protocols.
Management of systems infrastructure and people to provide high-quality support service.
To provide technical expertise and assist in the strategic direction in the development and provisioning of network infrastructure to support the Nominet business. This includes but is not limited to planning/designing, developing, implementing, upgrading and maintaining solutions and systems.
Lead and inspire a team to provide best of breed solutions, bringing out the best in others and acting as a role model for Nominet behaviours both internally and externally.
Resource management for project and BAU support requirements.
Work within an ISO framework to preserve vital production services.
Work to Service Level Agreements to manage the uptime and performance of both systems and services.
Understand and proactively plan infrastructure to meet both technical and business needs.
Manage and take ownership of project activity, budget, and financial management for this area.
Be a subject matter expert in Network infrastructure.
Be an effective, disciplined, self-starting and self-managing leader capable of hard work and great results.
Recruitment, team development and performance management of a critical business function through a growth phase.
Succession planning and as an ambassador in wider industry engagement to identify and nurture the Network engineers to meet the future business needs.
Key Requirements
Highly influential manager with hands-on operational experience managing Networks in a mission-critical production environment.
Experience in configuration of Juniper firewalls and routers.
Experience in the configuration of f5 load balancers.
Knowledge and operational experience of BGP and Anycast.
Ability to work on large, high volume critical infrastructures.
A thorough understanding of internet, networking and infrastructure technologies
Experience of managing co-located infrastructure with Disaster Recovery capabilities
Demonstrable knowledge of the following technologies and systems is also required; VPN Technologies, NTP Systems, SMTP Mail relay.
ITIL or ISO20000 Service Management System
Taking part in the on-call rota
Proven experience with:
Managing a small team of technical experts and professionals
Managing a budget
Working within service level agreements
Managing infrastructure projects
Developing people
Vendor management
If you are a Network Engineering Manager or Team Leader with experience of leading a team of Network Engineers, can deliver network projects with the skills and experience as outlined above and is passionate about wanting to work at the heart of the UK's critical internet infrastructure, then we look forward to receiving your application. Please apply now.

Overall Purpose of Job
The job includes design and configuration of Epsilon’s global IP-MPLS backbone to enable new services, build documentation and processes for provisioning teams. A key element to the role is working with the development team to automate Epsilons network service on the Infiny platform.
This role reports to the Head of Network Engineering and Planning
Key responsibilities
Participate in network planning meetings, and provide low level plans for major network changes with detailed diagrams and full scope of works for physical and logical work, and through automation as much as possible.
Responsible for updating network documentation and ensuring base configurations on all devices are consistent and up to date in line with design LLD.
Work in close collaboration with the service assurance team to ensure they have necessary documentation to support the network and all monitoring is setup for all network metrics to enable proactive monitoring of backbone and customer services.
Support the capacity management team with data collection and provide up to date details of utilisation and support capacity management team by executing migrations to free up capacity.
Act as Level 3 escalation for network outages and complex customer issues, as well as provide technical support to Service Delivery teams and Technical sales for complex orders and high value bids.
Adhere to change control for any network changes
Follow technology trends and understand the technical details (rfc etc)
HLD and LLD development where needed
Development of provisioning procedures for IP-MPLS based services
Development and updating of troubleshooting procedures
Development Infiny troubleshooting guides for network and customer service related issues.
Write technical stories for Automation development as required
Drive best practice for alarm and event clearing and assurance practice into the NOC.
Support NOC and Provisioning when needed.
Support technical sales team when needed
Support day to day network operation where required.
Participate in on-call rota.

Requirements
Experienced Network engineer with working knowledge of service provider network technologies, such as IP-MPLS, BGP and SD-WAN solutions. Preferably using Juniper OS.
Self-motivated and driven by technology evolution driving or developing business benefit.
Knowledge of Junos OS, Juniper Contrail, Nokia 7750 SR and Nokia 5620 SAM, and SNMP polling platforms. Knowledge of Junos Space and CSD is a plus.
Good understanding of cloud technologies, especially around cloud interconnections through Service provider networks, intercloud routing and security of cloud and on-prem services.
Understanding of network automation tools used in Juniper networks to automate network changes.
Extensive Knowledge of test equipment and troubleshooting techniques used to identify root cause and resolution.
Ability to solve design and operational problems, plan and schedule complex communication system or services upgrades, modifications, and new equipment deployment and network integration.
Track record of success in this industry with specific background in data network and its recent evolution into the Cloud.

JOB TITLE: Senior IT Engineer
DEPARTMENT: IT
REPORTING TO: Group IT Manager
PACKAGE: Basic starting salary of £28k up to £32k plus staff bonus, pension, death in service cover, health care cash plan.
THE DEPARTMENT
The IT Department is responsible for supporting and maintaining the company’s IT systems and for providing efficient desktop support to all business users. The department is also responsible for resolving any IT-related faults quickly and efficiently, including a broad range of queries from how to set up an email account to system diagnostics, plus enhancing and developing the IT provision extended within the business.
THE ROLE
To provide effective IT assistance across all aspects of the business and provide back up and support to the Group IT Manager. Responsible for supporting and maintaining desktop operating systems, and Microsoft 365 environment plus general maintenance of all IT-related hardware/software. The position provides exposure to a broad range of IT-related projects and activities.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Escalate IT issues to the Group IT Manager where necessary
Assisting IT Apprentice on day-to-day tasks and small project work
Responsible for managing backups and replication (Veeam)
Diagnose and resolve technical issues
Undertake small to medium-sized IT projects as instructed by the IT Manager
Provide desktop and server support
Support and maintain Desktops and 365 Environment
Setting up and configuring new laptops and desktops
Install authorised software to laptops and desktops
Ensuring security and upgrades are applied and kept up to date on desktops and laptops
Fault-finding to laptops and desktops
Reporting faults and maintaining logs on servers, desktops, and laptops
Completing internal user moves including phones
Patching of network and phones
Ensure all logs for equipment and users are maintained on the Asset Register
Ensuring patches and upgrades are applied to core servers
Fault-finding to core servers
Ensuring all software purchased licensing is recorded and maintained
Setting up new users and disabling expired accounts in accordance with IT requirements
Providing support for MAC and PC
Other Responsibilities
Prepare documents, meeting materials and correspondence
Perform basic administrative support duties as required to meet specific operational objectives
Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by the Group IT Manager
Work extra hours to meet deadlines, as required and where reasonable
Aid as required to the Group IT Manager
Aid and support to colleagues in IT-related matters
Ensure that a high level of customer service and support is provided to all internal customers
THE PERSON
To be successful in this role, you will be required to demonstrate the following key skills:
· Excellent communication skills and ability to work with people at all levels
· Highly organized
· Ability to multi-task and work on a number of projects at any one time
· Good prioritisation skills
DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE the following areas
· Office365
· Network - DNS / DHCP / TCP/IP / VLANS
· Windows Server – 2012 & 2019
· Windows 7/8/10
· Cloud Solutions (Azure)
· VMWare & Hyper-V
· Veeam Backup & Replication

Corelight is a cybersecurity startup in the network detection and response (NDR) market, based in downtown San Francisco and Columbus, OH. Our technology helps defend some of the world's most sensitive, mission-critical organizations and gives defenders a commanding view of their environment - so they can outsmart and outlast adversaries. Corelight's unfair market advantages include our unique architecture built on open source Zeek, as well as our our founding team - which includes Zeek's inventor and its key open source committers. We aim to follow in the footsteps of successful open source security companies such as Sourcefire and Tenable, and help make the world's networks safer.

Corelight, Inc is seeking a skilled, experienced Sales Engineer in the META territory to help promote, sell, and create customer satisfaction with the company’s products. You will primarily provide pre-sales technical support for the implementation of our products. This will include presentations, product demonstrations, assessment of potential application of Corelight solutions, and the development of account plans.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Act as a trusted advisor providing technical expertise through Sales presentations, Solution designs, Solution demonstrations, and Proof of Concepts
Develop and Maintain a high level of technical knowledge of the Corelight offering and competitive and complimentary solutions from other vendors.
Design differentiating solutions and articulate technical and business value of Corelight’s products versus other competitors.
Design technical solutions that can solve customer business problems or create a new service offering
Participate in the development and support of content (presentations, WP’s, use cases…) for customers and partners.
Maintain knowledge of competitive landscape and share with the team.
Foster a collaborative, team-based environment, sharing best practices and success and building lasting relationships.
Perform other related duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Expert written and oral communication skills
Expert presentation skills
Network design background and/or security software background preferred.
Qualifications:
8+ years related industry experience
4+ year pre-sales experience
BS/BA or equivalent work experience
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is clear demonstration of skill, dedication, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for.

Diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

TRULY FIBRE, TRULY FAST
We're expanding our team as we transform broadband in Kent and beyond. If you'd like to join us on our exciting journey, we'd love to hear from you. We are building our own fibre optic networks to homes and businesses using Fibre to the Premises (FTTP) technology – this means we can offer our customers the highest speed and highest quality broadband services in the country – guaranteed! The Trooli networks are modern, future-proof and fit for the digital age.
THE ROLE
We’re a small company with a very exciting future. The role holder will be responsible attending a customer’s premises on-time and according to an installation schedule to carry out a service installation.
Responsibilities
· Provision of FTTP Broadband services in both residential and business premises
· Installation and splicing of fibre cabling both underground and overhead
· Deployment and commissioning of customer premises equipment including ONT and router
· Deliver professional and concise customer handover.
· Self-audit all works and ensure it meets all applicable technical and operational quality standards.
· Work efficiently and tidily, maintaining a clean environment a at all times.
· Respond effectively and appropriately to all customer requests and enquiries.
· Complete work to agreed time scales.
· Comply with Health & Safety standards.
· Ensure that all work activities comply with environmental regulations.
· Ensure the use of plant and tools are conducted in a safe manner, meeting the requirements for operation of the specific equipment.
· Comply with company Transport Policy
· Conduct daily checks of plant and tools, ensure they are safe to use and where applicable carry valid calibration certificates.
The role is principally working within a customer installation team. However, you may also be required to carry out cabling work on our core distribution network.
Your experience
The successful applicant will have a proven track record of high-quality cabling work and excellent references, with at least 3 years’ experience of cabling in BT Openreach ducts and infrastructure - both overhead and underground.
Your qualifications
· NSRWA Unit 2 Signage, guarding and light.
· NSRWA Unit LA Avoidance of underground apparatus.
· IPAF MEWP Mobile Boom B3.
· Knowledge and experience of working to BT Openreach standards and processes for underground safety, working at height and confined spaces.

· Full clean driving license and age appropriate license to tow cable trailer.
Your personal attributes
· You will be able to develop excellent working relationships within your team, with your manager, and with other teams within Call Flow and Trooli.
· You strive to make efficiencies and work smarter.
· You have excellent organisation skills.
· You are a clear and concise communicator.
· You are physically fit to carry out manual handling
· ‘Can Do’ mindset with focus on customer satisfaction beyond expectations.
· A collaborative and innovative approach to service delivery and problem solving.
Your personal benefits
Substantial life insurance policy
25 days paid holiday, plus bank holidays
Pension
Free parking
Complimentary tea and coffee, plus kitchen facilities
Friendly working environment
Company laptop
Cycle to work scheme
Company sick pay after a years’ service
COVID secure employer
Our values
· Integrity: be transparent and honest with our customers and with each other.

· Develop: Invest in each individual.
· Continual improvement: Work smarter, not harder.
· Proactive: take responsibility.

Job Description
My client is looking for an experienced Engineer to join their team responsible for their expanding global network with over 5000 nodes consisting of Juniper on the core and mainly Cisco on the edge. You must have proven experience of troubleshooting and configuring Juniper M&T series Routers ideally with some switching exposure, you must also be skilled in Cisco Routing & Switching products. To be successful you must have Strong knowledge of the operation, design principles and troubleshooting of TCP/IP, IP Routing protocols: BGP, OSPF (and/or ISIS), MPLS, Multicast protocols: IGMP, PIM, Common Router Interfaces and Protocols: Ethernet, Fast Ethernet, Gigabit Ethernet, SONET/SDH, ATM, Frame Relay, PPP is essential. It is envisaged that you will have spent at least 3 years of your career supporting large IP networks. Certifications such as JNCIA, JNCIS, JNCIP, JNCIE, CCNP or CCIP would be a distinct advantage. This role will be a mix of Support and project work and on occasions will require you to travel overseas.
Our client provides end-to-end transaction solutions for the purchase and sale of financial products over its global private network which make it the trusted source for electronic trading at the world’s largest fixed income and foreign exchange trading firms and major exchanges. They are one of the world’s leading inter-dealer brokers, providing integrated voice and electronic services to wholesale market participants across global fixed income, foreign exchange, equity derivatives.

You can expect to work in a cutting edge environment with a great team of people and a company that heavily invests in technology and training for its technical team.

Company:
Nominet
WHAT DRIVES US...

Maybe you know us, maybe you don't. Even though you probably use our services every day. So

we'd like to share more about what we do at Nominet, and why we do it, so that you can help us to

build the right team.

We're proudly at the heart of the UK's critical internet infrastructure. Leading the charge in cyber

security, as we explore and pioneer new tech.

We do this to enable connectivity, inclusivity and security for our world - and create a vibrant digital

future.

That's what drives us - and the kind of people we want to work with.

PERKS

Competitive salary depending on experience, plus excellent benefits including a 10% bonus, 28 days holidays, Healthcare, Pension Scheme, Life Assurance, Wellbeing allowance, Flex benefits and onsite fitness classes and studio.

Main Job Purpose:

We are establishing a new, dedicated DevOps team in our Internet Engineering & Operations function, working closely with software developers and infrastructure engineers - all operating at the heart of the internet. We are looking for additional team members who will have the opportunity to help shape the direction and strategy of the team going forward. If you have experience as a DevOps engineer or are looking to take your career into the DevOps space, this is a great opportunity to use your knowledge and skills to transform our software deployment process towards a fully automated solution.

Job Summary:
Build, configure, run and patch Kubernetes clusters.
Work with Software Developers to release code (including new applications) across the application stack (development, beta, production, etc).
Take an automated-first approach to all tasks.
Engineer new tools and applications that improve production and deployment capabilities for all teams.
Work on projects across the business to ensure operational excellence.
Design and write automated tests within a CI framework on configuration, packaging and deployment scripts.
Work closely with Infrastructure and Security Engineers to implement operational requirements; identify and fix bugs and streamline development workflows.
Be an ambassador for DevOps across the business, influencing others to embrace automation and DevOps principles.
Work with the Release Manager to ensure successful and streamlined production deployments.
Key Requirements:
Strong background in software engineering (using languages such as Java, Python, etc).
Extensive experience with Linux and virtualization.
Extensive system design knowledge.
Formidable experience with Kubernetes and Docker.
Deep knowledge of containerisation.
Confident with Ansible, Terraform, GIT for configuration management.
Substantial experience with AWS.
CI/CD tooling and delivery best practices.
Network and security knowledge.
Experience deploying, managing and troubleshooting of software applications (including Web Apps and B2B).
Happy working using Agile practices, and JIRA.

At British Land, Places People Prefer is at the heart of everything we do. We are inspired by how places can affect people’s lives, whether they live, work, shop or are part of the wider community. As part of our £16.8bn assets under management, our portfolio includes UK-wide Retail multi-let Centres, Central London campuses and prime residential developments.
We design, build and manage places that reflect the way people want to live, work and shop today and into the future. The Team

The IT Infrastructure team is part of Group Technology and is responsible for the effective provision of all British Land’s corporate technology infrastructure. Functions include:
Support and maintenance of the existing IT infrastructure in order to minimize downtime and maintain business-as-usual operations
Design and implementation of new IT infrastructure solutions
Ensure structure and control of the functions responsible for diverse technical operations in both physical and virtual environments .
Implement appropriate standards and processes in relation to core infrastructure and sysadmin level access
Monitoring alerts and events, including proactive response and escalation to 3rd party suppliers where appropriate
The Role
The Network Engineer is responsible for implementing and maintaining all aspects of British Land’s multi-site network infrastructure. This includes daily support incidents, troubleshooting, network design, equipment installations, reconfigurations, upgrades and documentation. The Network Engineer is required to work as part of the infrastructure team and multitask in a diverse technical environment.
Key Responsibilities
Implementation:
Deploys/upgrades secure, practical workable network solutions (production and disaster recovery) following industry standards and best practices
Ensures proper installation and configuration of a broad range of network equipment
Provisions suitable connectivity solutions utilizing industry standard protocols
Maintains and improves the multi-site network environment
Work with other members of the infrastructure team to undertake the networking components of multifaceted infrastructure installations
Maintains, upgrades and evaluates new network management software and tools to ensure operational efficiencies
Adheres to British Land’s standard network operating procedures and policies
Documents network designs and suggests improvements
Manage and liaise with 3rd parties to ensure successful implementations
Troubleshooting:
Supports recovery of the infrastructure environment in the event of system failure or disaster
Provides 2nd and 3rd line support to analyse, diagnose and resolve infrastructure issues
Proactive fault finding, including the identification and elimination of single points of failure and security weak points
Utilising, implementing and configuring appropriate monitoring solutions to proactively find and resolve issues before they become user impacting
Work with other members of the infrastructure team to diagnose, analyse and resolve multi component infrastructure issues
Ensuring that identified issues are being driven to resolution
Engages in self-directed continuous improvement of the British Land network infrastructure
Investigates and follows both industry and British Land best practices and contributes to BL technical standards
Documents configuration and standards
Manage and liaise with 3rd parties to provide timely resolutions to support issues
Required Skills
Technical Skills:
Understanding of networking and distributed computing concepts, TCP/IP V4 and V6, IP addressing/subnetting, LAN/WAN, DHCP, DNS, VPN, NAT, Routing, P2P circuits, BGP/OSPF, Switching and Firewalls, server virtualization, client/server applications, disaster recovery and business continuity
Extensive knowledge of network security, threat detection and mitigation
Extensive knowledge of implementation and support of Ethernet networks (Enterprise level) with firewalls, routers and switches from vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint.
Extensive knowledge PKI, certificates and related authentication technologies (RADIUS, NPS etc.)
Practical knowledge implementing security using VPN technologies including IPSec, SSL VPN, and encryption.
Practical knowledge of On-Prem -> Azure and AWS connectivity including VPC and NSG
Knowledge of Wifi technologies including WLAN controllers
Working knowledge of tools including SIEM solutions, Solarwinds, PRTG, Cat Tools, syslog, SNMP, Visio Dark Trace and Wireshark
Working knowledge of, and ability to support network products from a wide variety of vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint
Position Requirements:
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills required: Ability to identify and analyze network quality and operational processes and then drive corrective / preventative action plans.
Highly self-motivated and directed with excellent interpersonal skills
Strong documentation skills
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed
Sharp attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Expected Behaviours
British Land employees are committed to living our values and promoting an inclusive, positive and collaborative culture.
Bring your whole self
Confident, pro-active, hardworking and highly professional individual
Treats everyone equally
Listen & Understand
Seeks out, accepts and acts on feedback
Awareness of and ability to maintain confidentiality
Smarter together
Good team player, with positive attitude and eagerness to get involved
Self-starter who uses own initiative
Flexibility - able to deal with different levels of workload, remaining calm under pressure
Build for the future
Willing to learn new skills and tools
Works to a high standard and always strives to improve

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers.

Why choose us?
We’ve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the world’s first telecommunications company. At our heart we’re a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.

Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.

Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward we’ll offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If that’s you and what you’re looking for, we’d love you to be part of our future.

We value different perspectives, skills and experiences. We’re creating an inclusive working culture where people from all backgrounds can succeed. That’s why we welcome applications from all parts of the community.

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are looking for an experienced Network Security Engineer with a focus on Cisco Security. You will be responsible for the design, configuration, installation, support and maintenance of network infrastructure (predominately Cisco) for multiple high profile financial service clients. The Network Engineer will be part of a team responsible for delivering corporate network services for data center and branch offices in a mission-critical enterprise. New non-incumbent role is established to develop passionate staff. This is an entry to mid-level role amongst senior design and delivery engineering team, essentially a junior position with opportunity for advancement. Opportunity exists for the candidate to specialize expertise in network programmability, cloud, data center, backbone, security, and wireless areas.

What a Network Engineer does at EA:
configure and maintain network gear
capacity planning, performance tuning, and configuration optimization
planning and execution of changes, assessing and mitigating risks
provision new services, migrate existing services, circuits
conduct feasibility, impact, and cost studies, develop solution options
highest level operational support, triage, break/fix, incident resolution
drawing diagrams, producing solution (physical and logical) documentation
develop and evaluate network performance criteria and measurement methodology
consistent configuration and deployment of network services aligned to architectural standards
You will have use of network tools for administration, maintenance, automation, and visualization/reporting
conduct economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections
Requirements:
Demonstrate continuous learning and development: Willing with an appetite for understanding new things, with a sense of curiosity.
Be passionate about network technology and demonstrate awareness of industry trends/direction.
2 + years experience in delivery, provisioning and troubleshooting of network.
Advanced understanding of OSI Reference model and IETF TCP/IP suite and typical implementations.
Basic understanding of OSPF and BGP routing protocols for routed protocols IPv4/IPv6.
Good understanding of the hierarchical network and next gen firewall platforms architectures.

Understanding of the concepts of overlays e.g. OTV, VXLAN
Experience with data, control, and management planes
If you have Cisco R&S background:
Practical and conceptual knowledge of routing and switching technology, static and dynamic routing protocols, network planes
Fundamental working knowledge of Cisco routing and switching technologies including Catalyst and Nexus switching, and ISR/ASR routing platforms.

An established and renowned industry leader is seeking a proven Network / Infrastructure Engineer to join their growing team based in central London. Please note, this is initially a fixed-term contract for 6 months, however there is a chance this might be extended for the right candidate.
Reporting into the Head of Infrastructure and as part of a sizeable infrastructure/ network team, the successful candidate will work closely with enterprise architects / third party providers and be responsible for providing enterprise-class network to multiple sites throughout the UK using the latest network technologies from Cisco, FortiGate, Checkpoint and Netscalers Load Balancers. Duties will include:
Designing system configuration, directing system installation, defining, documenting and enforcing system standards
Maximising network performance
Investigating data network faults
Securing, supporting, administering and upgrading all network systems and firewall solutions
Reporting network operational status by gathering and prioritising information and managing projects
Upgrading data network equipment to the latest stable firmware releases
Configuring routing and switching equipment
Managing third-party relationships.

This Network Engineer role is paying a maximum basic salary of £55,000 pro-rata plus benefits including bonus, pension, life assurance, private medical, season ticket loan and 25 days holiday.

Brief Description

Salary: £25,198 per annum
Grade: UKRI C
Contract Type: Open-Ended
Hours: Full Time
Closing Date: 24th November 2020

Our teams are predominately based at Rutherford Appleton Laboratory (RAL) near Chilton in Oxfordshire and Daresbury Laboratory (DL) in Cheshire. This role can be based at either site and applicants should express a preference in their covering letter. There will be an occasional requirement to travel to other STFC sites.

STFC reserve the right to close this vacancy early if a sufficient number of applications are received therefore early applications are encouraged.

About the role

The Digital Infrastructure department in STFC are responsible for the delivery of the enterprise Information and Communications Technology (ICT) infrastructure and services that underpin the STFC scientific programme of activities. The work that we do is key to protecting the organisation's digital assets and is an enabler for the work of the scientific community here at STFC.

The Digital Infrastructure team provide a comprehensive network and communications environment to support the work of STFC and partner organisations. This includes a range of technologies and environments including Voice, Data, Email and unified communications.

Specifically, this role is to provide day to day support and maintenance of the network and communications environment as supported by DI, including fulfilling service requests, resolving incidents, supporting the service desk. You can expect opportunities to develop technical skills through increasingly autonomous projects whilst under the guidance and mentorship of senior team members. If you have an aptitude and desire to progress in your career with STFC, you can benefit from appropriate training opportunities and guidance for career enhancement. A progression path leading to Senior Network Engineer or indeed other roles within the organisation is anticipated. You may also be eligible for Degree Apprenticeship programmes.

Key duties include:
Day-to-day responsibility for appropriate requests (tickets) for service at the direction of the Senior Network & Communications Engineer
Undertake minor installations or configurations within the area of both networking and telephony
Planning, installation, testing and maintenance of voice and data network connections.
Our teams are predominately based at Rutherford Appleton Laboratory (RAL) near Chilton in Oxfordshire and Daresbury Laboratory (DL) in Cheshire. This role can be based at either site and applicants should express a preference in their covering letter. There will be an occasional requirement to travel to other STFC sites.

Organization Description

UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world-leading position in research and innovation. More information can be found at www.ukri.org.
The Science and Technology Facilities Council is a world-leading multi-disciplinary science organisation, and our goal is to deliver economic, societal, scientific and international benefits to the UK and its people – and more broadly to the world.

Location York House

At British Land, Places People Prefer is at the heart of everything we do. We are inspired by how places can affect people’s lives, whether they live, work, shop or are part of the wider community. If you want to feel listened to and understood in an environment where your opinions count and your ideas are encouraged, you’ve come to the right place!

The Team

The IT Infrastructure team is part of Group Technology and is responsible for the effective provision of all British Land’s corporate technology infrastructure. Functions include:
Support and maintenance of the existing IT infrastructure in order to minimize downtime and maintain business-as-usual operations
Design and implementation of new IT infrastructure solutions
Ensure structure and control of the functions responsible for diverse technical operations in both physical and virtual environments.
Implement appropriate standards and processes in relation to core infrastructure and sysadmin level access
Monitoring alerts and events, including proactive response and escalation to 3rd party suppliers where appropriate
The Role

The Network Engineer is responsible for implementing and maintaining all aspects of British Land’s multi-site network infrastructure. This includes daily support incidents, troubleshooting, network design, equipment installations, reconfigurations, upgrades and documentation. The Network Engineer is required to work as part of the infrastructure team and multitask in a diverse technical environment.

Key Responsibilities

Implementation:
Deploys/upgrades secure, practical workable network solutions (production and disaster recovery) following industry standards and best practices
Ensures proper installation and configuration of a broad range of network equipment
Provisions suitable connectivity solutions utilizing industry standard protocols
Maintains and improves the multi-site network environment
Work with other members of the infrastructure team to undertake the networking components of multifaceted infrastructure installations
Maintains, upgrades and evaluates new network management software and tools to ensure operational efficiencies
Adheres to British Land’s standard network operating procedures and policies
Documents network designs and suggests improvements
Manage and liaise with 3rd parties to ensure successful implementations
Troubleshooting:
Supports recovery of the infrastructure environment in the event of system failure or disaster
Provides 2nd and 3rd line support to analyse, diagnose and resolve infrastructure issues
Proactive fault finding, including the identification and elimination of single points of failure and security weak points
Utilising, implementing and configuring appropriate monitoring solutions to proactively find and resolve issues before they become user impacting
Work with other members of the infrastructure team to diagnose, analyse and resolve multi component infrastructure issues
Ensuring that identified issues are being driven to resolution
Engages in self-directed continuous improvement of the British Land network infrastructure
Investigates and follows both industry and British Land best practices and contributes to BL technical standards
Documents configuration and standards
Manage and liaise with 3rd parties to provide timely resolutions to support issues
Required Skills

Technical Skills:
Understanding of networking and distributed computing concepts, TCP/IP V4 and V6, IP addressing/subnetting, LAN/WAN, DHCP, DNS, VPN, NAT, Routing, P2P circuits, BGP/OSPF, Switching and Firewalls, server virtualization, client/server applications, disaster recovery and business continuity
Extensive knowledge of network security, threat detection and mitigation
Extensive knowledge of implementation and support of Ethernet networks (Enterprise level) with firewalls, routers and switches from vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint.
Extensive knowledge PKI, certificates and related authentication technologies (RADIUS, NPS etc.)
Practical knowledge implementing security using VPN technologies including IPSec, SSL VPN, and encryption.
Practical knowledge of On-Prem -> Azure and AWS connectivity including VPC and NSG
Knowledge of Wifi technologies including WLAN controllers
Working knowledge of tools including SIEM solutions, Solarwinds, PRTG, Cat Tools, syslog, SNMP, Visio Dark Trace and Wireshark
Working knowledge of, and ability to support network products from a wide variety of vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint
Position Requirements:
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills required: Ability to identify and analyze network quality and operational processes and then drive corrective / preventative action plans.
Highly self-motivated and directed with excellent interpersonal skills
Strong documentation skills
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed
Sharp attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Expected Behaviours

British Land employees are committed to living our values and promoting an inclusive, positive and collaborative culture.

Bring your whole self
Confident, pro-active, hardworking and highly professional individual

Who we are

Founded in 2014 in London, United Kingdom, Garrison has raised more than $50m to date from London investors including Dawn Capital, IP Group, NM Capital and BGF. Garrison’s strengths lie in its experienced and dedicated teams, building on years of expertise in cyber security to bring genuinely game changing technology to the industry.

Garrison is working to build the future of cyber security and is already deploying at scale in both the government and commercial space. Our existing customers are large organisations averaging over fifty thousand employees each, across sectors including banking, insurance, media, telco, law and government.

2020/21 is shaping up to be our busiest and most productive year yet, with increasing demand, steady growth, and plenty of impactful projects taking place!

What we do

We make the internet a far safer place for work and play. We develop cybersecurity products that bring together our own electronic hardware, firmware and software to provide an unrivalled combination of security, usability and performance to ensure that risky web content is never processed on the user’s endpoint device.

Our working culture

We are an exciting start-up with ground-breaking technology; a very serious mission to solve real world problems, but with a positive and highly inclusive atmosphere, and an excellent work/life balance!

At Garrison we celebrate diversity and inclusion, and we’re focused on continuously improving equality for the benefit of our employees, products and community. We recruit, develop and retain talent purely on the basis of qualifications, merit and business needs.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we take every possible step to ensure that every person employed or seeking employment with us receives fair treatment. No-one shall be disadvantaged on the grounds of age, disability, gender, ethnicity, religion or belief, sexual orientation, marital and parental status, neurodiversity, social background, physical ability, illness or otherwise.

Overview of the role

Working closely with the VP Secure Consulting and the London-based Sales and Customer Success teams, you will serve as a subject matter expert on all technical aspects of Garrison’s unique and innovative ultra-secure solutions and their deployment, providing pre-sales support for the commercial and government markets in EMEA and Singapore.

The successful candidate will be a sharp, technically literate, commercially astute and self-starting individual with the ability to articulately consult with both technical and non-technical stakeholders both internally and externally, whilst working almost entirely remotely.

The successful candidate will have a proven ability to collaboratively consult with business leaders to understand their challenges and clearly articulate solutions that are technically achievable, appropriate and proportionate to the client’s need.

You will have broad and deep knowledge of a variety technologies and concepts whilst also being highly personable, able to present to audiences and speak to people at all levels, all the way up to C-suite. You will be comfortable working in a small team as well as individually. And you’ll have the patience for a journey that is changing the world.

A proven track record of implementing networking/infrastructure solutions (ideally cybersecurity) in large enterprise or government organization is preferred, but backgrounds including IT architecture and/or large-scale implementation projects will also be considered.

Key responsibilities
Developing a detailed understanding of Garrison’s products; able to articulate Garrison’s hardware enforced isolation capability in both highly technical language as well as simple, jargon-free explanation.
Frequent collaboration with both the technical and sales teams to ensure the development and execution of appropriate account plans. Engaging with customer technical teams to help inform their High-Level Design (HLD) documentation.
Supporting customer technical teams to plan installation and deployment, converting HLDs into implementation plans.
Engaging with Garrison's engineering team to discuss product improvements and roadmap items from a functional, usability and performance perspective
Skills and experience

Calm under pressure and able to maintain a diplomatic manner even when being challenged
Graduate-level qualification, ideally in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or similar engineering, technology discipline.
Strong experience of leading £2m+ opportunities through full competitive lifecycle
Extensive experience of delivering accredited cross-domain solutions
Excellent consultative approach to sales engagement:
Ability to listen and hear a client and respond to the questions they ask, as well as pushing your own agenda
Ability to explain complex concepts in a clear, consumable fashion
Ability to successfully engage at all levels, from 1st/2nd Line support and engineering teams and up to C-Level ideally
A proven track record in Enterprise IT/Security with a deep technical knowledge, including security infrastructure design/implementation and networking.
Demonstrable understanding of key information services e.g. web, email etc.
An ability to draw on examples of integrating solutions into client infrastructures.
Experience of shaping client requirements, identifying suitable use cases and helping prospects develop internal business cases to secure funding.
It would be super useful if you have any of the below:
Background in FPGA based hardware solutions.
Experience of delivering enterprise level network solutions.
Experience of designing secure solutions for business to business collaboration and interoperability solutions.
Certified Enterprise Architect (TOGAF or equivalent).
Security professional certification (e.g. CISSP).

At Wifinity we’re proud of our fantastic products, and amazing growth! But we couldn’t do this without our amazing people, who go above and beyond to wow our customers and make WiFi great!

THE ROLE
This is a role within the Network Operation Centre (NOC) of Wifinity, which provides support to multiple UK wide networks. This role is part of a team that provides 24/7 customer support all year round including public holidays. The role plays a key part in resolving technical faults across our customer base which includes end users (B2C) and managed service offerings (B2B). Products supported will include a wide range of services ranging from public and private cloud services, large enterprise wired and wireless network infrastructures through to end user troubleshooting.
The Network Operations Engineer role will provide outstanding service focussed on resolving escalated incidents from the customer facing support teams, resolving urgent monitoring alerts, network equipment commissioning, and planned network maintenance.
This position will allow excellent career opportunities to the right individual who is looking for a challenging and rewarding position in a fast growing company, and who has a strong drive to grow professionally and bring dedication to our customers and the rest of the team.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Handle technical support issues via incident management escalations
Daily use of monitoring systems to proactively identify and resolve potential issues
Configuration and commissioning of wired and wireless networking equipment
Integration of multi-vendor network devices with the monitoring systems
Maintenance and development of the monitoring systems
Day-to-day Technical Operation activities (network migrations, design changes, infrastructure updates and firmware updates)
Infrastructure documentation and knowledge base development to improve team knowledge and troubleshooting.
REQUIREMENTS
Essential:
Experience in network operations centre in the ISP/Telecoms industry
Ability to work individually and as part of a team, potentially covering extending working hours
Working experience on incident management processes and prioritisation
Working experience with monitoring systems, and have an excellent understanding of monitoring best practices
Excellent general networking knowledge, including routing (OSPF, BGP), firewalls and switching
Desire to learn new technologies and develop advanced networking skills
Strong desire and knowledge to work within Internet Service Provider industry and in a close-knit team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good understanding of RADIUS protocol
Good knowledge of WiFi standards and general Wireless principles
Ability to multi-task and deal with a combination of fault types at any given time
Desire to learn about new communication technologies and share them with the team.
Desirable:
Strong technical knowledge of Wireless Technologies
Salesforce CRM knowledge
Linux (Ubuntu or Centos) systems administrations skills
Knowledge of programming and scripting, preferably Python and PHP
Good understanding of SNMP protocol
Good knowledge of VPN and tunnelling technologies
Good knowledge of security protocols and firewalls
Network Infrastructure Design abilities
Knowledge of high availability protocols and design, on both Layer 2 and Layer 3
IPv6 implementation and transition mechanisms
Working experience of routing protocols (implementation and troubleshooting)

Job Description:
Network Engineer
Aldershot
What will I have involved with?

You will have overall responsibility for engineering (design & build) and day-to-day support of the Wide Area Network, Local Area Network and NW Security. Will be responsible to troubleshoot and resolve network and security problems. Have the ability to quickly identify and resolve problems stemming from network congestion, network collisions and other network abnormalities. Will be required to monitor, meet and report on Service Level Agreements. Implement and Manage network policies and standards.

You will work in a small, multi-skilled team across a range of technical products to build the system. You will be responsible for operating the system in a service management regime, and for ongoing continuous improvement and technical refresh projects. You will have significant experience of integrating secure systems, of problem resolution along with being able to lead design discussions with the customer and security assurance.
Network related certifications (preferred Cisco CCNA or CCNP level). Other well-known vendors are also acceptable
Solid experience with network (LAN/WAN/Security) installation, administration and support
What’s in it for me?
Bring a solid Network background, we’ll bring career progression and development opportunities in any area of IT you wish to progress within for your own personal development. Like shaping and defining the solutions you deliver, you will have the ability to shape and define your own career path, through hands on technical work or via our own DXC University. We provide discounted gym membership, health and dental insurance options as well as a strong flexible working environment to ensure you have the options of fitting your work around your lifestyle.
What you'll need to succeed:
LAN/WAN solutions (VLANS, STP, routing protocols, link-aggregation, QoS, 802.1x)
NGFW firewalls (including configuration of FW rules/translation/IPSec tunnels/VPN clients/web-filtering features)
IPS and vulnerabilities management systems
Load-balancing based on hardware devices
Familiar with with TCP/IP and related protocols such as DHCP, WINS, DNS, SMTP, POP3, and SNMP which helps in troubleshooting complex problems
Experience with Cisco, switches and routers and firewalls, however other network equipment vendors favourable.
Experience in Windows server and client operating systems
Experience of build and operation of highly secure infrastructure systems
Experience of taking systems through security test and applying remediation(s)
Ability to learn new technology skills
Understanding of Lean-Agile methods and DevOps working practices
Good interpersonal skills
Strong team player, capable of working as part of a virtual and logical team and independently as circumstances dictate

Job Title: Technical Support Engineer - Two-Way Radio Communications
Job Description:
Hytera is a global leader in two-way radio communications, developing and manufacturing innovative solutions to meet our varied customer requirements. With a reputation for high-quality, reliable, feature rich handsets and systems, Hytera can be found all over the world, from Shenzhen metro to the Etihad stadium, via North Sea oil rigs, railway networks, conference centres and construction sites.
We are now recruiting for an exceptional team player to join as a Technical Support Engineer (Full-time, Permanent - Salary negotiable - to be discussed with shortlisted candidates)
The role will focus on providing technical assistance to key partners in the support of Hytera’s product portfolio including pre-sales demonstrations, customer engagement and support case resolution. The RF based technologies in the portfolio include Analogue, DMR, TETRA, LTE and POC terminals and IP and Tier III systems. Our industry and our company are fast moving, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow.
This is a very practical, hands-on role, strong technical skills with a commercial focus are essential to this role, and the ideal candidate will have:
Strong experience and knowledge of Hytera RF products and applications or industry equivalent products is essential for this role.

Overview:

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help craft a more sustainable world.

Job summary


We are now looking for a Network Engineer – NPI SME responsible for on-site installation, commissioning and troubleshooting support of New Product Introduction for RAN Hardware, Software and Features, in readiness for industrialised volume deployment. Provide mentorship on installation & commissioning best practice, on-site troubleshooting support

Provide on-site training to ASPs and Ericsson field engineers, sharing knowledge and best practice
Technical Proficiencies:

Experienced in the Installation Commissioning and Integration of Ericsson Radio System (ERS) products
Broad technical knowledge in Radio & Mobile Broadband products, solutions and services
Detailed experience of integration, test and deployment methodologies
Experience of technology field trials of 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G radio, software and features
Knowledge and experience working on RAN Swap and RAN refresh projects
H&S training certification required for on-site Working at Heights (First Aid, Medical, RF Awareness, Roof Top working, Climbing)
