Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
Why this role matters
The individual will be a member of a small bespoke multi-skilled Field Engineering team supporting BT Security.

The role holder will be responsible for the installation, commissioning and in-life support for the project including power, environmental systems and network equipment.

The Field Service Engineering team will play a key role in testing and setting up the projects equipment and network components, commissioning these into operations and supporting all routines, servicing and maintenance obligations through to end of-life.

What you'll be doing

Support the BT Security organisation by delivering customer networks, platforms and systems in support of ourselves and special customers.

Deliver and operate these services within agreed performance standards and contractual agreements whilst operating within agreed timescales and budgets.

The position will initially be based in the UK, where the individual will be trained and briefed in all aspects of the role. Once trained, the individual will move onto a three-year International Assignment, based in mainland Europe. The exact start date, country specific details and assignment terms and conditions, will be given at interview.

You’ll be:
Improving customer experience – By delivering repair, provision and service availability performance, continually improving and supporting the delivery of great Net Promoter Score outcomes.
Profitability - Deliver and operate within service budgets (manpower, materials and circuits) and work tirelessly to deliver highly efficient services which meet our customer needs and maintain a highly utilised team.

We'll also need to see these on your CV

Skills you need:
Experience within the Telecoms Industry.
Broad knowledge of global voice, data and IP networks.
Ability to analyses complex network elements to identify customer solutions.
To understand Cisco IP systems.
To have a detailed understanding of BT Transmission systems.
To have a detailed understanding of Broadband networking.
To have a good understanding of Fibre practices to install and support optical networks.
To have a good understanding of Copper practices to install and maintain both ADSL links and external copper infrastructure.
Team working.
Must have strong communication and client interfacing skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication (including strong technical writing skills).
Ability to manage small concurrent projects, perform under pressure and meet deadlines.
Good relationship and leadership skills with a dedicated and positive attitude.
Innovative approach to technical solutions and service quality.
Willingness to take ownership and show initiative to achieve results.
Security Clearance at DV level is a mandatory requirement for this role (or the ability to gain it as a minimum)

Why choose us?
We’ve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the world’s first telecommunications company. At our heart we’re a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.

Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.

Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward we’ll offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If that’s you and what you’re looking for, we’d love you to be part of our future.
We value different perspectives, skills and experiences. We’re creating an inclusive working culture where people from all backgrounds can succeed. That’s why we welcome applications from all parts of the community.

Description
Job Description:
Job Description
Leidos are a growing company delivering innovative technology and solutions focused on safeguarding critical capabilities and transformation in frontline services, our work in the United Kingdom includes addressing some of the most complex problems in defence, healthcare, government, safety and security, and transportation.
https://www.leidos.com/company/global/uk-europe
We are seeing growth In the UK where, we support Central Government, Government Agencies and Critical National Infrastructure (CNI) customers and ensure they benefit from the best value for their technology investments, whilst safeguarding their staff and our nation through our technical expertise and experience. In doing this we uphold our values of Integrity, Inclusion, Innovation, Agility, Collaboration and Commitment. We are really passionate about what we do!
We are looking for a Network Engineer to work collaboratively with colleagues and our customer in an exciting and critical LAN/WAN environment delivering technical service in a dynamic ITIL environment.
Required Experience
Thorough and demonstrable understanding of Cisco Enterprise LAN environments, to both design and 3rd line support level including, deployment, administration and troubleshooting. Ideally to a CCNP and CCDP level.
Hand on experience in troubleshooting Layer 2/3 switching and routing,
Hands on experience in designing, configuring and troubleshooting OTV, VPC, VDC, STP, BGP, OSPF, Multicast, QoS and other key mainstream protocols
Hands on experience in designing, configuring and troubleshooting of MPLS networks
Hands on experience in designing, configuring and troubleshooting Palo Alto, ASAv and UTM Firewalls
Platform focus: Cisco Nexus 3k, 7k, 9k, ISR, 6800, 3750, 3850 series.
Proven experience with Cisco Identity Services Engine in a dot1x wired environment coupled with wireless and Guest Portals
Excellent communications skills, organisational skills and independent and autonomous working
Ability to run design workshops with internal and external teams
Be an escalation point for high severity complex problems and incidents
Experience in ITIL ICT service delivery on critical infrastructure
Experience of working under pressure to meet deadlines while handling multiple priorities
Experiencing in patch management including analysis and deployment
The actual work you will perform consists of a blend of operational support alongside the specification and implementation of new network infrastructure as part of a large, diverse, skilled and collaborative team. Occasional travel to other Leidos and customer sites may be required. Keeping an eye on the technology landscape is essential, too – identification of new and relevant technologies to solve problems and make improvements is part of the job. We believe innovation is the lifeblood of customer value – we are all catalysts for innovation and improvement and committed to continuous improvement in everything we do.
Applicants must hold a current, valid SC (security checked) clearance.
We offer flexible working where possible as part of our people centric culture along with an excellent benefits scheme and 25 days holiday per year as standard holiday, benefits.
What do we do for you?
We offer meaningful and engaging careers, a collaborative culture, and support for your career goals, all while nurturing a healthy work-life balance.
We provide an employment package that attracts, develops and retains only the best in talent.
Our reward scheme includes:
Contributory Pension Scheme
Private Medical Insurance
33 days Annual Leave (including public and privilege holidays)
Access to Flexible benefits (including life assurance, health schemes, and cycle to work scheme)
External Referral Bonus:
Ineligible
Potential for Telework:
No
Clearance Level Required:
Other Clearance
Travel:
No
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
37.5
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional

Network Administration and Ops

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Job
Senior Network Engineer
Description
About the Company
Deluxe, a subsidiary of Platinum Equity, is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and cloud-based technologies.
With headquarters in Los Angeles and offices around the globe, the company employs over 3,500 of the most talented individuals, developers, and industry veterans worldwide. For more information, please visit www.bydeluxe.com.
About the Opportunity
The Senior Network Engineer will provide technical expertise across the Routing, Switching and Security layers within our data centres and offices whilst working closely with the London based teams as well as global members of Deluxe. They will ensure solutions are delivered according to designs, technical standards and specifications. They will work in collaboration with the other Infrastructure team members as well as the Operations, Development, Broadcast, Creative and Media teams to create detailed designs, implement solutions, document best practices, and provide business as usual (BAU) maintenance and support for the Deluxe Infrastructure (including out-of-hours work).
Overview of responsibilities:
Manage the day to day operation of network infrastructure, provide BAU maintenance and support, including out-of-hours / on-call support.
Work collaboratively with the Infrastructure, Development, Broadcast, Creative and Media teams to troubleshoot problems and provide solutions.
Participate in project work and implement technical solutions including data centre builds, hardware and software upgrades and device configuration.
Ensure solutions chosen fit within the overall Infrastructure Architecture, management systems framework, and security standards.
Document standards, best practices, and installation guides; add to the networking knowledge base.
Intimate involvement with configuration, management and troubleshooting of all network equipment, going above and beyond the call of duty when required.
Capable of independent decision making based on broad managerial direction.
Demonstrates problem-solving skills to resolve issues that span technology and culture.
Core competencies:
5 years’ experience as a Network engineer using Cisco and Juniper based devices.
Strong confidence with routing and WAN technologies such as BGP, VRF’s, and OSPF
Knowledge on with Juniper QFX switches with EVPN and VXLAN
Confidence using Cisco switches with VSS, Stacking, EVPC, VLAN, FEX and LACP technologies
Experience with security devices such as Fortinet Fortigates, Cisco ASA’s and Juniper SRX’s. This will require experience with policy design and changes, offloading, SSL and IPSEC VPN, NAT with DOS and IPS policies.
Confidence with Juniper EX switches with Virtual Chassis switches
Have thorough knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, flags and be able to troubleshoot connectivity issues using tools such as Wireshark, Iperf, Netflow to analyse and fix faults.
Configuration and optimisation of QOS
Experience with multicast technology such as IGMP, PIM and MSDP
Knowledge on fibre installations, connectors and optics.
CCNP, equivalent or higher
Strong troubleshooting experience in a fast-paced working environment.
Demonstrable use of access control and monitoring skills with AAA, Radius and TACACAS with ACS, and SNMP.
Ability to work in a challenging and demanding environment.
Some knowledge of ITIL best practice would be beneficial.

The Role
We are looking for a Senior Network Engineer who will be responsible for managing infrastructure solutions with a focus on network technology. As part of the Global Network function, a successful candidate will be responsible for prototyping new solutions, as well as providing operational support to associates in the network and infrastructure teams as required.

What You’ll Do
Responsible for Firewall (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet) and Loadbalancer administration (F5)
Become a knowledgeable source on datacenter networking, WAN connectivity and campus networking
Become an accretive member of the networking teams to enable more effective delivery of quality project outputs
Effectively target and drive infrastructure automation & streamline change and maintenance workflow
Lead and drive improvement of network operations
Mentor associates to upskill the team & work with other teams to outline solutions to drive process efficiency
Automate processes where possible to reduce manual configuration
Understand the infrastructure environment
Manage the lifecycle of a call and any related incidents, problems or change requests
Troubleshoot software and hardware (predominantly MS Office and customized finance applications)
Liaise with Support Teams to ensure any issues are logged into the call logging system and managed from end to end, with regular customer progress updates where needed
Have a methodical, analytical approach & be able to work to aggressive deadlines whilst remaining flexible to the needs of the business
Demonstrate a proactive attitude & always take the initiative in ensuring project outputs are delivered on time & to the expected quality
Effectively communicate to ensure all team members are aware of system outages, resource availability and workarounds
Work in a strong cross discipline team environment
Thrives in a pressurized high output focused environment
What You’ll Bring
CCNA / CCNP desirable, familiar with HP/Aruba product line, managed 802.1X/NAC networks
Deep knowledge in Wireless networks (Aruba/Cisco)
Proven experience with Arista networks
Experience of a scripting language (Python, perl, bash, powershell) and automation tools (Ansible, puppet, VRO, UCS Director)
Experience in security log administrator (Splunk, Extrahop Network monitor products)
Proactive, enthusiastic and output driven
Driven to develop existing, and learn new skills
Willingness to embrace and drive change
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to establish and maintain collaborative work relationships at all levels
Resilient, high energy, and unquestionable integrity
Effective verbal and written English communication skills

Are you a Network Engineer within a service provider environment looking for somewhere you can develop your skills by contributing to the planning, coordination and delivery of user services? If so, we have the role for you as a Network Engineer within Europe's leading collaboration on e-infrastructure and services for research and education.

As a Network Engineer you will be responsible for making changes to the infrastructure across a range of platforms. Using your planning and coordination skills you will be responsible for implementing network configuration changes to mitigate security threats and vulnerabilities maintaining quality standards. You will also be involved in the expansion and coding of our automation tools.

Our ideal candidate

This role would suit an experienced Network Engineer from a service provider environment with direct experience of working with Juniper MX and EX series equipment and command line interface. You will have the ability to configure MPLS based VPNs and firewall filters and you will have detailed knowledge of IP networks.

We are looking for someone who enjoys working in an open and collaborative manner. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are essential for this position as you will be required to deal directly with vendors, 3rd party suppliers and end users.

Why work for GÉANT?

We offer a blazing-fast, cutting-edge network that connects scientists, researchers and academics across Europe and the world.

Thanks to our terabit network, 50 million researchers, scientists, academics and students can share record volumes of data unconstrained by location, solving some of mankind’s biggest challenges.

Work at GÉANT and you’ll be supporting critical research into sustainable energy, deep space, high-energy physics, earth observation, environmental disasters, medicine and more!

GÉANT operates a pan-European multi-100G network for research and education users over a combination of dark fibre (10,000km) and managed bandwidth. We are in the midst a four- year upgrade project to double the number of fibre routes that will triple the total length of fibre used by GÉANT.

We are intending to increase the level of automation used in type certification of code, configuration management and service deployment. This will be achieved using industry standard open source tools such as Robot, Python, GIT, Ansible, Salt, Jenkins and Jinja2.

Benefits of working for GÉANT

You’ll receive excellent benefits at GÉANT – we offer a generous holiday allowance and a 5% end of year bonus as standard. We also invest heavily in learning to help our people become the best at what they do.

The other benefits you receive will depend on the country you are employed in, but these will include an appropriate pension scheme and medical insurance.

Cisilion OVERVIEW


Cisilion delivers next-generation IT infrastructure that transforms the way that businesses work. Cisilion is an award-winning global systems integrator and managed service provider, working with clients in over 70 countries across 5 continents. We partner with leading technology vendors including Cisco, Microsoft and Dell Technologies.

Role Overview


Office based role at Cisilion HQ, Leatherhead and subject to Cisilion shift pattern. The Service Centre Collaboration Engineer is an intrinsic part of the Service Centre and Support Services department whose primary responsibility is take ownership of respective incidents, changes and problem tickets from our 1st Line Team or Customers that have been escalated. These will need to worked on to resolution, often working in tangent with vendor support, in a timely and effective manner thus upholding our service levels.

Key Responsibilities
Work with Cisilion escalation engineers to troubleshoot and resolve complex customer problems
Analyse the nature of queries and customer problems and provide suitable solutions within SLA timescales
Respond to the ticket queue in an expedient manner, providing clear and informative status entries, resolution entries and quality assurance closure.
Establish and maintain high levels of incident ownership through incident lifecycle to a satisfactory conclusion
Create and manage problem tickets for repeat customer issues
Work with Cisilion’s key vendors to provide a resolution to customer issues
Perform changes to customer systems while following strict guidelines for compliance
Mentor more junior members of the Service Centre team
Be part of Cisilion’s On-Call rotation with the rest of the Service Centre team as applicable
Experience Required


Cisilion is a Cisco Gold Partner, supporting almost the full range of Cisco products and technologies, therefore the successful candidate must have a good, solid background in the Cisco product portfolio. Ideally CCNP collaboration, the candidate must have experience in the following areas:
IP Telephony / IPT Network Management.
Experience in configuring Cisco IP telephony applications such as Cisco Call Manager 9.x, 10.x,11.x, 12.x, Call Manager Express, Cisco Unity Connections, Cisco Unity Express, Cisco Unified Contact Centre Express, IM&P (CUPS), Jabber, Voice Gateways based on H.323, MGCP and SIP, Expressways, Attendant Console- Cisco, ARC, Cisco Handsets 78xx, 79xx, 88xx,89xx, 99xx
Extension Mobility, Music on Hold etc.
Configure, maintain and troubleshoot Cisco Unity systems
Monitor and manage the IP telephony network using Real-Time Monitoring Tool.
Sound Knowledge of SNMP protocol and NMS (Network Management Systems) testing – SolarWinds would be an advantage
Key Skills

Essential:


Excellent customer-facing skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Experience of a help-desk environment
Working to SLAs
Knowledge of troubleshooting voice quality issues
Use of SNMP-based Network Management systems and troubleshooting tools
A minimum of two-years’ experience of working on Cisco UC applications such as Call Manager, UNITY, UCCX and Presence
Demonstrable experience of producing and updating technical documentation using MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Visio)
Participation in shift pattern working after a Qualifying period
Competent analysis skills regarding call logs, SIP & Call Manager logs
Desirable:


Using ‘trouble-ticket’ applications would be beneficial.
Configuring IP SLA for monitoring
Knowledge of SolarWinds would be an advantage
Any Cisco experience in Security, Wireless, Routing & Switching would be beneficial
A large part of the role will be the monitoring and managing of customer networks. Cisilion offers excellent career progression opportunities, as the Service Centre is seen as a stepping stone into the Cisilion network consultancy team. Applicants may be screened via a technical phone interview and some candidates will then be invited for a practical assessment at Cisilion HQ.

Here you’ll be welcomed. We champion diversity and we understand the importance of our people representing the communities and customers we serve. You’ll find an inclusive environment where you can be yourself and where everyone is driven by the same purpose – helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives.

Our purpose has never been more important than during Covid-19. Our approach to keeping our people, customers, visitors and patients safe is clinically-led and in line with public health guidance.



We’ve implemented effective remote working/interviewing and safety measures across all our offices, care homes and clinical locations and we will continue to review our operating practices as the situation changes.

At Bupa, we’re passionate about technology. With colleagues, customers, patients and residents in mind you’ll have the opportunity to work on innovative projects and make a real impact on their lives.

Role Overview

A senior technical position, the IT Specialist (CCIE / CCNP Security certified) is a self-motivated role responsible for setting direction and leading the advancement of Bupa’s ITSS Connectivity organization’s technical capabilities. Expectations include an entrepreneurial spirit, innovation, sharp execution in delivering goals and objectives and driving team culture. Incorporating industry best practice methodologies in everyday efforts to continuously improve process and operational excellence for connectivity services.

What you’ll do:
Technical leadership of the support and maintenance of functions across a defined portfolio of Connectivity services
To deliver and maintain key ITIL processes in support of Connectivity services: Configuration, Release, Availability, Capacity, Financial and Service Continuity Management
Technical ownership of Risk in relation to Connectivity Services
Contribute and where appropriate lead in the delivery, review and continuous improvement of cost-effective Connectivity Service
Demonstrate cohesive activity oriented towards problem avoidance, efficient recovery from disruptions and execution and technical leadership of the Connectivity technology elements of Business Continuity Plans
Working closely with other Bupa IT teams ensure that new Connectivity services are designed, built and tested as fit for purpose, secure and strategically aligned adhering to Bupa’s Enterprise standards and policies.
What you’ll bring:
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert Routing and Switching,
Cisco Certified Network Professional Security, Collaboration, Wireless.
Proven related business experience
Proven experience with best practice methodologies for technical project management.
Proven experience with best practice methodologies for Connectivity service delivery & management for mature operational success
In-depth experience in the design and implementation of on premise and cloud infrastructures
Experience leading vendor contracts technical definition
Experience as Technical Project Lead/ consultant
Superior technical competence and demonstrated leadership
Seeks to innovate with integration of technology and services.
Recognizes potential improvement areas and takes the lead in a continuous improvement program.
We are a health insurer and provider. With no shareholders, our customers are our focus. We reinvest profits into providing more and better healthcare for the benefit of current and future customers.

Our benefits are driven by what matters to our people. It’s important to us that these benefits support a work-life balance that keeps people healthy, both mentally and physically. As a (Senior Network Engineer) you’ll be eligible for:

25 days holiday, increasing through length of service, with option to buy or sell

Bupa health insurance as a benefit in kind

An enhanced pension plan, life insurance and income protection

Annual performance-based bonus

Onsite gyms or local discounts where no onsite gym available

Various family friendly benefits

Diversity and Inclusion

Bupa is committed to making sure that every applicant is assessed solely on personal merit and qualifications. We actively celebrate the diversity of our colleagues and provide an inclusive environment so you can bring your true self to Bupa. We’ll make sure you are treated fairly regardless of disability or circumstance. That’s why we’re happy to offer reasonable adjustments as part of our recruitment process to anyone that needs them.

Whether you’ve found your feet or are discovering a new path.

Welcome to a place that celebrates you.

This isn’t where you've been.

This is where you're going.

This is what we have belief in.

Colt is the New Standard in high bandwidth network and voice services for enterprises and wholesale customers in Europe, Asia and North America’s largest business hubs. With a global reach but a deep local presence, Colt is big enough to deliver and small enough to care.

Role summary:

This person is to help us move faster without taking our eye off quality whilst we continue to develop 2 award winning B2B customer-facing Network On Demand applications, working in an Agile/Kanban model. This person will have expertise in the technologies that underpin our platform.

The team is small and nimble, and as a result has made amazing progress in the industry. The primary focus is to ensure the platform is robust and reliable, and as zero touch as we can make it.

We work in a business with other infrastructure groups, so interaction with our peers is key. Sometimes we also have to test the water with new stuff, and so there will be a need to develop spikes/proof-of-concepts to evaluate tools and approaches to ensure the evolution of the platform makes best use of new technologies and techniques

Responsibilities:
Understanding and maintaining the infrastructure platform on which our applications sit.
Guiding/directing changes to the application code, as well as test and deployment toolchains so the team can spend more time developing capability and less time thinking about infrastructure.
Estimating size of development and infrastructure improvement tasks
Contributing to work prioritization
Suggesting and analysing different approaches for building solutions.
Continuously evaluating the infrastructure for opportunities to improve through refactoring.
Running spike/proof-of-concept exercises to test a concept, new technology or technique.
Mentoring other team members on good infrastructure design and systems administration.

Amazons network is a key differentiator for Amazon Cloud Computing and Web Services (AWS), enabling the global operation of thousands of applications across hundreds of thousands of servers worldwide. As our regions continue to grow, we are looking for a Network Development Engineer to execute and deliver a large program for one of our largest strategic partners in the UK.

The pace, scale, and growth of Amazons data center platform will challenge you. Our uncompromisingly high standards and rapid innovation on behalf of our customers will push you to new levels of creativity. At this level, Amazon is unique in that we seek experienced senior leaders who have evolved to be highly strategic in their approach to managing their business unit, yet understand how to lead large teams by example who will not hesitate to roll up their sleeves when tactical needs dictate it. So, if you are customer obsessed, and are looking for a fun and challenging environment, we would love to hear from you.

Amazon is seeking a Network Development Engineer with the ability to automate day to day tasks and develop/build software and/or services from the ground up. The Network Development team drives engineering, implementation, scalability, operations, reliability, and sustainability of these next-generation networks and works on innovative ways to automate and scale our network as we expand. A good candidate must have strong Networking and System Administration knowledge, including shell scripting, and a proficiency in at least one development language or a strong understanding of Linux/Unix. They must be able to think at Amazon scale to solve problems in permanent, sustainable, and scalable ways, with an eye towards utilizing the best solution over the quickest solution.

The ideal candidate will be expected to work across the end to end process (design, engineering, implementations, operations and escalation) of our current and newly developing networks. They will aid the engineering and evolution of highly available networks and work closely with our software developers to automate network deployment and operations. They will have a proven track record of success in driving complex issues to resolution autonomously and/or collaboratively. A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is required.

This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazons world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.

In this role you will have the opportunity to:

· Work on network projects in the areas of network sustaining engineering, network deployment/implementation, network scaling, technology refresh, best practices application, and/or network optimization.
· Work closely with our software developers to automate network deployment and operations
· Maintain Amazon Web Services next generation networks for significant AWS customers by providing critical network support to diagnose, mitigate impact, and resolve large-scale networking events.
· Troubleshoot network routing, interconnectivity, platforms, performance, and configurations issues; including necessary low level application interaction, Unix systems, and new age networking software tools.
· Work closely with our Network/Systems/Software Engineering teams to ensure fast, smooth roll-out of new designs and products, as well as assist with deployment and sustaining of networking software tools.
· Maintain standards across the networking toolset and ensure that we are fully compliant to those standards and policies.
· Deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes.
· Collaborate with highest tier escalation engineers/resolvers.
· Create and review documentation and process regarding network implementation/deployments, recurring issues, new standard operating procedures, knowledge transfer material, etc.
Physical requirements:
· Must be able to work in a 24x7 team on call rotation, with ability to drive into workplace for critical events/needs.
· Travel to data centre/network sites and Amazon/customer offices as needed.
· Experience dealing with customers during problem resolution and operating efficiently under pressure.




Basic Qualifications

· A relevant degree in a related technical discipline or equivalent experience in a large scale network environment.
· 3+ years experience in a network focused hands-on technical role working with routing protocols/technologies and platforms in large scale data centre and/or WAN network environments.
· Knowledge & experience of Linux or other Unix operating systems
· Proficiency in scripting/programming with one or more of Python, Perl, Ruby, Shell, Java, etc.
· 3+ years experience in a technical on-call capacity, responding to customer impacting events, mitigating and root cause analysis of those events.
· 3+ years experience developing engineering, deployment, or operations mechanisms to support IP network and/or networking systems.

Preferred Qualifications

· Thorough understanding of TCP/IP networking, IP routing, Server Load Balancing, and Network Security architecture and core technologies such as IP, TCP, OSPF/IS-IS, BGP, MPLS, Server Load Balancers, Firewalls, ACLs, DNS, DHCP, IPAM, LDAP, NFS, etc.
· Strong desire to build, ability to multitask, sense of ownership and urgency.
· Experience with Agile development methodologies and DevOps environments.
· Meets/exceeds Amazons leadership principles requirements for this role

Job Description:
DXC Technology (DXC: NYSE) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.com
About Fixnetix
Fixnetix (a DXC Technology company) provides market data, trading access, liquidity venue connectivity, pre-trade risk and execution management technologies for Investment Banks, Hedge Funds and Proprietary Trading Firms globally, under a fully managed services model. By facilitating low latency, resilient and secure trading, DXC Fixnetix enhances operational efficiencies for the world's electronic trading communities.
DXC Fixnetix is a market leader in delivering managed technology outsourcing projects for front office IT on a global scale and is part of DXC Technology – the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, with $26bn annual revenues and a presence in all major financial markets across North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.
Job Description

Work within a network team on the planning, design, and implementation and upgrade of Local Area Networks (LANs), Wide Area Networks (WANs).
Evaluates new technologies to recommend future direction.
From time to time will work closely with internal and external teams to help successfully on-board new clients and to manage connectivity requirements for existing clients. These clients are located globally and connect to the Fixnetix Low Latency network to enable access a variety of services. The team consists of experienced network project engineers who are used to delivering multiple projects, working to agreed deadlines.
The Network team provides 2nd/ 3rd line 24x7 network support escalation for the Technical Operations Centre (TOC).
Roles and Responsibilities
Review HLD’s and LLD’s to gain a detailed understanding of the proposed work
Work with external and internal client design teams to finalise the design, and to clarify all requirements prior to implementation
Create device configurations based on finalised design
Work closely with internal and external teams, including 3rd Party Infrastructure contractors to ensure all physical aspects of the network are correctly configured.
Location of devices including any modular components
Updating data bases
Diagrams
Work closely with other internal and external teams and Project Managers. Ensuring the network elements are deployed on time and fit for purpose of the solutions being implemented
Execute and document detailed test plan prior to go-live. Remediate any issues identified during the testing phase where applicable
Produce detailed documentation of final network implementation
Provide training and guidance to support teams during transition period
Maintain client network documentation
Work and extended day, 3 shifts covering 07:00 - 19:00 Monday - Friday - 3 shifts covering
2nd/ 3rd line 24x7 network support escalation for the Technical Operations Centre (TOC).
Key Performance Indicators
Ability to deliver consistently in a project environment and to take a lead role during the delivery process
Tasks are completed correctly, on-time, and within the agreed design parameters
Compliance with internal corporate processes
Delivery against department objectives in-line with business requirements
Ability to work effectively and communicate clearly with clients, internal and, external teams
Investigating and resolving escalated incidents within SLA
Essential Skills
Demonstrable experience in networking project design and implementation
Networking knowledge up to CCNP level.
Strong Cisco switching/routing skills, good knowledge of routing protocols including EIGRP, OSPF and BGP
Multicast
Demonstrable knowledge in configuring and debugging firewalls
Experience working with Arista and Nexus switches and their associated technologies
Experience of large multicast environments within a financial organisation
Demonstrable experience of exchange/broker/ECN connectivity
Experience of financial markets and investment banking
Solid experienced with working with security and load balancing products - FOrtinet Cisco ASA, Palo Alto, and F5 LTM devices
Desirable Skills
CCNP/CCIE certification (or equivalent knowledge)
Strong experience of deploying and troubleshooting Arista switches
Knowledge of firewall technologies ideally Fortinet, and Palo Alto
Extensive experience on low-latency switches
Knowledge of Corvil latency monitoring tools

What is the job?
The core Infrastructure Support is a multi-disciplinary team within Operations responsible for providing a tertiary support function for the platforms within our control.
Primarily responsible for supporting consumer and business edge through IP aggregation, core, backbone, interconnect and peering up to and including the Data Centre (Firewall, Load balancing and Switching).
You will work as part of this high profile and functioning team, providing expert level support and delivering innovative solutions and work alongside both Data and ISP Systems Support colleagues to provide a complete E2E support function within Virgin Media.
What will you be doing?
Work with peers in Engineering and Operations to deliver the strategic goals of the Core Infrastructure platforms, from both a new service introduction and support perspective. You will also ensure that all change activity on the Core Infrastructure platforms adhere to internal Change Management policies and meet the criteria for Operational acceptance.
Provide technical leadership for network element and network management platforms in terms of repair, re-configuration, hardware & software support and use of existing technologies and practices.
Provide high level, detailed reports on ongoing complex faults, validating and implementing repair actions and contribute to project work streams & meetings, impact assessments and leads in operational readiness activities.
You will proactively identify and drive improvements in service through technology, process improvements and promote use of industry best practice. Supports problem activities in incident reviews and represents Core infrastructure Support on network programmes and initiatives.
Lastly you will maintain the integrity of the Core Infrastructure platforms in their entirety to ensure that both regulatory and compliance requirements are met eg. ISO27001, CAS(T) etc.
Are you right for the role?
The right candidate will have the following experience:
Extensive experience in supporting carrier /enterprise grade network infrastructure, Juniper, Nokia, Cisco.
Understanding of HFC, DOCSIS and CMTS technologies.
Comfortable in a multi-vendor, multi-protocol, ISP environment.
In-depth understanding of underlying network fundamentals not limited to
TCP/IP, Routing, Switching and the OSI model.
Process oriented skills for troubleshooting, problem solving and problem resolution.
Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) and the ability to adapt to technical and non-technical audiences (upto VP/MD level).
Certifications or suitable real world experience to cover Juniper JNCIP-SP,
Nokia NRS II, Cisco CCNP (R&S, SP, DC)
Previous experience in a support role in a Tier 1 Service Provider.
What we’ll provide for you:
This is an excellent opportunity to develop your skills in to the latest technologies and create leading products, services and support systems to us integrate with Liberty Global and continue both companies success.
As well as this as a package we are offering:
Salary: £50,000 - £55,000 (depending on experience) plus all the benefits mentioned below

At Meraki, we are making IT easier, faster, and smarter by building technology that simply works! Our team is passionate about innovation and delighting customers which has enabled us to grow more than 100% year over year. As a Network Support Engineer, you will be responsible for providing quality technical support for our growing client and partner base. You will diagnose problems and troubleshoot the entire Meraki product line, including our wireless access points, security appliances, and switches. Our support engineers are foremost problem-solvers passionate about networking, and we seek enthusiastic and tech-savvy individuals to join the team. Our customer-facing role will expose you to a diverse group of teams, providing endless opportunities for career growth in a fun, challenging and fast-paced environment. We're looking for people who take pride in doing excellent work, and can both teach and learn from those around them.

Responsibilities
Effectively communicate with third parties such as partners and customers regarding technical issues and customer service inquiries, both orally and in writing.
Diagnose and troubleshoot wireless, security, switching, and other various network-related issues reported by Cisco Meraki customers and partners.
Own each customer case from initial creation to resolution.
Collaborate with other support team members to fix network outages, misconfigurations, and complex networking issues on customers' devices.
Read and analyse packet captures using Wireshark.
Work with engineering and management to diagnose and resolve critical, escalated issues.
Use acquired knowledge to suggest, edit, and write in-depth Knowledge Base articles.
Stay up to date on Meraki features and technology by attending lunch and learns, participating in engineering and product team communication, and keeping up with enterprise and cloud networking trends.
Qualifications
Fundamental understanding of and hands-on experience with network technologies including firewalls, content filters, routing/switching, VLANs, and 802.11a/b/g/n/ac wireless.
Thorough comprehension of fundamental networking protocols including TCP, STP, ARP, Ethernet, OSPF, etc.
Experience supporting or testing LANs, VLANs, WLANs, VPNs, NAT devices, &/or DHCP servers.
Experience installing and troubleshooting WiFi networks
Outstanding French and English languages written and verbal communication skills and comprehension.
Ability to clearly and concisely articulate matters to third parties.
Outstanding customer service skills.
Excellent account management, follow-through, and attention to detail.
Experience in computer networking related problem solving, critical thinking, and troubleshooting.
Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
Networking certifications a plus: CCNA, CCNP, CWNA, etc.
Must be authorised to work in the U.K., position does not offer sponsorship.

Senior IP Network Engineer
With OneWeb, You'll Get To:
Be part of the technology revolution in Space
Accelerate your career through fast paced experiential learning and executive-level exposure
Work with razor-sharp colleagues in a company where people come first
Who You Are: You're a whiz in IP and a self-starter who proactively takes the initiative to ensure operational issues are resolved effectively and efficiently. You possess superb communications skills with the ability to clearly and concisely convey ideas and technical information to engineers and senior staff members. You're sparked by a fast pace and new challenges. You want to make a real difference in the world by revolutionizing technology in Space.
What You'll Do:
The Senior IP Network Engineer is a member of the OneWeb Technical Operations team operating our world class Network Operations Centre (NOC). The Senior Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful network operations across the global IP network which provides connectivity between the satellite network portals and PoPs. This includes monitoring the network for alarms and faults, and performing Fault Diagnostics, Isolation and Recovery (FDIR). The role may require shift working once the system enters into commercial service.
Duties will include:
Be the Network engineering Subject Matter Expert (SME) during over air testing and transition into commercial service.
Provide IP LAN/WAN technical leadership to network operations staff members.
Build the Alcatel Base POPs of layer 2/3 equipment 7200/7750 using both vender specific on boarding, CLI base understand the complexity of switched network traffic and how this influences the completion of layer 3 routed traffic.
Own the Network device in the operation center and collaborate with relevant team to isolate the network issues.
Lead the technical/implementation ownership on major Projects and Communicate with Network Designer and Architect.
Make changes on in-life services, considering the impact of the change and any possible outage caused, ensuring the local change control process is followed and keeping all relevant stakeholders updated.
Good knowledge of Implementation and Deployment Routing protocols and technologies, to include, but not limited to, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, NAT, DHCP, MPLS, IPSEC and GRE tunneling. A detailed and in-depth knowledge of Quality of Service both tier 2 & 3
Configure Alcatel 6250 / 6850 switches, adding NNI and UNI services, creating interfaces to test across the layer 3 IP network and changing port settings.
Advanced knowledge of circuit provisioning, testing and troubleshooting of OSPF/BGP/MPLS.
Act as an escalation point for the network managed service provider who is responsible for Level 1 & 2 fault management.
Support change evaluation and implementation on the IP network
Support situation and service at risk fault resolution and conduct post incident review
Support service transition of sites and network connectivity, define and conduct acceptance test cases and readiness reviews.
Review and evaluate Incident, Change and Problem records related to IP networking.
Collaborate with solution engineering team
Mentor Ground Support Engineers across the different GNOC disciplines.
What It Takes:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering and/or Computer Science or demonstrated equivalent experience
5 years + experience gained in a live network operations environment including senior technical responsibilities and a minimum of 8 years overall work experience in an engineering capacity.
In-depth experience with IP WAN/LAN customization and optimization in satellite / telecommunications systems
In-depth experience in developing / operating reliable and high-performing networks integrating LAN, WAN, Internet, and intranet components.
Demonstrated ability to monitor data communications components and configuring them to meet system and stakeholder needs.
Strong Linux/Unix working experience. Confident with standard CLI applications, file navigation and a good understanding of the operation of the base operating system & how applications/processes run on them.
Experience of working with Nokia products NetAct, NSP NFM-P & KPI portal and ServiceNow
Working experience of troubleshooting tools, like tcpdump/Wireshark across operating
Advanced Experience working with log files, for network equipment and unix systems, and logging applications like syslog/Splunk.

We are looking for a "hands on" Cloud Engineer or Architect to join our growing team in London.

The team is responsible for building and designing the foundations of the platform in AWS. This includes: bakery functions around provisioning and hardening, connectivity (internal and external), and cost mapping/optimization.

Your mission:

TransferWise has already pioneered new ways for people to transfer money across borders and currencies. Our customers can also manage their hard-earned money with the world's first platform to offer true multi-currency banking.

Here's how you'll be contributing to the Engineering Team
You'll be part of a small team of engineers and architects who design and build out the platform according to both strategic goals and operational needs. You'll be responsible for growing the platform in Amazon Web Services, and expanding our reach both globally and in scale.

We operate on a strong belief in full automation, programmatic implementation, and repeatable design patterns. We're looking for people who can step outside the system and come up with robust architectures, but also follow through and help implement the design; drawing on the resources across the rest of the platform tribe. Someone in-between engineer and architect would be ideally placed to fill this role.

Our AWS estate is becoming ever more complex, and we need to absorb the scale of our growing user base, whilst constantly improving our up time and availability. We also need to control costs as we grow: monitoring cost and adoption patterns of the estate, and optimizing where possible. The cloud engineer/architect will be a key driver in this regard, and will take ownership for a wide range of AWS products.
This role will give you the opportunity to:
Choose your path to impact – we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you'll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across TransferWise but you'll have the freedom to make your own calls
Be flexible in how and where you work, we understand everyone needs a little something different so we'll do our best to make it happen
Travel (when things get back to a new normal) to work with our teams in London and Budapest as well as meet various partners and organizations when needed
Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitude
What does it take?
The ability to convince and get your voice heard – you're comfortable making a case for what you want to do
Experience being a self starter and working autonomously
The mindset to solve problems from scratch
Make appropriate trade offs when it comes to design and delivery, iterate where possible – regular feedback is part of our culture
You have..
Experience with AWS products at scale and complexity
A Proven track record on architecting AWS networks
Experience with taking single-region systems global
Experience with defining service catalogs and constraints
Previous Experience with; JVM applications, Databases (PostgreSQL/MySQL)
Ran projects and are a self starter
Are familiar and have some experience around Risk and Reliability topics
A security mindset
Great communication skills,verbally as well as written
A holistic view on a lot of different moving parts, and are able to identify where you can add impact and upset the norm
Technologies that we use and would like you to have some experience with;
Terraform (module design, CI)
Ansible
Packer
VPC design/architecture
Transit Gateway
Partner VPN connectivity
What you get back:
The autonomy to solve problems your way
The freedom to have real impact
Loads of development opportunities
A fun work environment with social activities and events
The opportunity to work with super smart people
And more… Check out our offer here.

Interested? Find out more:
How we work – a practical guide
TransferWise Vlogs: Omar, Engineering Lead
Engineering team blog
How our Engineers build new features
We're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you're passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you'll fit right in.

Also, qualifications aren't that important to us. If you've got great experience, and you're great at articulating your thinking, we'd like to hear from you.

And because we believe that diverse teams build better products, we'd especially love to hear from you if you're from an under-represented demographic.

We're looking for a experienced and skilled Senior Software Engineer/Architect DevOps Engineer.
As a Senior Software Engineer/Architect you are responsible to design and develop creative, compelling, fault-tolerant and cutting-edge cloud-systems that support our mission. You will make architectural decisions based on business requirements and constraints. The role caters for the opportunity to decide on underlying technologies and controlling architectural evolvement throughout iterations of the system. That includes code optimization according to business requirements such as scalability, reliability, availability, performance, manageability and costs. Code review, maintenance and contribution will be part of your day-to-day work as well.
You will be involved in various stages of each product's lifespan and should remain abreast of technological advancements to promote efficiency. You combine technical, communication, analytical capabilities and enjoy mentoring junior staff as well as steering best practices and engineering culture.

B.Sc. or B.Eng. in Computer Science or a related field and 5 to 10 years working experience.
Hands on knowledge of how to apply software design principles (e.g. SOLID, MVC).
Experience in architectural styles and patterns (e.g. micro-service architecture).
Experience on building cloud architectures (solutions) based on distributed web principles.
Broad and deep technical knowledge of several technological stacks, cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred) and strong python coding ability.
Passion and experience in mentoring and advocating best practices.
Excellent analytical skills and experience troubleshooting complex systems.

M.Sc., M.Eng. or PhD in Computer Science or a related field and 10+ years of working experience.

Experience in machine learning libraries such as Tensorflow and Pytorch.
Proficient with large-scale data-serving/compute libraries and software, such as Hadoop, Spark, Apache Mesos, Apache Kafka etc.

26 days paid holiday per year, plus bank holiday.
A MacBook Pro, and other tech that supports you doing your work.
Participation at training workshops, 1-on-1 sessions, conferences, and events.
Regular (remote) team events as well as regular (remote) social events.
When on-site, healthy snacks and breakfast as well as coffee, tea, and drinks.

Job Description Qualifications:

An exciting opportunity has become available to join Boeing Defence UK (BDUK) team as a Network Engineerbased in Bristol, UK or Milton Keynes, UK.

Position overview:

Boeing Defence UK Limited (BDUK) is responsible for delivering IT services to a number of customers both internal and external throughout the UK. As part of this integration process, a dedicated IT capability is being supported within the UK that can draw upon the considerable IT resources of the worldwide Boeing Company to deliver complex solutions to the business and its clients.

An opportunity has arisen for a Network Engineer to support the IT network infrastructure to meet business requirements. As a part of the infrastructure team within a large enterprise environment, the role requires a broad set of skills and a high degree of flexibility and adaptability.

Position responsibilities:

Typical activities in the role of Network Engineer will include, but will not be limited to the below responsibilities:
Supporting network infrastructure changes to the UK IT and Support Chain Information Services (SCIS) programme environments in order to meet the developing requirements of the business
Supporting new and additional networks and data centre facilities
Liaising with Boeing US support groups to leverage the capabilities of the wider group
Evaluating new technologies and toolsets for use within Boeing
The job holder should not be constrained by a rigid job specification and should be willing to pick up additional duties as necessary.

Preferred Qualifications (not essential):
Proven experience as a Network Engineer with strong Cisco CCNA, CCNP or equivalent
Cisco Switching, and building resilient TCP/IP Networks, Firewall (ASA, Checkpoint, Juniper Netscreen) and VPN technologies, F5 load balancer and CISCOs ACI
Experience with network design and architecture
Experience with Software Defined Networking
Experience with dealing with customers, suppliers and teammates in a professional manner
Experience with all or some of the following: Linux operating systems, VMware, containerization, Juniper SSL, Security appliance terminology, infoblox DNS/DHCP Management, System log management and network/server monitoring
Knowledge of network technologies server computing systems including operating systems, networks, hardware, software packages and utilities, computer control languages and commands
Proficiency in the usage of standard applicable computing disciplines including change, configuration, problem, performance, and operational management
Proficiency in analyzing, managing and maintaining network topology, network devices, routers, firewall’s, servers and server delivery systems, subsystems, and components
Excellent skills in Cisco routing and Cisco switching (Ideally including OSPF and IP protocol experience i.e. SNMP, SMTP, DNS, DHCP, NTP, HTTP)
Excellent technical written and verbal communication skills
Ideally a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
The candidate should be comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels within the organization and be confident representing BDUK to external clients and partners. The role may require possible travel within the UK and possible occasional travel to the USA in the future.

Important information regarding this requisition: This role also may require some flexibility as off-hours support will occasionally be required to support service monitoring.

All information provided will be checked and may be verified.

Please apply ASAP for this role as recruitment may commence before the end date.

Important information regarding this requisition:

This requisition is for a locally hired position in the UK. CANDIDATES MUST HAVE CURRENT LEGAL AUTHORIZATION TO WORK IMMEDIATELY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM. BOEING WILL NOT ATTEMPT TO OBTAIN IMMIGRATION AND LABOR SPONSORSHIP FOR ANY APPLICANTS. Relocation is not available for this position. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not part of Boeing U.S. based payroll.

PLEASE NOTE: The successful candidate will be expected to undergo a SECURITY CHECK/CLEARANCE.

Important information regarding this requisition: This role also may require some flexibility as off-hours support will occasionally be required to support service monitoring.

Job Title: Operations Engineer I

Company Description:
Limelight Networks, Inc. (Nasdaq: LLNW) is the content delivery partner for thousands of entertainment, technology, enterprise and government entities around the globe. Limelight’s mission is to securely manage and globally deliver digital content, building customer satisfaction through exceptional reliability and performance.

Job Purpose:
The Operations Engineering team is responsible for providing advanced level 3 support for the product suite that Limelight offers to internal and external customers. The core responsibility of the team is to ensure a stable and functioning network of servers and services for all customers. The position will generally interface with technicians, developers, customers and sales teams as an escalation point and a liaison between teams. Advanced knowledge of large scale networking, http caching, streaming technologies, and *nix administration is desired. Excellent customer service skills are also a necessary component of the job. This position will involve on call support in a rotation setting and shift base queue coverage.
The Operations Engineering team is staffed 24*7 so you must be able to work 2nd/3rd shifts and weekends when asked. This position reports to the Operations Engineering Manager.

Essential Functions:
In depth troubleshooting of customer issues in a production environment. Occasionally join a live event bridge to help troubleshoot live with the customer
Deliver and document solutions to resolve escalations from our NOC in the Limelight production service environment based on severity in a timely manner
Properly document and escalate issues to Engineering and Development teams
Be able to correlate systems issues and alarms to provide feedback on problems that may occur in production
Perform tier 3 level troubleshooting of linux/unix based systems and network devices.
Maintain clear and easy to follow documentation when asked to or appointed as a subject matter expert
Be willing and able to quickly learn and research technologies and information obtained from technical documents
Qualifications:
Experience and Education (minimums)
3+ years direct hands on experience working in a support role
2+ years of networking, computer science education or equivalent work experience
1+ years troubleshooting network elements and protocols layer problems
1+ years experience with Linux or Unix administration in an operations or help-desk environment
Experience and Education (prefered)
4-year technical bachelor's degree
Cisco CCNA
Linux or Unix certifications
2+ years working in a NOC and monitoring environment
2+ years scripting experience
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Being comfortable with work from a command line interface
Basic ability to read and write scripts(bash/perl)
Knowledge of Unix or Linux administration troubleshooting methods
Understanding of DNS systems and how they function
Excellent time management and organization skills
Excellent articulation and written skills
Working knowledge of firewalls(ACLs), routers, switches, VLANs and BGP is prefered
Experience with http web servers such as apache or nginx is prefered
Knowledge of databases and ability to read and write database queries is prefered
Understanding of BGP troubleshooting methods is prefered
Advanced knowledge of TCP/IP and HTTP protocol is prefered
Advanced knowledge of DNS administration is prefered
Knowledge of streaming technologies and how they function(HLS/HDS/DASH/MSS/RTSP/RTMP) is prefered

Company Description

Kinetica helps many of the world’s largest companies solve some of the world’s most complex problems, including Citibank, GSK, OVO, Softbank, and Telkomsel, among others. The Kinetica Streaming Data Warehouse combines historical and streaming data analysis with powerful location intelligence and AI in a single platform, all easily accessible via API and SQL, for instant results. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond can load and analyze their entire collection of data simultaneously, delivering instant insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including Dell, HP, IBM, NVIDIA, and Oracle, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.

For more information and to try Kinetica, visit kinetica.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Job Description

Solutions Engineers are responsible for articulating and demonstrating how Kinetica can solve the hardest analytics problems. Interfacing directly with customers they are the ambassadors for the company and the technology. The team is composed of data engineers, data scientists, and entrepreneurs. You will work closely with all aspects of product, delivery, and sales to play a pivotal role in winning new customers, growing existing accounts, and driving company growth. You will be a trusted advisor, product expert, and visionary to a variety of users across all verticals.

We are seeking a hands-on customer-facing and hands-on Technical Solutions Engineer to lead the charge on the front lines of an exciting and disruptive, proven technology. Partner with Enterprise customers to help them power their businesses using data by designing, developing, and deploying Big Data, AI & Analytics solutions on the world's fastest GPU accelerated OLAP database.

Responsibilities:
Engage with sales prospects where you prepare and present Kinetica’s technology along with addressing any technical questions that come up during the sales cycle
Support the technical needs of existing customers including discovering additional use cases for Kinetica’s technology
Work closely with the product management and engineering team to align customer requirements to future versions and products
Have a deep understanding of Kinetica’s technology and a willingness to learn new technologies when needed
Qualifications
Technical Degree (i.e. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology)
4+ years of pre-sales experience
Strong programming skills in any of the following languages: Java, Python or C++
Experience with Linux and SQL skills are a mandatory requirement.
Strong understanding of Big Data, Data Warehouse, Data structures, Algorithms, and designing highly available systems. Ability to design & articulate enterprise architecture
Knowledgeable of and has a strong concept on databases, data warehousing, OLAP, data architecture, and data engineering
Has an experience working with MPP database and big data system (Hadoop)
Knowledge of enterprise systems and protocols is a plus. Ex: LDAP, SSO, SSL, BI applications.
Experience with Machine Learning, Neural Networks is a plus
Knowledge in Geospatial formulas and techniques is a plus
Experience working in a start-up an environment
Travel (post-covid)
Soft Skills:
Great communication skills (verbal and written)
High-energy self-starter with a passion for data, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment with limited direction
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
