When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and be part of a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.
The 2nd Line Deskside Support Engineer ensures the continued operation of desktop or laptop equipment and associated peripherals for both local and remote staff within the EMEA region.
Reporting to an IT Manager, you will manage your own time and resources to effectively meet SLA’s and support local operational activities. This is an exciting opportunity for a customer-facing IT support professional who can work independently to play a key role in providing technical support to our colleagues at our growing Swindon & Milton Park sites.

Responsibilities:
Complex hardware and software incident resolution for on-site and remote users within the defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs), utilizing standard remote-control tools.
Monitor the service management tool (ServiceNow) and updating as incidents are progressed or resolved.
Plan, coordinate and carry out hardware installation, moves, adds and changes. This will include the lifting and transporting of objects, such as computers and peripherals. Occasional inspection of cables in floors and ceilings.
Network support including port activation and extended troubleshooting working with Network Support Engineers.
Advanced Avaya user Administration and support, including Hunt Group setup and reporting
Advanced Voicemail, Video-conferencing and Meeting Room support
Advanced support and troubleshooting for printers, MFD’s and printer servers, including vendor liaison and escalation
Local Management of a File Server, Setting Shares & Permissions.
IT Manage the Thermo Fishers Onboarding & Offboarding Process.
Deliver complex project work under guidance when agreed.
Comply with Desktop Good Working Practices and wider Thermo Fisher Scientific Quality Management processes.
Present an effective, helpful and professional Thermo Fisher Scientific presence to our customers, which span a range of different departments and job roles.
Attend, participate and report on team and customer meetings.
Travel within the UK (up to 20%) which may necessitate own transport. Flexibility to support other sites when required.
Position Requirements
Previous experience working onsite in a customer facing role, providing technical support (including remote management tools).
ITIL qualification at Foundation Certificate (or equivalent)
Strong experience with Windows 10 and Windows 7.
Strong experience solving user VPN (Pulse) & Authentication (Centrify) issues (or Similar)
Strong customer management skills and professionalism.
Ability to manage own time effectively, prioritize and set realistic timescales and meet deadlines.
Excellent analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.

Desirable Experience:
Degree (or equivalent) in computer science, information sciences, or related field
Experience of DELL or Lenovo hardware support beneficial
Knowledge of virtualization technologies
Support experience with Microsoft Office 365
Understanding of current network hardware, protocols and standards
Understanding of Information Security principles
MCSA in Windows 10 preferred
Location: Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England

Job Description:
Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells high-performance distributed systems that make the business of trading and transacting money (and other financial assets) easier, faster, safer, and smarter for everyone involved. Our technology makes it simple to create, combine, and extend large-scale, high-performance intelligent systems in ways that were never before possible.

As pioneers within our industry, we hire top talent and strive to build the next generation of thought leaders. People who are naturally compelled to figure out what works and why - enthusiastic crafters, outside-the-box thinkers, and brilliant self-starters. No stuffy corporate office. No dress code or business attire (unless that’s your thing). No endless meeting schedules. We build amazing software that solves real-time problems with some of the greatest thinkers around the world, and we love doing it.

Broadway Technology is looking for a sharp Senior Network Engineer who has experience designing resilient, mission-critical trading networks infrastructure for global trading organizations. Past experience in low-latency network design and management is a must.
Broadway is a leading provider of high-performance trading solutions. We've delivered some of the world’s most advanced systems to a who’s who customer list that includes the largest global banks. Our software manages billions of dollars in transactions daily.

Responsibilities
Manage Broadway’s global trading network. Identify and resolve network failures on both switches and servers and network performance within both the trading environment and corporate network.
Ensure the security of the trading and corporate networks. Remain current on information security best practices. Recommend and implement security tools, policies and procedures.
Configure multicast networks, including Multicast PIM Sparse/Dense and IGMP.
Collaborate with customers and partner with technical teams to make changes to network connectivity.
Create and maintain documentation for network environments and user documentation for utilizing network services.
Leverage and expand use of automation across all actives to build operational scale with use of Puppet and/or Ansible.
Manage short and longer term projects while owning day to day issues to resolution, keeping stakeholders informed of the issue status.
Lights out management, maintenance, and administration of HPE servers
On call work and weekend work may be required.
Requirements
Very strong knowledge of IP routing, VLANs, Access Control Lists and Network Address Translation.
Exceptional knowledge on scripting/automation using Python, Bash and Ansible
Exceptional knowledge on Unix systems and how to utilize Low Latency applications
Exceptional problem-solving skills in networking.
Unrelenting commitment to quality and exceptional attention to detail.
Outstanding analytical and organization skills.
Knowledge of, and experience implementing, best practices to enforce network and system security e.g. ISO 27001.
Demonstrated expertise in process and system documentation.
Excellent verbal/written communication.
Strong collaborative nature and the ability to support internal and external clients.
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in telecommunications, computer engineering, or a related field.
Nice To Have
Windows or Linux administration (specifically RedHat and Centos) and troubleshooting skill sets
Active Directory management
Experience
At least 4 years of experience in a senior role, managing switches and other network equipment at L2/L3, connecting international data centers, customer sites and market partners.
At least 4 years managing production systems across multiple, global sites.
At least 3 years securing edge infrastructure with firewalls, IDS/IPS products and configuration of VPNs to 3rd parties
Network routing inside, outside and between the company and external partners.
Expertise in multiple vendor firewall, switching and routing technologies like Arista, Fortigate, Cisco or A10 Networks
BGP & BFD setup as well as demonstrated experience troubleshooting.
Analyzing network data captures with tools such as Wireshark.
VPN: between sites using IPSec as well as between users and sites.
Past experience with maintaining network configurations with version control systems.
Penetration testing experience is a plus.
Python scripting or similar.
About Broadway Technology
Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells low-latency distributed systems, primarily for use in financial applications like trading bonds, fiat currencies, and cryptocurrencies. Our software has powered the world’s most critical systems at top financial institutions and controls well over $125 trillion in business annually across five continents. Our proprietary software platform is an open, flexible, complete solution for screen and automated trading operations of any size and complexity.

Founded in 2003, Broadway has nearly 200 employees worldwide with offices in New York, Austin, London, Waterloo, Toronto and Christchurch. Our founders are industry-recognized innovators (as well as MIT and Cornell alum) with advanced CS/engineering degrees and 15+ years leading high-tech ventures.

We take a rapid, methodical approach to development; and we focus on creating solutions that solve our clients’ immediate needs, yet can evolve and scale as needs change. We believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed.

Johnsons Workwear, the UK's number 1 workwear, PPE and textile service provider is currently seeking an electrical bias Maintenance Engineer for our Letchworth site. The role will be to provide effective maintenance, repair & servicing of plant, building & equipment. We offer a competitive salary, Monday to Friday daytime shifts and overtime.
Key Tasks
Attend all mechanical, electrical, plant, equipment and building problems
Carry out safety tests as required
Open and secure premises as required
Start up and shut down processing plant, equipment and facilities
Undertake a programme of planned preventative maintenance ensuring optimum use and minimum downtime
Carry out duties as laid down in BS EN ISO 9001: 2000 / 14001 Local Working Instructions and Company Operations Manual which may be updated from time to time
Keep managers, supervisors, colleagues informed as necessary
Carry out all tasks to comply with Company policy on health and safety and COHSE requirements
Other Ad hoc duties as required
The role is Monday-Friday and Saturday mornings with occasional overtime.
Person Specification
The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role with expertise in electrical and mechanical engineering.
Who are Johnsons Workwear?
Johnsons Workwear, part of Johnson Service Group Plc, is the UK’s number one Textile Services provider. Providing truly national coverage via an extensive network of 23 local plants and service centres to around 37,500 UK-based customers, we operate in a wide cross section of industries from major blue chip companies to small local businesses. We’re leaders in driving innovation and change in our industry, focusing on our people, the changing needs of our customers, technology and process improvement. We pride ourselves on service and constantly monitor, measure and improve by engaging with customers through our Visits in Person programme, our dedicated account management team and customer satisfaction surveys. Dedicated to management development, our in-house Academy was created to nurture existing and aspiring managers who have the talent and potential to progress through the company – and many of our employees stay with us for years.
HP
Job Type: Permanent
Benefits:
Company events
On-site parking
Profit sharing
Wellness programmes
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Experience:
Electrical Engineering: 2 years (Required)
Mechanical Engineering: 1 year (Required)

A global technology business are looking for an experienced Network Engineer / NOC Engineer to provide extra support for them during a busy period. This will initially be for a 3 month period, however there may be a chance the contract will extend.
This is offered as a REMOTE WORKING contract.
They offer 24/7 support and you would work a 4 on / 4 off shift pattern.
To secure the contract you must:
Be an experienced Network or Security Engineer
Have solid understanding of TCP/IP, routing, switching, related protocols, various networking environments
Have great communication skills and professional manner
Ideally have experience with any of the following: Check Point, F5, Blue Coat, NetApp, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Linux, Microsoft Cloud Technologies
The daily rate for this contract is between £200 - £300 per day, depending on the experience and skill set you bring to the role.
This is offered outside of IR35.

At Mitel, you will have the opportunity to help businesses connect, collaborate and provide better experiences for our customers. You will deliver valuable contributions in creating business success within our global organization utilizing your unique attributes, skills and experience.
Please take a moment to look over this opportunity and if interested, feel free to send us your application. If this is not the right opportunity for you, you can also sign up for Job Alerts by creating an account. This will give you a profile that you can use for all future applications, and you will be notified whenever a new position that matches your criteria becomes available.
Mitel is seeking a Senior Network Engineer to assist in the implementation and support of Mitel's core UC data network infrastructure. As Senior Network Engineer, you will help extend the capabilities of our current network to accommodate our future growth, leverage new technologies to improve connectability, reliability and scale, and recommend solutions to issues that may arise.
The successful candidate will be a creative thinker yet a disciplined engineer, relying on both experience and intuition to make good decisions and qualified judgments. We are looking for someone who has a great positive attitude, highly intelligent, motivated to learn and grow within the organization. If you are an overachiever and want to contribute to a team that will truly appreciate your dedication and hard work, then consider a career at Mitel.
Responsibilities:
Provide high-level / detailed design solutions and support function for network connectivity to and from MiCloud UC data centers globally
Provide technical services and support for the following areas, WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security, internal systems, cloud and network infrastructure
Performs network maintenance, upgrades and refreshes by conferring with vendors; developing, testing, evaluating, and installing enhancements
Perform interoperability testing with internal and external network relevant vendors
Responsible for the creation and maintenance of technical documentation to ensure it is updated and current.
Configure and troubleshoot network compontent, routers, swtiches, optical transport, and other network equipment
Maintains a healthy network by managing and providing network performance statistics, including availability, utilization, throughput, and latency to NOC systems
Work with the business side to understand their objectives and account for them in the system design.
Work with internal and external 3rd party vendors i.e. software and systems engineering teams to understand and implement technical requirements
Configure and manage Automation and SDN tooling
Configure and troubleshoot VMware virtualized network components (NSX)
Participant of a rotating on-call schedule
Mentors junior staff
Requirements:
Ten or more years hands-on networking experience
Must possess excellent working knowledge of design & implementation experience for data networking, routing & switching, subnetting and network segmenting with large scale enterprise network
Must possess a demonstrated excellence in common Network Infrastructure and topology, LAN/WAN, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, and Network Monitoring tools
Ideal candidate will have experience building and maintaining an internal MPLS network including BGP-TE, LSPs and VRFs.
Experience using automation and IaC tooling, such as Ansible Tower, Rundeck, Terraform, etc.
Proven ability to troubleshoot complex issues related to hardware, L3/L2 deployment, application behaviors and TCP stack
Strong knowledge of routing and switching concepts and technologies (MPLS, OSPF, BGP, PIM, EIGRP, VXLAN)
Experience working collaboratively with Engineering Directors, SysOps, DevOps, SREs, and Administrators
Experience working with datacenters, 3rd party vendors, and IaaS vendors.
Ability to manage multiple, often competing, priorities and tasks and follow through to completion on strict deadlines
Ability to use discretion and judgment in evaluating problems and creating solutions for Members.
Strong communicator able to effectively communicate technical information, both verbal and written, to a wide range of end-users, including non-technical audience
Self-motivated with enthusiasm and ability to develop technical skills and take on additional responsibilities in order to add value to departmental and Mitel's mission and goals
Knowledge of Cloud provider architecture (AWS/Azure/Google) preferred
VOIP Engineering experience a plus.
Unix administration experience a plus.
Ability to be on call or assure critical incident response 24x7x365
Education:
BS in Technical or Engineering field (or equivalent) required
Current Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) or higher in Routing and Switching and/or Wireless Networking
Network/Security certifications a plus
VMware Certified Professional – Network Virtualization (VCP-NV) a plus
Mitel is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. Diversity makes sense for us, for our customers and for our future. We value different perspectives, skills and experiences, and welcome applications from all sections of the community.

Fitzrovia IT provide you with a range of ongoing tailored solutions to increase efficiency, decrease outgoings, minimise system downtime and boost your performance.
We believe that prevention is always far better than a cure so we offer strategic support plans that are both proactive and flexible allowing us to eliminate problems before they occur so you can maintain your competitive edge.
When it comes to developing your core information systems, our experts know what is best for your business.
Our goal is for our clients not to have to call our support staff because we have provided such robust solutions they have nothing to fix!
Job Description
Purpose of Job:
You will take a supporting role in the in the management and resolution of customers technical issues, as well as taking a proactive stance in improving the managed services delivered through additional Fitzrovia services and effective Problem Management. This role may require the successful candidate to work from a remote office in Hammersmith or Fitzrovia’s main office in Fitzroy Square.
Job Specifications:
Experience:
· Microsoft Server 2008 – 2016
· Exchange / AD Management / 0365
· Windows 7, 8, 10
· Networking – Switches & Routers (Cisco / HP / Netgear)
· Firewalls (SonicWALL / WatchGuard)
· Apple OS and Apple Mac support experience
· Microsoft Office Suite
· Backup Technologies
· Laptop/desktop and thin client support
Desirable Experience
Cisco / Apple / Microsoft Certified
Linux Support
Person Skills
§ Highly Motivated
§ Can do attitude
§ Attention to detail
§ Excellent communicator
§ Proven client service skills
§ Ability to work under pressure
Main Tasks and Responsibilities
Provide a professional and customer-focused service through the life cycle of each ticket; manage customer expectations by keeping customer informed of progress.
Recording all IT Incidents, Requests and Problems, ensuring all relevant details are captured in line with Service Desk standards.
Classify calls accurately with the information provided and prioritise in line with the Service Level Agreement (SLA).
Investigate and diagnose Incidents by providing first line telephone support, gathering and analysing information to identify and resolve a range of technical Incidents such as hardware, software, application and network Incidents with the objective of restoring normal service as quickly as possible.
Liaise with third party suppliers where necessary, logging tickets and act as a central point of contact.
Monitoring and tracking Incidents, Requests or Problems, escalating where necessary to other resolver groups, or line Manager.
Log and assign tickets and monitor workloads for the other Service Desk team members.
§ To maintain a professional discipline within the team by adopting the procedures applicable to the department and role
Upon management request you should be willing to perform duties outside normal business hours, e.g. on-call service or overtime.
Any other duties required from time to time as requested by your line Manager or the Board
Additional Responsibilities:
Incident Management using Fitzrovia’s Service Management toolsets, at all times ensuring your cases contain timely and comprehensive updates
Respond to alerts received from the pro-active monitoring toolsets
Perform vendor and management escalation of customer issues in a timely and appropriate fashion
Develop excellent working relationships within Fitzrovia, with customers, partners and suppliers, ensuring that the reputation of Fitzrovia is upheld at all times
Proactive management of customer systems, enabling incident management and system performance to be maintained in accordance with defined SLAs.
Contribute to and maintain managed service documentation

Company Overview
Gigaclear is a high growth company delivering fibre-optic broadband to underserved rural communities in England. Started in 2010, the company is now backed by large institutional investors and is expanding rapidly across England. With head offices based in Abingdon, Oxfordshire and a significant proportion of staff based in the field Gigaclear currently has over 400 employees and is pursuing ambitious growth plans.
Network Operations looks after the customer network and is responsible for maintaining both the physical and logical services to our customers, reporting direct to the Chief Technical Officer we’re a lean and efficient team who utilise peer reviewed process and supported tools and documentation to keep our customers network live 24/7/365, teamwork is paramount and as such we form strong bonds to ensure success not only for the company, but for the individual members of our team.
Purpose of the job
The role of the 2nd Line Support Engineer will be to ensure the healthy running of our WAN via reactive fault resolution on our cabinet switches and routers and proactive jobs to update software and firmware. This role will be responsible for owning cases escalated from the 1st line support team and resolving within pre-agreed SLA’s, liaising with technicians and customers to ensure speedy resolutions. The NOC will be moving to a 6am-9pm shifts operating model in the near future and the potential candidate should be prepared for this. There is also an on-call duty requirement (once every 3-6 weeks)
Key Responsibilities
Complete day-to-day network administrative tasks.
Assist in the provisioning, managing and auditing of new cabinets.
Create documentation that support customers and aid fault resolution.
Remote support of customers with typical ISP issues.
Liaising with third party contractors and other departments within Gigaclear.
Must be able to work autonomously and within a team.
Managing major incidents across the network
Resolving problems in a calm and systematic way.
Interaction via e-mail & telephone with our customers will form a major part of this position and the successful candidate will be an able communicator with excellent written & verbal communication skills.
This person must be able to prioritise workload between multiple customer incidents or enquiries.
The person will be included in the on-call rota after their training has been completed, which is compensated separately.
Knowledge & Skills
Essential
Network operation, including routing, VLANs, RSTP, Ethernet
Understanding Router/Switch configuration
Troubleshooting Routers, CPEs, NTEs and Switches
An in-depth understanding of OSI layers 3, 2 and 1
Knowledge of Home IT, i.e. home networks, servers, email, Wi-Fi access points, Ethernet over power lines, etc.
Knowledge of Linux / Apple Mac / Windows systems is desirable
Ability to translate technical language to non-technical personnel and customers
Capability to operate in a changing environment and to drive significant changes into the organisation
The ability to work under pressure
Desired
Ability to influence, negotiate, persuade internal and external customers at all levels.
Strong communication and decision-making skills ability to balance conflicting interests.
Proactive individuals with a flexible and adaptable approach to their work and a proven track record demonstrating that they are - Team player, strong influence and relationship management skills, and customer centric.
Ability to build and maintain strong ongoing business relationships.
Qualifications
Degree qualification in a technology discipline e.g. Computer Science, Networks, IT. With a minimum of 2:1 or equivalent experience desirable.
CCNA qualification or equivalent.
ITIL awareness an advantage.
Our Values
Find a way - we will work together to deliver market-leading solutions and provide customer service excellence to our communities
Do the right thing - we always base our decisions on what we believe is fair, considerate and in the best interest of our customers and our colleagues
Be committed - we are all accountable for our actions and work relentlessly with our many customers to deliver on our promises
Keep it simple - we take potentially complex and confusing information and we make it easy for everyone to understand
This job description is not intended to be exhaustive. The post holder will be expected to adopt a flexible attitude to the duties which may be varied (after discussion), subject to the needs of the business and in keeping with the general profile of the role.
Gigaclear is not currently engaging with any external recruitment agencies or suppliers for this role. Gigaclear has a preferred supplier list of Agencies / Suppliers with whom T&Cs have been agreed and Gigaclear will only accept CVs from these suppliers for roles we have formally requested they work – this request will come from a member of the HR team. Any speculative CVs submitted without this request will be deemed property of Gigaclear and may be engaged with directly without Gigaclear being liable for any “introduction fee”.

Monday to Friday

G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. The role

The Low Latency Engineering Group is responsible for a low-latency trading system that forms a critical part of a global investment platform. The group includes teams responsible for market data and Linux engineering, order entry, and order execution functions.

The group produces software which runs in stock exchange co-locations around the world. The scale of our deployment, and the tight performance and reliability requirements of our platform, mean we put a premium on timely and correct delivery of market data.

We are looking for a Market Data Engineer to join our growing team. As a company, G-Research interacts with many exchanges globally and a multitude of data providers meaning you would have extensive interactions across the industry.

Managing our market data infrastructure, feed connectivity and data licensing

This role is well suited to a technical Market Data Engineer looking to expand their horizons into the commercial side of market data, or to get exposure to a breadth of asset classes across a diversified range of data feeds.

Experience in designing, running and troubleshooting Elektron/TREP/DACS infrastructures

Excellent communication and documentation skills

Enable and enhance security configuration and DevOps practices through close collaboration with Azure DevOps and by providing secure design patterns, and a hands on security engineering capability. Supports the definition and implementation of security requirements.
Deliver security automation in the CI/CD pipeline via leadership, process automation and tooling.
Implement continuous security control testing, and improvements to monitoring of Azure security events and alerts through optimisation and automation.
Increase visibility of security threats and configuration weaknesses by optimising the configuration of cloud native security tools, e.g. Azure Security Center, SQL Server Advanced Data Security, and Azure Sentinel.
Reduce security vulnerabilities and configuration weaknesses through standards and increased awareness.
Use security risk metrics to enable DevOps and security to report on threats and the cyber security controls.
Additional responsibilities
Security Operations and Assurance requirements are enabled through Azure event alerting, and controls testing
ESSENTIAL
Deep understanding of Azure data protection and security architecture, and features including Security Center and Secure Score, Ddos attack mitigation, Azure Front Door / Web Application Firewall, Azure Key Vault, Network Security Groups, Azure AD Identity Protection and Privileged Identity Management
Good understanding of Azure Iaas, serverless architecture and Azure Cloud Platform services, Application Service Environments, Service Fabric, Azure functions, Azure API Management
Hands on Azure security configuration and scripting skills.
Experience with build and deploy technologies such as TeamCity, Octopus, Bamboo
Demonstrable experience and execution of security automation, and configuration of Azure cloud native tools to maximise their effectiveness
Ability to apply security principles and good practice to manage risk, e.g. authentication, role-based access, encryption
Collaborates to develop close working relationships with DevOps teams to build/deploy secure solutions and automate security in the CI/CD pipeline
Able to communicate complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Microsoft Azure certifications, e.g. Azure Security Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, Azure Solutions Architect.
DESIRABLE
Understanding of FCA and PCI data security control requirements
Developer background can code and understands development methodologies and frameworks
Hands on experience of technical security vulnerability assessments and penetration testing using Burp Suite, Kali Linux or similar
AWS cloud platform skills and knowledge, e.g. AWS Config configuration.
Personal Attributes
Builds partnerships through collaboration and being part of the solution
Able to influence peers focuses on risk and the why, and communicates complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Challenges conventional thinking and demonstrates a continuous improvement mindset

Job Title: Network Architect EMEA - Telecom Systems Business
Job Description:
Network Architect, EMEA - Telecom Systems Business
An exciting opportunity for an experienced Telecom Network Architecture to join a growing team with a charter to sell, and deploy solutions to the rapidly growing 5G Telecom market segment .
Showcasing excellence and innovation at every stage, Product Management is responsible for the cross-functional management of products or solutions through their entire lifecycle. Using a wealth of technical and industry experience, we work across functional areas to implement our products or solutions. We undertake thorough analysis of the markets to ensure we maximize profitability and adjust our product strategies to respond to competition. Our role also involves acting as subject matter experts for internal and external product events or partner meetings.

Join us as a Network Architect in our Telecom Systems Business team in the UK to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you will achieve:
The Network Architect role combines Telco industry knowledge and technical expertise, a broad range of consulting capabilities, and innovative business and technology solutions to drive co-innovation and network transformation initiatives with Tier 1 Telecom Operators. The Telco Network Architect provides innovative thought, strategic guidance and technology expertise to enable new business opportunities. The Network Architect will lead client technical engagement and accelerate their transformation journey by positioning Dell Technologies Telco solutions and services capabilities.
Lead technical aspects of new business development with Tier 1 Telecom Operators across EMEA. Develop, propose and coordinate co-innovation projects in close alignment with the Telco BU strategic product & services roadmap and regional/account level client executives.
An evangelist for the client’s specific business and technical issues and demands and translate them into architectures & solutions delivered by Dell Technologies
Develops, maintains and cultivates strong customer relationships at all levels, with special emphasis on architects & Executive level Network/IT leaders
Develops trusted and meaningful client relationships through a deep understanding of Key Business Issues within their account base and alignment to key Dell Technology Solutions
Is the lead technical expert with an emphasis on pre-sales motions and scoping of the customers vision through Dell Technologies Solution development
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
10+ years of technical pre-sales and architecture experience for large enterprises and Telecom Operators working with global clients on multi-year Network/IT transformational engagements that scale over $50M+ in investment value
10 years in technical role, as an architect, R&D systems, product management and/or related area. Experience with 4G and 5G Networks including radio access network (RAN) technologies and solutions
Strong technical background in Mobile Networks architecture include 3GPP core and radio access network. Working knowledge and direct experience with 5G 3GPP standard (Release 15-17) and 5G O-RAN Alliance and TIP architecture, ecosystem, market dynamics and solutions
Solid understanding or practical experience with data center technologies including: Virtualization, Cloud-Computing, Storage, Networking, IT Operations Management, etc.
Strong understanding of financial aspects of Network/IT which include but is not limited to; planning, capital & operating expenses, and asset capitalization.
DESIRED SKILLS
Desirable to have expertise related to business applications, business process management, application integration, database management, application development, data analytics or converged/virtualized IT infrastructure as an architect, systems engineer or consultant in Telecom or related industries
Ability to deliver business outcomes and provide Influential leadership of virtual, matrix and cross-functional team
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.
Application closing date: 29th November 2020

Job Title: Field Service Engineer - Reading or Guildford
Job Description:
The Zonal group are one of the UKs largest technology providers to the hospitality industry. Our products are used by over 11,000 pubs, restaurants and hotels. Customers include national brands like Pizza Express, JD Wetherspoons and All Bar One.

We provide our customers with the solutions they need to make their business a success. These solutions include mobile apps for ordering and web apps for engaging with consumers either through loyalty or reservations. By linking these solutions to Zonals EPoS (till) system, we help hospitality brands to understand their customers behaviour and preferences, enabling them to excel in an increasingly competitive market.

If you have booked a table or hotel room, ordered, and paid for food and drinks, received loyalty offers, or downloaded your favourite hang outs app, you will likely have used a Zonal product.

We are a family business with Scottish roots. We operate from our modern head office in Edinburgh to our Marketing Technologies Division in Staffordshire, or our Innovation Centre in Abingdon and hotel management solutions base in Cardiff.

What youll do

Maintain Zonal products at sites around the UK and abroad according to Company standards of customer service, Service Level Agreements, and Health and Safety requirements.

The Technical Service Department consists of the Technical Support, Technical Consultancy, Repair Centre, Production, Warehouse and Service Engineer teams (reporting ultimately to the Operations Director).

Support is provided based upon the SLAs in place with the customers. These are monitored on a daily basis and reported back to the customer at regular intervals.

Responsibilities will involve:-
Daily liaison with the Engineering Scheduler. Close calls with the Engineering Scheduler as soon as these are completed.
Provide the Engineering Scheduler with regular updates on progress, details of any other relevant issues, or further action to be taken.
Diagnose and/or repair faults on site or remove to workshop for more thorough repair.
Carry out programme upgrades on site.
Carry out Data copies if required to preserve critical data.
Liaise with the R&D department during product trials: report any problems that occur during installation, usage or removal to ensure which require further attention.
Full and detailed completion of all appropriate paperwork.
Present a positive Company image.
Provide a timely, polite and efficient service.
Provide on-call cover on evenings and weekends on a rotational basis.
Ensuring the delivery of product features into product releases at the required level of quality
Pro-actively participating in the full development lifecycle
Monitoring and reporting on the production usage of the product to help identify areas of weakness/risk
Championing expertise to ensure quality of product throughout all stages of the development lifecycle
Who you are

Essential:-
You will live within a 10 mile radius of either Reading or Guildford
Minimum 18 months experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally in the hospitality/leisure industry.
Background knowledge in computer hardware (pc's, IP networks and WIFI)
The ability to provide 5 years of continuous past work history and satisfactory references to enable the candidate to obtain an airport pass successfully.
Clean driving licence is essential.
PC literate (all MS Office suite) and aptitude to pick up new software packages quickly.
Planning and organisational skills; able to establish efficient and appropriate plans for self and others and adapt quickly and effectively to unexpected changes whilst still ensuring objectives are met. Customer service; understands and responds to customer needs (internal and external) and exceeds expectations where possible.
Communication and team working; works co-operatively with others to achieve a common goal and communicates information in a clear, concise and accurate manner.
Problem solving and decision making; analyses information appropriately in order to find best solutions and takes a balanced view to reach logical conclusions and make relevant decisions. Commercial and organisational focus; demonstrates understanding of overall business and commercial issues facing company.
Commitment to results; is committed to obtaining results through taking responsibility, demonstrating a positive attitude and ensuring quality is built into work.
Desirable:-
EPoS background
Experience of maintaining and installing EPoS equipment
3 years or more experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally within the hospitality/leisure industry
What we value

Passion, Teamwork, Innovation and Professionalism are the values we believe make us the company we are. Were looking for someone who understands great culture and will help us shape it as it evolves.

The Network Security Specialist is responsible for implementing, supporting and maintaining all IT Infrastructure within including but not limited to servers, networking, firewalls, client devices, VoIP and other equipment and systems.

The post holder will lead on all Cyber Security protection plans for the Trust and ensure that the Trust risk is minimised at all times. This will involve developing and managing processes and procedures for this purpose.


Technical Support: Participate and help to co-ordinate the provision of second and third-line technical support for all IT Infrastructure including Windows Server and Client Operating Systems, VMware, VMware Horizon View, Windows Terminal Server, SQL and all versions of Microsoft Office to maintain and improve the operational effectiveness of the Trust IT systems. The post holder will be expected to act as technical lead to identify and implement solutions to problems affecting IT services within the Trust.

Server Configuration: Installation and maintenance of Windows based server systems, hardware and software upgrades in line with Trust standard.

Systems Administration: maintenance, upgrades, administration and documentation of server systems within the Trust and perform regular housekeeping tasks on all major systems. This will include configuring and monitoring the backup processes on all servers, and carrying out restore operations as required. The post holder will be expected to use their own initiative to identify potential problems with arrangements for system administration and suggest and implement potential solutions.

System Patching: To supervise and oversee the updating and patching of all systems to minimise the cyber security risk to the Trust. To ensure that adequate testing and monitoring are in place.

Network Services Support and Management: Use technical skills and tools to carry out defined tasks associated with the planning, installation, upgrade, operation, control and maintenance of local and wide area communication networks. The key emphasis will be on maintaining maximum availability of supported services.

Project Management: active participation in IT projects arising from the Trusts Digital Strategy and business plans. This will include project management of small projects and working with a project matrix management structure.

To work within an ISO 20000:1 certified management system and ensure all appropriate actions are undertaken including change and release management, problem management and incident management

IT Procurement: Providing advice on selection and purchase of IT equipment for the Trust and ensuring adherence to agreed technical standards. Obtaining quotes for supply of goods and services from suppliers in accordance with Trust Standing Orders.

Supplier liaison: Logging and monitoring progress of support calls with third-party maintenance contract suppliers. Co-ordinating, monitoring and reporting performance of suppliers in terms of contract terms and value for money.

IM&T Security: ensuring that the requirements of the IM&T Security Policy are adhered to, including password expiry, disaster recovery, closing security loopholes and access levels. Reporting to the Head of ICT all security-related events on the IT systems in the Trust. Ensure adequate antivirus solution is maintained and updated on all clients used on the Trust network.

Ensure that all Trust security systems such as firewalls, antivirus and policy defined networking is up to date, secure and effective.

Analyse, log and action all CareCERT and other relevant security bulletins to improve the cyber security assurance of the Trust.

Procedures and Documentation: contribute to the production of documentation for operational, system and user procedures and guidelines on all major supported Trust systems.

Infrastructure Development: Monitoring current usage and assisting determination and recommendation of system upgrades required to maintain performance of systems and networks in the Trust as well as to take account of planned changes in usage.

Training Support: input into in-house user and system training and development programmes (e.g. master classes, course evaluation, skill transfer guides etc.).

Customer Service: Ensure that support calls logged to the server team are handled effectively and efficiently in line with the departmental SLA.

Osterley (remote)
About the client
Fancy working with Europe's largest entertainment organization? They excite and inspire customers with leading innovations and technologies in the entertainment industry. They strive to be the best for customers and the people working for them. They are always looking for ways to improve. That spirit has made us them what they are today, and it will drive them to become what they want to be tomorrow.
Role
The team are working on a number of key projects, including a new insights app for our exec team, and require an experienced SRE who can help create a CI/CD pipeline and ensue all our infrastructure is fit for purpose, supportable and well monitored. We use Google Cloud Platform, including many of the GCP provided services, such as GKE and Cloud SQL.
Key Responsibilities & Duties
Support development teams in all the traditional areas covered by a DevOps Engineer, including troubleshooting systems, networks and applications. Candidates should aspire to be the "go to" person for any technical infrastructure requirements.
Design, build and deploy a CI/CD pipeline to ensure our developers get their code to production efficiently and safely, while meeting all modern DevOps practices.
Be proactive by improving application monitoring, developing convenience tools for the Development Team to use, mentor the team to a level necessary to provide out of hours support (based upon a rotation rota) and act as second line support when on the support rota.
Mandatory Skills
Strong experience with Terraform, K8s, and related containerisation and IaaC Technologies
Cloud System Administration experience, ideally in Google Cloud Platform
Extensive CI / CD experience
Experience in an Agile environment
Extensive experience of working with Development teams / Developers
Must possess excellent clear communication skill
Desirable Skills
Config management (Testing and Automation )
GCP technologies (GKE, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Dataflow)
CI/CD (Understanding Pipeline design for CD/CI )
Networking (deeper level knowledge of Networking and deploying Software Defined Networks/ VPCs)
Storage Management (Storage Provisioning, LVM, Raid-levels, NFS, Object-Storage, Block-Storage etc.)
Containerisation & Container Orchestration ( Kubernetes/Swarm/Mesos)
Cloud Platforms (architecture design on Cloud Platforms)
Monitoring (Implementation of Monitoring Solutions / Metric Driven alerting)
Logging (ELK)
Scripting / System-Programming (Python is preferable, Bash, Go, Java)
Databases (HA/Clustering, Optimisation)
System Administration (Patching/Upgrading/RCA/Performance Optimisation)
Security (SSH / SSL / TLS / HMac / IPS / IDS)
IT Architectural (Low-Level design)
Suitable candidates should submit their CV in the first instance

A Financial Services client of mine, based in London, are looking for a Lead Network Engineer to join their growing team. This role will be reporting into the Network Manager.
About the Lead Security Engineer Role:
The Lead Network Engineer role reports directly to the Network Manager within the IT Operation and Engineering team for Networks. The Networks team is responsible for all networking within the client in relation to both Data Center and Enterprise including Firewalls, Routers, Switches, Load Balancers and Wireless.
The Lead Network Engineer provides non-managerial leadership within the Network team, taking responsibility for promoting technical excellence and consistent implementation to provide a high performing and stable network for the client's needs. The Lead Network Engineer has oversight of the implementations through reviewing and contributing to HLDs and LLDs as well as ensuring that the delivered solutions are fit for purpose and consistent with the intentions of the design. The Lead Network Engineer also has oversight of the operational incident process, highlighting issues that need more attention and taking ownership when escalation is required. The Lead Network Engineer represents the Network team during the technical review of changes. The Lead Network Engineer also represents the team in the absence of the Network Manager
Responsibilities:
The Lead Network Engineer has the following responsibilities:
Reviewing and contributing to HLDs and LLDs
Reviewing and approving Changes including running the Network TRB
Responding to Incidents and providing escalation as necessary
Identifying issues within the network and recommending appropriate remediation/solutions
Identifying and tracking software versions and recommending upgrades
Identifying potential for improvements within the network and recommending appropriate steps.
Encouraging the use of automation and scripting to streamline build/delivery
Encourage knowledge sharing within the team
Produce, maintain and review operational documentation.
Required knowledge and level of experience:
Career history and work experience within financial services or similar environment is a critical requirement for this role.
The successful candidate should have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a large financial organisation
Expert knowledge of the following
Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, Routers
BGP, OSPF, STP, vPC, Port-Channels, IP
Solid knowledge of the following: Arista Low Latency Switching and Tap Aggregation, Fortinet Firewalls and Management, Cisco ASA Firewalls, Check Point Firewalls
VXLAN, DNS, HSRP, VRF, Multicast, VPN
Knowledge of the following desirable:
A10 Load Balancers, F5 DNS, Cisco Wireless, Riverbed AppResponse, Corvil
Strong understanding of network enterprise monitoring solutions and associated operational support processes, preferably Solarwinds, Arista CloudVision
Strong understanding of integrating network devices with Security Incident and Event Management tools, preferably HP Arcsight
Ability to identify automation opportunities and have hands-on experience of tools such as Ansible Tower and Python to deliver efficiencies for the network team and dependent stakeholders.
Significant exposure of working within an ITIL governed environment
Note: The role requires participation on an on-call rota for escalation and resolution of out-of-hours incidents, for which overtime is paid.
If the above is of interest please call me on 0207 509 8040 to find out more (if you cannot get through to me please email darius.goodarzi@Robertwalters.com). Alternatively please apply to this ad and I will come back to you within 24-48 hours.

A Financial Services client of mine, based in London, are looking for a Lead Network Engineer to join their growing team. This role will be reporting into the Network Manager.

Salary: £45-50k dependant on experience

If you would like to join an industry recognised organisation at an exciting time, please send your CV and a cover letter to techrecruit@technimove.com

DESCRIPTION:
Technimove’s strong reputation for delivering excellence has resulted in the world’s leading Data Centre providers and a further 5,000 enterprise organisations, utilising our services globally.
Technimove’s continued expansion with the sector has resulted in this exciting role, one that would suit a dynamic, career minded individual. If you believe this is you and are looking for a company where your ambition will be matched and efforts appreciated and rewarded, then please read on.
THE ROLE:
This is an exciting and challenging role to complement and grow our highly successful UK based team. You will engage will all areas of our Technimove family. From supporting our Pre-Sales in project scoping, planning with Project Managers through to Operations in delivering the service to our clients.
You will be the main contact for clients for our networking service offering, giving you the opportunity to utilise your network and security knowledge to assist clients with a wide variety of datacentre implementations both large and small
A key part of this role will be the training and mentoring of engineers, who would make up the networking team.
Knowledge of a variety of datacentre infrastructure & cloud services would also be an advantage. Experience with working on a variety of both wired and wireless solutions with knowledge of Cisco, Juniper, HP, DELL and other vendors is essential to be successful.
The role will allow you to shape and grow with the company over time and further to career and goals.
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS
Ideally, you will have over 10 years’ experience in designing, implementing, and supporting the delivery a variety of network solutions to clients. Related data centre / infrastructure experience will also be considered. Networking Certification is required.
Proven hands-on network and security experience CCNP or equivalent, higher understanding of networking protocols (e.g., GRE, IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, QoS)
Hands on experience with Configuring and installing various network devices and services including; routers, switches, firewalls, VPN, GRE, QoS
Hands-on experience with monitoring, network and security diagnostic and network analytics tools
Excellent customer service and Communication skills and documentation.
Flexible working, self-motivated with the drive and determination to succeed.
Proven experience working and delivering networking solutions to clients in the field.
Full UK drivers’ licence

If you would like to join an industry recognised organisation at an exciting time, please send your CV and a cover letter to techrecruit@technimove.com

IT Engineer | London | circa £45,000

We’re looking for a highly capable 2nd / 3rd line Engineer to join our newest client; an IT Service Provider and their expert team, based in East London.

THE BASICS:

This is a new and exciting role for someone to help to take the lead on many of the processes, projects and migrations as well as offer a point of escalation for the helpdesk.

If you have solid IT experience and if you like working with people coupled with a passion for solving problems in a varied role then please be in touch. Supporting and developing processes across a range of different desktop systems; and utilizing Cloud/Azure-based environments will make up part of your role. You’ll also gain lots of exposure to different systems and have an opportunity to focus on things that you’re passionate about.

THE TECHNICAL STUFF:

Engineers with good customer service skills, excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude will be of interest. Excellent organisational and time management skills, with an attention to detail, and extensive desktop experience will also be sought after.

Experience with networks and firewalls will be a big advantage, and hands on demonstrable experience around Exchange 2007 : 2016, Microsoft Windows Server 2008 : 2012 / 2016 and Microsoft Windows 7 : 10 operating systems will likely result in an immediate interview request.

Exposure to Azure & Office 365 & GSuite migrations & deployments and an ability to troubleshoot, manage and deploy Hyper-V or VMWare will hold you in good stead.

A technical understanding of deploying Microsoft technologies especially support for on-premise server environments; implementing systems, building infrastructure, solving problems and a strong background in supporting users/clients and systems through remote and on-site support is what we are looking for.

THE NICE TO HAVES:

If you have experience with Cisco firewalls and other networking equipment and / or any experience migrating systems to the Cloud (Office 365 & Google); VPN / remote users / site to site support we’d like to hear from you TODAY.

THE CONCLUSION:

If you have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent advanced studies / training and several years’ experience in an IT support environment, coupled with a certified MCP (Microsoft Certified Professional) – ideally working towards further Microsoft qualifications – then this is a place where you can thrive and have fun, within a supportive, stimulating and nurturing environment.

Contact Jonothan Bosworth for more information.

About Us
We are an IT organisation serving a private portfolio of international businesses principally focussed on shipping, real estate, energy, banking and investments, located in central London and New York. Our business interests span Europe, North America, Australasia, the Near East and Asia.
The Role
Responsibilities

Network and Security Operations
Manages and administers the day-to-day operations of the Local and Wide Area Network and VoIP systems.
Maintenance and management of on-premise equipment.
Provide design, engineering, and architectural support to manage the network infrastructure, including technical requirements, analysis, design, and implementation of WAN, LAN, and VoIP.
Install, configure, administer, and maintain all Aruba switches, Ubiquiti Wireless Access Points, and Palo Alto and Fortinet Firewalls.
Be a member of the Office365 security team.
Provide Level 2/3 network support and troubleshooting.
Analyse existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the infrastructure.
Establish pro-active monitoring & optimal network performance.

Property Standards and Implementations
Assist in the creation of property technology standards.
Lead the planning, design, and implementation of network, firewalls, telco, and security systems in new or refurbished properties based on property technology standards.
Vendor management (Low Voltage, Security, etc.)

Digital/Cloud Evolution
Contribute to our ongoing on-premise to cloud migration, to minimize our on-premise environment.
Decommissioning of on-premise equipment as appropriate.
Participate in Office 365 migration/implementation; managing Microsoft updates, assessing the impact on the group.
Maintaining security of Office 365 configuration once the integration is complete.
Administration of Group standardisation for the Office 365 configuration and administration.
Acceptance of new Office 365 features into service.

Other Responsibilities
Deliver on a variety of technology projects.
Document workflow and processes.
Establish and maintain Change Management processes.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Operational Infrastructure Support
Maintenance and management of remaining on prem infrastructure (firewalls, networks etc)
3rd line infrastructure support
Out of hours on call rota supporting 24x7 operating business
Key Accountabilities
More About You

Strong business stakeholder management.
Professional and positive, with good customer-facing practices.
Analytical and diligent, with attention to detail.
Resilient: The ability to cope successfully under pressure and with shifting priorities.
Articulate, transparent, with excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English.
Effective collaborator and communicator at all levels, who use their initiative and shares skills.
Be a self-motivated, self-sufficient, enthusiastic team player.
Achieve results and targets – “Can do attitude” with initiative and drive.
Be willing to travel – locally and internationally, as required.
Skills & Experience
Experience and Qualifications

Experience in Physical Networking.
PowerShell scripting
VMware, Veeam, Aruba Switches, Fibre switches, Network Technologies, Firewalls.
Have Knowledge and experience with cybersecurity technologies such as Mimecast, Darktrace.
Microsoft 365 (SharePoint/Teams/MS Office/Office 365/Enterprise Security/Intune/MDM/MAM).
Windows 10 / Windows 2016/ Mac / Linux.
Telephony (PBX / Mobile / VOIP, A/V systems (audio-visual).
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies such as Azure and AWS.
Active Directory Azure and On-Premise Active Directory, GPO, Exchange/Exchange Online, SQL
Experience with authentication and single sign-on tools such as OKTA and Microsoft Azure Active Directory.
A degree in computer science or related technical field with a minimum of 5 years of proven in-depth infrastructure experience is preferred.
Other
Values & Behaviours

Values expected from each employee

Psychological safety
Humility (not most important in the room)
Trusted (credible, capable and act in the best interest of others)
Respect difference and others
Integrity (honest, reliable, fair)
Accountability (deliver on promise)

Core behaviours we are looking for in perspective employee

Service mindset/ business partner
Accessible 24/7
Teamwork and collaboration – always thinking who else needs to be involved
Creative, work with ambiguity & challenges
Self-starter – hit the ground running
Inquiring, learning & improvement mindset
Transparent and open to new ideas whilst respecting difference of opinion/viewpoints
Business acumen – understand how business works
Resilience & adaptability

Utility Warehouse is an award winning multi-utility provider, our core offering is simple: all your utilities, one monthly bill. Our network of 45,000 partners add the human touch to our delivery, help us get the word out to our existing members and bring in new ones. We consistently win the Which? awards for our service and don’t believe “good enough” exists when it comes to customer satisfaction.

We’ve got the culture and focus of the earliest stage startups with the resources and strength of an extremely profitable and loved brand. Our eyes are on meteoric growth over the next few years. All the pieces to make it happen are here, we need you to help us put them together.

Our philosophy revolves around getting things done and we only hire people we can trust to do that. Bring your A game and you’ll always get ours. If you’re the type that can deliver you’ll be rewarded with small, fully autonomous teams that have real ownership of their products using a cutting edge stack in a best-idea-wins meritocracy. If that doesn’t quite cut it, we can throw in flexible and remote working (no, really) with top of market compensation.

As for the tech we use: the best tool is the right tool. Go and React are our bread and butter but nothing is stopping you from reaching for something else if it does it better. We deploy to Kubernetes across both AWS and GCP with some help from Terraform. We run a mature event sourced microservice architecture using Kafka, NATS and GRPC. As much as is possible we code in the open on GitHub. If it can be open- sourced, it shall. If we can submit a PR instead of building our own, we will. Getting your hands dirty from the top to the bottom of the stack isn’t a promise to be broken, it’s a requirement. If you’re only good at parts of it that’s okay, we’ll quickly make you good at all of it.

Exposing a wealth of untapped data streams to power product insights and improve customer experience.
Supporting and extending our new service management, billing and provisioning platforms

Network Engineer (Ultra Low Latency Data Centre CCIE) *Remote Interview*. Algorithmic trading firm is seeking an Ultra Low Latency Network technologist to work on complex and interesting systems as part of a global team.

As a Network Engineer you'll provide solutions across the company's global colocation estate including infrastructure in 22 Data Centres across the world encompassing all aspects related to collocation sites: site access, equipment procurement, logistics, contract management, capacity management (power, space, servers, network ports, etc.), performance management, service availability, connectivity, compute and market data delivery.

You will architect, engineer and deploy ultra low latency network infrastructure including overseeing and carrying-out installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, optimisation and documentation of all network hardware, security hardware, software and connectivity. You will also get involved with managing multiple projects and be responsible for configuring / optimising the network to ensure ultra low latency is achieved for intraday trading and direct market access systems, providing exchange, broker and managed service providers connectivity to support market data delivery and order execution.

Driven by technology this company is able to offer a remote interview and onboarding process during the current social distancing measures.

Requirements:
Strong Network engineering and project delivery experience
Advanced knowledge of routing and switching protocols; strong experience with Multicast: PIM, RP, MSDP, IGMP
Experience with Unicast: OSPF, BGP, NAT, IPSEC and GRE
Experience with Switching: STP, PC/vPC/MLAG, CDP/LLDP, QoS, HSRP/VRRP, VLAN/VxLAN
Indepth experience with Arista and Cisco network switching, routing hardware and software
Expert knowledge of network monitoring PCAP decoding tools landscape (Corvil, SFlow, timestamping (PTP)
Knowledge of Algorithmic/DMA/HFT and trading platforms and how the trade lifecycle operates
Solid understanding of market venue, exchange protocols (binary, FIX, ITCH,OUCH, Pillar, etc.) and trading systems across multiple asset classes
Strong scripting and automation experience (Python preferred)
Excellent communication skills; ability to perform under pressure and detail oriented
Likely to be degree educated and / or CCIE certified

As Network Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £120k) plus significant bonus and benefits package.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Network Engineer (Ultra Low Latency Data Centre CCIE) opportunity.

IT Infrastructure & Network Engineer

You will have the opportunity to work on one
of a variety of our programmes and projects, helping us to design, develop,
integrate, manage and support complex systems and combat sub-systems for in‑service
and future submarines. This may include the development and support of our
land-based integration, test and reference facilities.

There are a number of different and
interesting roles, depending on your specific area of expertise and levels of
experience but you will be working with us to ensure that our technical IT
solutions are clearly defined, integrated, configured, controlled, delivered
and accepted. You will understand relevant maritime legislation, industry &
defence standards, which will help us to ensure that our solutions are
correctly configured, protected and safe to operate.

You will have knowledge of the IT marketplace,
including products and suppliers and the direction of potential future
technologies, in order to able to support business planning and decision-making
for new design activities and the implementation of change.

Your main responsibilities as an IT Infrastructure
& Network Engineer will involve:

Understanding
the functional and technical requirements for the submarine combat system, products
and test facilities and environments and be able to design, configure test and
support the supporting IT and computing infrastructure. Work with other
engineer specialists to understand the impacts of security and safety controls
on the IT system design, architecture, components, interfaces and data.

Implementing
and delivering desktop and server hardware, installation, configuration and
maintenance. Have an awareness of software defined networking.

Providing technical guidance and support to other
engineering teams during the submarine design, build and system installation
and integration activities. You will have or develop an understanding of the
customer Operational Defect (OPDEF) and maintenance processes to be able to
provide specialist advice as required.

Using your knowledge of current and potential
future potential technologies in the marketplace to understand and be able to
provide advice on the implications for sub-system design in a submarine.
Your skills and qualifications:

Essential:

Degree level qualification (or equivalent
experience) in relevant IT or STEM subject (Engineering/ Physics/ Maths/
Science).

Knowledge of the system
engineering lifecycle and be able to apply good systems engineering and IT practices
to your work

Understanding of relevant engineering standards,
including safety and environmental regulations
Desirable:

Experience of working in
a customer-facing and/or supplier engagement role.

Member of appropriate
professional institution; Chartered Engineer or working towards Chartership.


What we're looking for in you:

We welcome people with
experience of the military, defence and maritime industries, who can use their
knowledge and learning to help us ensure that we provide the best products into
submarines. We are also keen to work with people from other industries,
technical fields and working environments who can bring in innovative and fresh
thinking and work with us to participate and contribute to the important work
that we do.

We are looking for
motivated people who can take responsibility for their own outputs and be
confident working autonomously and in a structured manner. You will be capable
of supervising others will have strong written and verbal communication skills.

Location: Frimley, Weymouth,
Bristol, Portsmouth, Barrow-in-Furness dependent on role and your personal
circumstances
Salary: Competitive

Benefits: Our employees receive an excellent
benefits package which includes a competitive pension scheme, enhanced annual
leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan. We also offer a
range of additional benefits such as flexible working, an employee assistance
programme, Cycle2work and many local and national employee discounts. Some
employees may also be eligible for an annual incentive.
BAE Systems


BAE Systems is one
of the world’s leading global defence, security and aerospace companies. We
work at the cutting edge of technology, creating more than 100 new inventions
every year for customers in over 100 countries

Complex Systems and
Support:

Complex Systems and
Support (CS&S) is part of BAE Systems Submarines. We predominantly
supply to the UK MoD but with smaller derivative work done in support of
international Customers. Our team is responsible for system design, build
and/or procurement of the major electronic and mechanical systems on a
submarine, as well as provision of test, integration and support services.

Innovation is
central to our DNA and has produced the Common Combat System (CCS) to address
the customer’s affordability, technology and capability challenges. It is based
on commercial off-the-shelf technology (COTS) coupled with bespoke military
hardware and software and is being progressively rolled-out into the UK's
Submarine flotilla.

We effectively
incorporate rapidly evolving, commercial technology, new capabilities and
changes coming from the operational environment into long-term build,
maintenance and in-service programmes.

As a 'system of
systems' integrator we work closely with our Customer, partners and suppliers
to develop and provide innovative, intelligent and value for money
solutions across all classes of UK Submarine both in build and in service
with the Royal Navy, ensuring our submariners always have world-class, safe,
capable and available products.

BAE Systems is an equal opportunities employer. We value diversity and
welcome applications from candidates from all backgrounds. We particularly
welcome applications from sections of the community which are currently
under-represented at BAE Systems, including women, BAME and applicants with
disabilities. Please note we will not use any personal information relating to
your background at any stage of the application process.

Please be aware
that many roles working for BAE Systems will be subject to both security and
export control restrictions. These
restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous
nationalities you have held, and/or your place of birth may limit those roles
that you can perform for the organisation.

Due to the volume
of applications we receive, we sometimes close our vacancies early. It is
therefore advisable to apply as early as possible if you would like to be
considered for a role with BAE Systems.

Customer Service Engineer

Who are we?

Hyperoptic is the UK's hyperfast broadband network. Founded in 2011 to shake up the UK broadband market, we're leading the way in full fibre technology. With hyperfast speeds 14x faster than the UK average, and rated excellent on Trustpilot, we're changing the way people are experiencing broadband.

Ranked in The Sunday Times ‘Tech Track' 100 fastest growing technology companies for the fourth year running, winners of ‘Best Superfast Broadband' provider for six years in a row at the ISPA Awards, as well as ‘Best Customer Service' and ‘Best Business ISP' in 2019.

We are looking for a Customer Service Engineer who goes beyond the expected. We believe in working smarter, together, meaning we work collaboratively to find smart solutions that balance agility and excellence. Our team stays focused by rising to the challenges of a fast-paced environment while remaining focused on what's important. Our people passionately strive for excellence by paying attention to detail and working for continuous improvement. In short, we're looking for a Customer Service Engineer who demonstrates our values. Does this sound like you?

What will you be doing?
Delivering an excellent customer experience for the customer and ensuring Health and Safety is a priority when working on site, taking into consideration your own safety and that of customers
You will take ownership of any site issues and work with others to ensure that a resolution is found and documented
Team working is an important part of working as a Hyperoptic engineer and you will need to build good working relationships across the business
Identifying problems / issues and escalating to your Field Team Manager to ensure that continuous improvements are made to the business and processes
What are we looking for?
“Right on the day” is key to a customer's journey, ensuring we install our product discreetly, in line with installation process and their service is fully working before leaving
The ability to identify a problem and solve is crucial when attending any service related work, it's imperative we fix our customers “Right First Time” to ensure service is resumed with minimal delay
Delivering an excellent customer experience for the customer is paramount and is measured by our internal CSAT survey following a visit along with Trust Pilot Reviews
We're committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees – in fact this is at the heart of our company culture and values. We welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.

What happens next?
You apply.
We carefully review your application over a decent cup of coffee.
We'll get back to you. Even if it's a no (at the moment).
And don't forget to keep an eye on our careers site as we're growing fast: https://careers.hyperoptic.com/

We look forward to hearing from you!
