Job Title: Senior Network Engineer (Client) - Star Wars IP
Job Description:
NaturalMotion’s Action Strategy Group (ASG) is a BAFTA-nominated team developing an exciting new Star Wars™ game, running live operations on Dawn of Titans and developing a third unannounced game, all from our London studio.
We are a tight-knit team, with a sociable culture and a strong team identity whilst being able to experience all the benefits that come from being part of NaturalMotion and Zynga. The team crafts world-leading, mid-core games on a foundation of trust and camaraderie.

In 2018, 2019 and 2020, NaturalMotion Studios were named one of the Best Places to Work in the UK games industry by gamesindustry.biz.

JOB PURPOSE:

We are looking for an experienced client Network Engineer to work on our new UE4 Star Wars game. We are looking for an engineer who excels at networking and multiplayer systems work for games, including real-time Unreal Engine client-server multiplayer networking and communications to general server services. You will have opportunities to contribute at both a systems level and a gameplay level.

Key Roles & Responsibilities
You will help drive the design and implementation of underlying networking systems, building on the functionality of the Unreal Engine and our own server services
We are a close-knit team, and you will collaborate to create systems for both real-time gameplay and massively multiplayer events and progression
Ensuring the creation of well-designed, adaptable, and testable software, including some work on automated tests
Working with both the UE4 client-server architectures and our internal Central Tech SDKs
Gathering and sharing knowledge across our Action Strategy Group
Required Experience & Skills
You have developed and released multiple games with Unreal, and at least two games as a client multiplayer network coder
You have deep experience with C++, plus a thorough understanding of low level comms libraries and associated threading challenges
You are a good authority when it comes to network systems engineering
You document your code with concise overview descriptions and guides
Have good understanding of system design patterns, memory/performance optimisation, and how to document knowledge
Desirable Experience & Skills
Experience with real-time multiplayer games
Experience of live game incident resolution
You have worked on action or strategy games in the past
What Do We Offer?
Competitive salary, discretionary annual bonus scheme and Zynga stock allowance
Contributory pension scheme
25 days holiday, plus public holidays and Christmas shutdown
Private medical care and healthcare cash plan
Life insurance and critical illness insurance
Discounted gym membership and free weekly yoga class
Flexible working hours
Free fruit, snacks & soft drinks provided daily, as well as free lunch on Fridays
Annual season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Summer and Christmas parties and Happy Hour every Friday
Natural Motion is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, religion, pregnancy, marital status or veteran status.

What's involved with this role:
Interim Senior Network Engineer (Authentication Switching Network) - PSR 1JP00027966 Pay Rate: Up to £440 per day pay range subject to IR35 status You will be working as the main technical resource in a small project team delivering a number of significant enhancements to the LANs on the campuses at RAL and DL. These include, but are not limited to:
Implementing 802.1x
Configuring and installing routers to provide additional resilience in the LAN
Reconfiguring of a number of routers which receive an uplink from older hardware which is due for retirement
Participating in a workstream to present options for a core network design to provide scientific networking to our campuses for the next 10 years.
You will need extensive experience of IP routing and switching and be able to demonstrate extensive knowledge of the implementation of 802.1x. There are some repetitive changes to make and the successful individual will need to be able demonstrate the ability to perform repetitive tasks accurately, with significant attention to detail, over long periods of time. You will report to the STFC Network Technical Architect and will also be accountable to the Project Manager for this programme of work. You will be expected to contribute in regular design and evaluation sessions with an external Network Security consultancy, as well as with a number of internal network specialists. You will be expected to work autonomously to implement changes which have been signed off by the project. In order to free up permanent staff to work on the project there will also be a requirement for them to take on business as usual activities which might equate to 25% of their time. For BAU duties they will report directly to the Sustaining Delivery Manager. Working within a change controlled environment the individual is expected to deliver the required changes to harmonise and strengthen the configurations of multiple FortiNet firewalls running within our organisation. You will be expected to communicate with people across our organisation with differing levels of technical knowledge. You will be accountable for all of the communication with system administrators affected by the changes that are being made to the firewalls. You will be expected to produce high quality documentation of the changes to the systems that they undertake. Essential requirements: Technical Skills:
Strong trouble shooting and fault diagnosis skills, including the use of packet analysers
IP routing and configuration of routers (Mainly HP and Extreme)
Network switches and configuration of switches (Mainly HP and Extreme)
TCP / IP protocols v4 and v6 Personal Skills and Qualities
Strong ability to think creatively, to accept change and seek continuous improvement
High level of drive, enthusiasm and focus on the achievement of goals. Ability to utilise organisational systems effectively
Good inter-personal skills, particularly in communication and contribution to team motivation and problem solving
Proven people management skills, normally founded in some training, and with potential for further development
Self-identification with the organisation. The reflection of STFC values in attitudes
Able to absorb and convey technical information and communicate effectively at all levels to both technical and non-technical audiences
Able to assess, evaluate and prioritise particularly when under time pressure
Ability to produce clear and concise written operating procedures and documentation
Able to work on own initiative and supervise others
Be organised, methodical and able to plan
Good communication, facilitation and listening skills

Position: Network Engineer (3rd Line)
Location: Central London (zone 1)
Start date: asap
Role type: 6 month FTC

Salary: £60-65K + 15% pension + 10-15% bonus + healthcare + life assurance + 25 days holiday

The Client

Our client is an industry leading Plc organisation based in the Central London who require an Network Engineer (3rd Line) join an existing team of highly proficient network team. Applicants will need to have the requisite communication skills demanded by a FTSE100 company.

The Role as Network Engineer (3rd Line)

The position as Network Engineer (3rd Line) entails responsibility for implementing and maintaining all aspects of a multi-site network infrastructure. There is a broad range of works including trouble shooting, maintenance, back-ups, project work and BAU. The role requires an energetic, engaging, dynamic and passionate individual with an excellent attention to detail to work on the following;

Duties;
Supports recovery of the infrastructure environment in the event of system failure or disaster
Provides 2nd and 3rd line support to analyse, diagnose and resolve infrastructure issues
Proactive fault finding, including the identification and elimination of single points of failure and security weak points
Utilising, implementing and configuring appropriate monitoring solutions to proactively find and resolve issues before they become user impacting
Work with other members of the infrastructure team to diagnose, analyse and resolve multi component infrastructure issues
Ensuring that identified issues are being driven to resolution
Investigates and follows both industry best practices and contributes to technical standards
Manage and liaise with 3rd parties to provide timely resolutions to support issues
Experience required for the role as Network Infrastructure Engineer (3rd Line)
Understanding of networking and distributed computing concepts, TCP/IP V4 and V6, IP addressing/subnetting, LAN/WAN, DHCP, DNS, VPN, NAT, Routing, P2P circuits, BGP/OSPF, Switching and Firewalls, server virtualization, client/server applications, disaster recovery and business continuity
Extensive knowledge of network security, threat detection and mitigation
Extensive knowledge of implementation and support of Ethernet networks (Enterprise level) with firewalls, routers and switches from vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint.
Extensive knowledge PKI, certificates and related authentication technologies (RADIUS, NPS etc.)
Practical knowledge implementing security using VPN technologies including IPSec, SSL VPN, and encryption.
Practical knowledge of On-Prem -> Azure and AWS connectivity including VPC and NSG
Knowledge of Wifi technologies including WLAN controllers
Working knowledge of tools including SIEM solutions, Solarwinds, PRTG, Cat Tools, syslog, SNMP, Visio Dark Trace and Wireshark
Working knowledge of, and ability to support network products from a wide variety of vendors including Cisco and Checkpoint

An Audio Visual Engineer with strong networking experience is required by our Design & Technology client based in Bracknell, Berkshire. This is a home based role for the right individual. A salary of up to £35k basic is available plus excellent training and benefits.

In this varied role, you will be responsible for onsite installation for client technical requirement covering Audio Visual Systems and hardware, networking to various interfaces, server set up and connectivity as well as configuration and support. You must have a solid knowledge of Server Management and Network Infrastructure and will ideally come from an Audio-Visual technical background.

You perform responsive or proactive schedule onsite service repairs, schedule and perform on site preventive maintenance. You maintain customer relations via phone/e-mail, or available service tools, and perform customer visits on a regular basis to assess product/service satisfaction and to promote any new product ideas or current product improvements.

Solid networking experience (Cisco / Juniper / VLANS)
Driving licence and willingness to travel 3 to 4 days per week, plus occasional EMEA travel

This position requires regular onsite visit for support and installation with clients. You must have a full UK driving licence.

Utility Warehouse is an award winning multi-utility provider, our core offering is simple: all your utilities, one monthly bill. Our network of 45,000 partners add the human touch to our delivery, help us get the word out to our existing members and bring in new ones. We consistently win the Which? awards for our service and don’t believe “good enough” exists when it comes to customer satisfaction.

We’ve got the culture and focus of the earliest stage startups with the resources and strength of an extremely profitable and loved brand. Our eyes are on meteoric growth over the next few years. All the pieces to make it happen are here, we need you to help us put them together.

Our philosophy revolves around getting things done and we only hire people we can trust to do that. Bring your A game and you’ll always get ours. If you’re the type that can deliver you’ll be rewarded with small, fully autonomous teams that have real ownership of their products using a cutting edge stack in a best-idea-wins meritocracy. If that doesn’t quite cut it, we can throw in flexible and remote working (no, really) with top of market compensation.

The Energy squad is responsible for providing the systems that allow UW to integrate with the energy industry and function as a large Energy supplier; the frontend systems that allow our operational staff to manage the UW energy supply base and the systems to provide information and accurate energy billing to our customers. The team’s primary goals are to improve the operational efficiency of the operations and customer services teams by providing innovative and simple to use software solutions; ensure business continuity as a supplier by providing robust industry integration and regulatory compliant systems and build the platforms to allow UW to become an innovator for customer offerings in the Energy supply market.

As for the tech we use: the best tool is the right tool. Go and React are our bread and butter but nothing is stopping you from reaching for something else if it does it better. We deploy to Kubernetes across both AWS and GCP with some help from Terraform. We run a mature event sourced microservice architecture using Kafka, NATS and GRPC. As much as is possible we code in the open on GitHub. If it can be open- sourced, it shall. If we can submit a PR instead of building our own, we will. Getting your hands dirty from the top to the bottom of the stack isn’t a promise to be broken, it’s a requirement. If you’re only good at parts of it that’s okay, we’ll quickly make you good at all of it.

Role Overview:
We are recruiting a Senior DevOps Engineer for the Rebellion Group. Based in our studio in Oxford, you will be an essential part of the Web team. The successful applicant will have considerable experience in a DevOps role and be passionate about robust testing and deployment processes. You will be able to work with developer specifications and show initiative in suggesting and implementing improvements to existing setups.
A bit about the company:
Founded in 1992, Rebellion is one of Europe’s biggest independent studios. Its flagship Sniper Elite series is renowned for its authentic stealth and sniping gameplay with more than 20 million players worldwide. 2000AD is synonymous with the absolute finest in British comic book art. With the acquisition of a $100m film studio and the world’s largest archive of English language comics, Rebellion continues to grow from strength to strength.
What you'll be doing:
Expand, improve and maintain the existing CI and testing of web applications and services
Improve and increase the level of automation in the existing build and deployment processes
Actively participate in architecture development, planning and build for new projects
Pro-active communication of technical problems and issues
Ensure the highest possible availability of live systems under your remit, including willingness to work out-of-hours in urgent circumstances
Maintain comprehensive site and system level monitoring coverage across all hosted services
Adhere to company software standards
Implement and enforce company security standards
What we're looking for:
Significant linux server administration experience (Debian familiarity desirable)
Strong ability in scripting (Bash and PHP desirable, python and perl beneficial)
Good understanding of network protocols (including SSL), firewalls and routing
Experience with nginx, php-fpm, mysql/mariadb (memcache, redis, beanstalk, elastic also desirable)
Experience with deploying and configuring PHP applications in multiple running environments
Familiarity with virtualisation technologies (such as Xen, VirtualBox, Vagrant)
Hans on experience of configuration management and remote execution software (such as Salt, Chef, Puppet)
Experience with cloud technologies and infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, Digital Ocean)
Version control implementation and management experience (gitlab and gitlab-ci experience desirable)
Good problem solving skills
Clear communication skills
Ability to work well with individuals and teams
Desirable Skills:
Experience with maintaining Java applications, in particular ELK
Experience utilising web APIs to automate tasks
Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence
Previous experience of using application containers (docker and kubernetes) and canary deployments
Holiday: 26 holiday days annually, increasing with service to 31 days, plus national public holidays
Private Medical Insurance: Our PMI scheme offers comprehensive cover to access private medical treatment, taking the stress and strain out of waiting for treatments via the NHS
Pension Contribution: Tax efficient salary sacrifice contributory pension scheme where Rebellion matches 4% of salary, plus 10% of any contribution you make
Healthcare Cash Plan: Cash-back on treatment costs, from flu jabs to chiropractors
Dental & Vision: Cash-back on routine or emergency costs, free eye tests
Income Protection: Financial help if unable to work due to illness or injury
Critical Illness: Financial help if diagnosed with critical illness
Life Assurance: Financial security for your loved ones at a difficult time
EAP: Wellbeing hub, including confidential telephone support and counselling
Active Rewards: Earn discounts and other perks for physical activity, from trainers to cinema tickets
Gym Membership: Discounts to over 3,000 participating UK gyms, pools & fitness events
Loans: Interest free, tax-free loans
Relocation: Assistance with relocation planning and costs
Cycling Cycle Scheme: Save around 30% of the cost of a new bike and equipment though salary sacrifice tax & NI savings, spread repayments over 12 months
Discounts: 50% off most 2000 AD merchandise, plus Active Rewards and more through health schemes, from high street retail to holidays
Referral Bonus: Up to £2k bonus for internal staff referrals that lead to hires
Flexible Hours: Flexible start and finish times
Great Friendly Culture: Friendly, creative and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and recognition of the importance of work-life balance (anti-crunch)
Social & Charity Events: Annual Summer BBQ & Christmas Party, social groups such as photography and board games, charity events including football, go-karting and supporting Special Effect
Digital Freebies: GDC Vault access, all Rebellion Steam titles, digital copies of 2000 AD and Rebellion Publishing comics, graphic novels and ebooks, physical game and film libraries
Reference ID: RO428
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
DevOps: 2 years (Preferred)

Network Engineer / Technical Lead (Cisco CCIE BGP OSPF AWS) *Remote Interview WfH*. Would you like to take on a senior, technically challenging position at a hugely profitable Hedge Fund whilst remaining hands-on with technology? You could be managing a global network for a hugely profitable trading firm whilst remaining hands-on with technology, continually learning and earning significant bonuses.

As the Network Engineer / Technical Lead you will manage and deliver operational support for a globally distributed network of offices that operates 24/7 across four continents. You'll collaborate with Network Engineers to design, maintain and implement on-premise and cloud (AWS) networks to support BAU activities; perform network configurations, upgrades and hardware replacements and liaise with third parties and internal software engineering teams on Information Security, Auditing and Risk. Your role will be a mix of project based worked and support of BAU activities; an initial project will be to migrate to Prisma. You'll provide technical direction and leadership but won't have direct reports.

Driven by technology the company is offering remote interview and onboarding process with a gradual return to the office planned for around Spring 2021, then going forward you'll be based in Wimbledon in modern offices with a range of facilities and a friendly team atmosphere with casual dress code and flexible working hours.

Requirements:
You have expertise with Infrastructure and / or Network Engineering Design
You have a CCIE certification or equivalent understanding and troubleshooting experience of network layers, routing (BGP, OSPF), IP protocols and application behaviours
You're experienced with developing cloud network architecture and defining end-to-end Network as Code deployments
You have automation experience with PowerShell plus one of the following Python, Terraform
You have experience with a broad range of technologies and vendors including at least some of the following: AWS, Palo Alto, Prisma, Cisco, Load Balancers: Riverbeds, HA Proxy, Monitoring, Windows, Linux
You are a confident and pragmatic communicator, comfortable collaborating with global colleagues and stakeholders

As a Network Engineer / Technical Lead you will earn a competitive salary (to £100k) plus significant bonus and benefits package.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Network Engineer / Technical Lead (Cisco CCIE BGP OSPF AWS) opportunity.

Network Engineer (Ultra Low Latency Multi-cast) *Remote Interview*. Ultra Low Latency Network technologist sought by algorithmic trading company to work on complex and interesting systems as part of a global team. You'll be based in modern, open plan offices with all the latest kit and 360 views of the City; driven by technology the company is able to offer a remote interview process and onboarding during the current social distancing measures.

As a Network Engineer you'll provide solutions across the company's global colocation estate including infrastructure in 22 Data Centres across the world encompassing all aspects related to collocation sites: site access, equipment procurement, logistics, contract management, capacity management (power, space, servers, network ports, etc.), performance management, service availability, connectivity, compute and market data delivery.

You will architect, engineer and deploy ultra low latency network infrastructure including overseeing and carrying-out installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, optimisation and documentation of all network hardware, security hardware, software and connectivity. You will also get involved with managing multiple projects and be responsible for configuring / optimising the network to ensure ultra low latency is achieved for intraday trading and direct market access systems, providing exchange, broker and managed service providers connectivity to support market data delivery and order execution.

Driven by technology this company is able to offer a remote interview and onboarding process during the current social distancing measures.

Requirements:
Strong Network engineering and project delivery experience
Advanced knowledge of routing and switching protocols; strong experience with Multicast: PIM, RP, MSDP, IGMP
Experience with Unicast: OSPF, BGP, NAT, IPSEC and GRE
Experience with Switching: STP, PC/vPC/MLAG, CDP/LLDP, QoS, HSRP/VRRP, VLAN/VxLAN
Indepth experience with Arista and Cisco network switching, routing hardware and software
Expert knowledge of network monitoring PCAP decoding tools landscape (Corvil, SFlow, timestamping (PTP)
Knowledge of Algorithmic/DMA/HFT and trading platforms and how the trade lifecycle operates
Solid understanding of market venue, exchange protocols (binary, FIX, ITCH,OUCH, Pillar, etc.) and trading systems across multiple asset classes
Strong scripting and automation experience (Python preferred)
Excellent communication skills; ability to perform under pressure and detail oriented
Likely to be degree educated and / or CCIE certified

As Network Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £120k) plus significant bonus and benefits package.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Network Engineer (Ultra Low Latency Data Centre CCIE) opportunity.

Systems Administration experience in the below;

IT Engineer
At Amazon, we strive to be earths most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the worlds brightest minds, offering them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for customers. Innovation and creativity are built into the DNA of the company and are encouraged at all levels of employment. Every day we solve complex technical and business problems with ingenuity and simplicity. Were making history and the good news is weve only just begun.

Amazon has an immediate opening for an IT Engineer to support our buildings throughout the UK that handle millions of items from tens of thousands of vendors, and ships them across the globe each day. The successful candidate will know how things work in his/her areas of responsibility and keep changes under control. You will build and operate infrastructure environments and will provide critical input to ensure that the platform is designed with operability in mind. You will make sure that all work around infrastructure moves forward successfully. As no two days are the same in Amazon you will thrive on changes and embrace ambiguity. Please note that frequent travel will be required in this role.
Since we believe that diversity improves teams, we are looking for people of different gender and age and with different backgrounds and experience.
Amazon seeks individuals who are willing to Work Hard, Have Fun, and join us in making History.
What makes this team a great place to work?
· Day 1 opportunity You will be joining a team that is responsible to what happens after the customer clicks buy.
· Opportunities for growth - You will have the opportunity to manage build & deploy projects, involved in the pre-delivery of the environment and ensure that continuous improvement and innovation is at the forefront of what we do.
· Scale New Heights- With the fast pace growth of our fulfillment network, you will be working on challenging and complex problems to help us scale and grow the service to meet our customer demands.





Basic Qualifications

· Experience communicating technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
· Professional experience in networking infrastructure and system integration.
· Experience with core Internet technologies
· Experience with IT infrastructure components
· Experience establishing what drives quality and world-class customer focus and attention to details.
What will YOU bring?
· High degree of ownership in all matters within the IT infrastructure but not limited to.
· Experience in deployment and ability to work with 3rd party vendors.
· A new and curious mind-set, always looking for changes to improve the status quo no matter how good it may be.
· A curious mind-set that always question: what we can do better. .
· A true team player that is happy to share knowledge and work together as a team to always innovate and improve how we work.
· Proven ability to lead and inspire the team to deliver on complex tasks
· Analytical skills with attention to details



Preferred Qualifications

· Industry certifications such as Cisco (CCNA, CCNP), Microsoft (MCP, MCSE), Linux (LPIC-1, LPIC-2).
· Experience in the administration of heterogeneous network environments with Microsoft Windows and Linux based clients and servers
· Experience in IT asset management and purchasing
· Advanced knowledge in handling all common network and Internet protocols
· Experience with Wireless Local Area Networks (WLAN / WiFi)
· Proven ability to learn and apply new technology.



Please note you are not required to meet all of the above-mentioned expectations, any combination is welcome! (the more the better , of course ).
In addition, we expect fluency in English (Common European Framework of Reference C2), open mind, willingness to learn new skills and respect for the team spirit.

Company Overview:

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers.

Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds.

Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped.

Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future.

Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction.

Job Purpose

This position is part of the Information Security and Risk Management team here at Jagex and is responsible for supporting and promoting Information security. Reporting to the Head of Security, the role will work closely with IT engineering and outsourced Security Operations to establish and maintain services required to respond to security alerts and incident resolution.
You will have Security Tool Administration experience as well as experience of building and maintaining security systems, as well as a thorough understanding of the latest security principles, techniques and protocols. The security engineer will have a solid understanding of security technologies at an SME level and good understanding of SOC tooling. You will provide engineering expertise to and on behalf of the Security Operations Centre (SOC) with regards to security infrastructure and tooling. SOC tooling would typically include SIEM, IDS/IPS, and End Point Management.
Key Duties
Design and implement technical security controls.
Experience of developing and documenting security processes and plans based on common information security management frameworks (ISO 270x, ITIL, COBIT, NIST or CIS)
Implement and manage processes to operate within a Managed Security Operations Centre
Build out a supporting function to the outsourced SOC.
IDS/IPS and WAF policies/rules administration and maintenance.
Knowledge of AWS security and networking configurations eg security groups, subnets and routing tables.
Responsible for monitoring, detecting, containing and remediating security incidents being identified by the SOC.
Essential Requirements
Extensive commercial experience within the information and cyber security domain. Hands on experience in IT system administration, network administration, security operations centre would be advantageous
Knowledge of SIEM / Log Aggregators (Splunk, IBM QRadar, LogRhythm, Darktrace, Generic Syslog) Tools & Processes
Working knowledge of vulnerability/compliance, patch management, anti-malware, APT, identity and access control management toolsets.
Excellent interpersonal and communication
Proven working experience in at least a scripting language (Python, Bash, Perl)
Desirable
Demonstrable background in a security operations environment
Strong understanding of threat intelligence and alert triaging
Vulnerability management. Good knowledge on performing vulnerability tests.
Working knowledge of vulnerability/compliance, patch management, anti-malware, APT, identity and access control management toolsets.
Postgraduate degree within the Information security domain
Certification: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK)

Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells high-performance distributed systems that make the business of trading and transacting money (and other financial assets) easier, faster, safer, and smarter for everyone involved. Our technology makes it simple to create, combine, and extend large-scale, high-performance intelligent systems in ways that were never before possible.

As pioneers within our industry, we hire top talent and strive to build the next generation of thought leaders. People who are naturally compelled to figure out what works and why - enthusiastic crafters, outside-the-box thinkers, and brilliant self-starters. No stuffy corporate office. No dress code or business attire (unless that’s your thing). No endless meeting schedules. We build amazing software that solves real-time problems with some of the greatest thinkers around the world, and we love doing it.

Broadway Technology is looking for a sharp Network Engineer who has experience designing resilient, mission-critical trading networks infrastructure for global trading organizations. Past experience in low-latency network design and management is a must.
Broadway is a leading provider of high-performance trading solutions. We've delivered some of the world’s most advanced systems to a who’s who customer list that includes the largest global banks. Our software manages billions of dollars in transactions daily.

Responsibilities
Manage Broadway’s global trading network. Identify and resolve network failures on both switches and servers and network performance within both the trading environment and corporate network.
Ensure the security of the trading and corporate networks. Remain current on information security best practices. Recommend and implement security tools, policies and procedures.
Configure multicast networks, including Multicast PIM Sparse/Dense and IGMP.
Collaborate with customers and partner with technical teams to make changes to network connectivity.
Create and maintain documentation for network environments and user documentation for utilizing network services.
Leverage and expand use of automation across all actives to build operational scale with use of Puppet and/or Ansible.
Manage short and longer term projects while owning day to day issues to resolution, keeping stakeholders informed of the issue status.
Lights out management, maintenance, and administration of HPE servers
On call work and weekend work may be required.
Requirements
Very strong knowledge of IP routing, VLANs, Access Control Lists and Network Address Translation.
Exceptional knowledge on scripting/automation using Python, Bash and Ansible
Exceptional knowledge on Unix systems and how to utilize Low Latency applications
Exceptional problem-solving skills in networking.
Unrelenting commitment to quality and exceptional attention to detail.
Outstanding analytical and organization skills.
Knowledge of, and experience implementing, best practices to enforce network and system security e.g. ISO 27001.
Demonstrated expertise in process and system documentation.
Excellent verbal/written communication.
Strong collaborative nature and the ability to support internal and external clients.
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in telecommunications, computer engineering, or a related field.
Nice To Have
Windows or Linux administration (specifically RedHat and Centos) and troubleshooting skill sets
Active Directory management
Experience
2-3 years of experience in a senior role, managing switches and other network equipment at L2/L3, connecting international data centers, customer sites and market partners.
2-3 years managing production systems across multiple, global sites.
1-2 years securing edge infrastructure with firewalls, IDS/IPS products and configuration of VPNs to 3rd parties
Network routing inside, outside and between the company and external partners.
Expertise in multiple vendor firewall, switching and routing technologies like Arista, Fortigate, Cisco or A10 Networks
BGP & BFD setup as well as demonstrated experience troubleshooting.
Analyzing network data captures with tools such as Wireshark.
VPN: between sites using IPSec as well as between users and sites.
Past experience with maintaining network configurations with version control systems.
Penetration testing experience is a plus.
Python scripting or similar.
About Broadway Technology
Broadway Technology is a software company that builds and sells low-latency distributed systems, primarily for use in financial applications like trading bonds, fiat currencies, and cryptocurrencies. Our software has powered the world’s most critical systems at top financial institutions and controls well over $125 trillion in business annually across five continents. Our proprietary software platform is an open, flexible, complete solution for screen and automated trading operations of any size and complexity.

Founded in 2003, Broadway has nearly 200 employees worldwide with offices in New York, Austin, London, Waterloo, Toronto and Christchurch. Our founders are industry-recognized innovators (as well as MIT and Cornell alum) with advanced CS/engineering degrees and 15+ years leading high-tech ventures.

We take a rapid, methodical approach to development; and we focus on creating solutions that solve our clients’ immediate needs, yet can evolve and scale as needs change. We believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed.

As a Network Support Engineer, you will be responsible for providing quality technical support for our growing client and partner base. You will diagnose problems and troubleshoot the entire Meraki product line, including our wireless access points, security appliances, and switches. Our support engineers are foremost problem-solvers passionate about networking, and we seek enthusiastic and tech-savvy individuals to join the team. Our customer-facing role will expose you to a diverse group of teams, providing endless opportunities for career growth in a fun, challenging and fast-paced environment. We're looking for people who take pride in doing excellent work, and can both teach and learn from those around them.

Responsibilities
Effectively communicate with third parties such as partners and customers regarding technical issues and customer service inquiries, both orally and in writing.
Diagnose and troubleshoot wireless, security, switching, and other various network-related issues reported by Cisco Meraki customers and partners.
Own each customer case from initial creation to resolution.
Collaborate with other support team members to fix network outages, misconfigurations, and complex networking issues on customers' devices.
Read and analyze packet captures using Wireshark.
Work with engineering and management to diagnose and resolve critical, escalated issues.
Use acquired knowledge to suggest, edit, and write in-depth Knowledge Base articles.
Stay up to date on Meraki features and technology by attending lunch and learns, participating in engineering and product team communication, and keeping up with enterprise and cloud networking trends.
Qualifications
Fundamental understanding of and hands-on experience with network technologies including firewalls, content filters, routing/switching, VLANs, and 802.11a/b/g/n/ac wireless.
Thorough comprehension of fundamental networking protocols including TCP, STP, ARP, Ethernet, OSPF, etc.
Experience supporting or testing LANs, VLANs, WLANs, VPNs, NAT devices, &/or DHCP servers.
Experience installing and troubleshooting WiFi networks
Outstanding Russian and English languages written and verbal communication skills and comprehension.
Ability to clearly and concisely articulate matters to third parties.
Outstanding customer service skills.
Excellent account management, follow-through, and attention to detail.
Experience in computer networking related problem solving, critical thinking, and troubleshooting.
Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
Networking certifications a plus: CCNA, CCNP, CWNA, etc.
Must be authorised to work in the U.K., position does not offer sponsorship.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.

Audley Travel is one of the world's leading tailor-made travel businesses with operations in the UK and North America. Although like many industries travel faces much disruption, Audley is uniquely positioned to continue its stellar track record of growth when travel once again returns. Metrics & Performance: track performance across the Tech Platforms areas of responsibility. Process Optimisation: standardising and automating services to streamline work and minimise outages
Service Management: maintain processes to ensure Tech Platforms services meet business requirements, e.g. deployment of security and operational patches
Managing and mitigating technology outages which can interrupt business operations
Ensure technology and services are implemented and compliant with controls and policies set by Audley’s SPG
To succeed in this role, it is essential you can demonstrate you have:
Experience of providing level 2 and 3 support to end users across an enterprise environment
Inter-Personal, self-starter, adaptable, flexible, team player who takes ownership
Demonstrated ability to interact with users to evaluate and solve problems and experience working across all areas of Technology to support a 24x7 environment
Highly organised with strong time management and planning skills
Strong communication skills both verbal and written with the ability to build and influence key relationships within the business
Stakeholder management and influencing skills across multiple stakeholder groups
Effective communication with third party vendors and build strong relationships to maximise operational and commercial benefits

Hands-on administration of the following technologies and services in an enterprise environment:
Active Directory
Avaya Communication Manager
Azure Cloud Services
Citrix
Exchange Online administration
Hardware management including: servers, SAN’s, networking infrastructure & end user devices
Microsoft 365 with compliance & security modules
PowerShell Scripting

VMware

Microsoft SQL Server

We believe it's our people that make the difference and who build Audley into the success it is today. We pride ourselves on enabling people to reach their full potential through promoting and celebrating a diverse and inclusive working environment.

Job Title: NetEng - EMEA Network Engineer - Networks - VP - London
Job Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:
Network Engineering is a global organisation that is part of the Foundational Infrastructure business unit and is based in multiple locations around the world. We engineer technologies, products and solutions across the entire Goldman Sachs network. This includes networks hosting critical market data, exchange connectivity and e-commerce services, cloud connectivity, the global core backbone, the design of the physical network supporting campus based users, interconnectivity to regional offices. We are also involved in the development of software solutions to support all aspects of network automation. The team ensures that knowledge, best practises and expertise are shared between regions promoting teamwork and collaboration.

Network Engineering is seeking an experienced engineer with excellent technical, analytical and communication skills.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

The engineer’s responsibilities include:
Introduction, communication and development of strategic networking technologies to provide additional scalability and functionality.
Take an active role in the product lifecycle; new technology introduction through to demise
Engineering new solutions for internal clients to address business requirements
Owning the delivery of a variety of concurrent projects in varying scale from small to very large
Provide subject matter expertise when collaborating on cross platform projects with teams responsible for Voice, Video, Market Data, Compute, Storage, Information Security and Data Centre.
Provide technical escalation for complex problems
Working with networking product vendors and telecoms service providers with regards to all of the above

SKILL / EXPERIENCE:

The skills required to be successful in this role:

Extensive technical experience in engineering and implementing networking technologies within a large Enterprise, preferably with some exposure to the Financial Sector.
In-depth knowledge of WAN/LAN topologies and protocols, networking technologies. (Ethernet, TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, PIM, SNMP, MPLS)
In-depth knowledge of perimeter networks, external connectivity, security standards, cloud connectivity, data centre design principles, products and protocols
Good appreciation of Network Security architectures, models and methodologies, Authentication schemes, Encryption techniques and standards
Design and product experience with firewalls – Juniper Netscreen/JunOs, Palo Alto
Extensive technical experience using many of the following: Cisco Routers, Switches, Nexus, ASR, ISR product lines, Layer4-7 switching / High Availability (Citrix Netscaler preferred), Cisco IOS, IOS-XE, NX-OS, IOS-XR, Juniper JunOS, Arista EOS
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Extensive experience with the management, internetworking design and implementation of networks
Good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Good project management skills (large network deployments and cross-discipline project deliverables)
Appreciation of neighbouring technologies: Market Data, Voice, Virtualisation Computing and Multimedia
Additional technologies of interest: WiFi, iSCSI
Desirable - experience of application performance optimisation and troubleshooting through packet level analysis
Desirable – software scripting and development experience, e.g. Automation & accessing web based services via APIs, specifically NodeJS
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

+3 years’ experience directly performing systems administration on Windows Server (versions 2008-2016)
+3 years’ experience automating and supporting desktop Operating Systems (Win 10)
+3 years’ experience working with network fundamentals. (DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, routing, switching)
Ability to lift 25kg of equipment (computers, monitors, etc)

A successful Support Engineer on our team will be customer focused and motivated by both individual and team successes. We are looking for a Graduate Test Engineer to be a vital part of the StarLeaf family at our office in Watford. You will report to our test team leader and work closely with our team members to ensure that we release high-quality products to our customers. The Watford team develops the infrastructure which provides the StarLeaf cloud service.

This position will involve:
Reviewing and analysing requirement documents ensuring business and technical requirements are fully understood.
Testing components within the StarLeaf Cloud infrastructure
Discovering, investigating and reporting defects accurately
Working with developers to manage issue through to successful resolution via Jira.
Designing new test cases for new features and upcoming products.
Liaising with project managers, developers and experts to continually develop product knowledge.
Upgrade and maintenance of the StarLeaf test infrastructure
You will be exposed to a variety of technologies and processes, including but not limited to IP networking, Agile development, Jira, TestRail, Git/SVN, release processes and a range of operating systems we support our products on.

Requirements

Requirements:
2.1 degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Natural Sciences or a related discipline.
A passion for technology.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
A desire to learn and to take ownership of your projects.
An aptitude for learning and solving complex problems.
Ability to pick up new technologies and products quickly
Basic understanding of IP networking, ports, routers, switches and the Linux command line
Knowledge of Software Testing preferred but not essential
A little bit about StarLeaf

Founded in the UK in 2008, we have a global footprint with representation on every continent and offices across the world. We are on a mission to transform the way businesses communicate and collaborate by designing intuitive messaging, premium meeting and calling solutions.

Last year, the company was named in the Gartner 2019 Magic Quadrant for Meeting Solutions and one of the fastest growing tech companies in the UK by The Sunday Times Hiscox Tech Track 100.

Our culture is built on collaboration, inclusion, creativity and support. This permeates everything we do, across all our teams and operations. We believe everyone at StarLeaf has a part to play in our success and that everyone should be rewarded for their contribution. This is why every single StarLeaf employee becomes a shareholder through the company’s share option scheme.

Benefits
Starting salary of £36,000.
Regular salary reviews.
EMI share option scheme.
Private medical insurance and long-term sickness/disability insurance.
Life insurance of four times salary.
25 days annual holiday plus bank holidays.
The opportunity to join a friendly, motivated group of people who are all very excited about the StarLeaf journey.

Orbital Internet Group is one of the UK’s fastest growing and largest, Kent based, ISP’s offering a wide spectrum of Internet solutions at affordable prices to residential and business users. Orbital Internet Group has rapidly built one of the UK's most sophisticated WiMAX class networks, providing thousands of end user's with ultra-fast internet access. We operate a national IP backbone spanning multiple datacentre’s, telephone exchanges and core POP sites. We provide services to customers in the UK as well as internationally.
Orbital Internet Group is now looking to employ a Senior Network Engineer to help maintain our core network as well as help develop new solutions.
We are a forward-thinking company and thrive on our ability to provide bespoke internet connectivity solutions. Our can-do attitude, and exposure to varying internet technologies, makes this role an exciting challenge for the right candidate.
The right candidate will have the chance to work in our purpose-built modern office based just outside of Canterbury and should have had experience of working in a senior network engineer role. Split home working is also possible with this position. You will be required to work 37.5 hours a week and will include out of hours work and on call.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a dynamic company who are playing a crucial part in the underpinning network infrastructure of the internet and play a key role in maintaining and developing our network capability.
Key Responsibilities:
· Reporting directly to the Technical Director, you will be responsible for delivering implementation projects, including upgrading, managing and fault finding on our core network.
· Configuration and management of a range of IP network equipment from multiple vendors as required for ongoing operation of the service
· Reviewing, accepting and modifying new design concepts from the engineering teams and 2nd line engineers to ensure they are fit for purpose and can be supported in the live network without compromising the network availability
· Handle escalations from our 1st/2nd support line team where necessary.
· Provide technical expertise in special and bespoke projects.
· Configure and maintain network automation platforms.
· Ongoing day-to-day Network maintenance.
· Hands-on complex engineering, including heavy maintenance work.
· Provide out of hours support to the NOC as part of the on-call operations engineering team
· Providing training and knowledge transfer to other team members when new technology or systems are deployed to the network
· Proactive identification of potential issues in the network and subsequent implementation of corrective action plan
· Own core network monitoring to ensure full visibility and reporting
· Managing the existing change control process
Candidate Profile:
· Expertise on latest Extreme & Cisco hardware and operating systems (SLX-OS, IOS)
· Knowledge of Mikrotik and Ubiquiti product set and configuration
· IP internetworking and Routing & Switching
· Expert level internetworking troubleshooting in a large-scale network environment
· WAN circuits and protocols (Ethernet, MPLS)
· Dynamic IP Routing protocols (OSPF, ISIS, BGP)
· Expertise in AS connectivity (eBGP, MPLS)
· Excellent design documentation skills
· Experience of Ticket Management applications
· Strong knowledge of VOIP and its associated protocols
· Layer 1 Understanding of fibre / copper cabling, constraints, technologies, grades, distances, applications
· Knowledge of network management, network availability and capacity planning applications and techniques
· Extensive expertise with general firewall configuration and support, including IPsec VPN configuration and troubleshooting
· Strong experience in network traffic monitoring, analysis, packet capture, and troubleshooting
· Solid understanding of enterprise ISP facing services including migration of services to Next-Gen network technologies, including the implementation of new DDOS platforms
· Understanding in Incident, Problem and Change Management
· Some scripting skills would be desirable
· A practical, hands-on approach to problem solving with the ability to work effectively under pressure
· An ability to recognise issues that have a wider implication and acting upon them
· A love for emerging technologies to help strive the business forward
· Self-motivated, willing to take responsibility, work with minimum supervision and able to lead the resolution of issues through to final resolution.

Location
Bristol, London, Manchester
About the job
Summary
To support these ambitions we have established a new Chief Digital Information Office (CDIO) directorate for the Cabinet Office to build on existing strengths. The Cabinet Office, CDIO directorate is based on six principles to:

• Build trust by stabilising services and getting the basics right.
• Be the gateway for all non-GDS digital, data and technology services delivered by Cabinet Office.
• Provide impeccable service to our users
• Drive digital, data and technology thought leadership
• Transform ways of working
• Build sustainable capabilities

The directorate is organised and led by six teams who work collaboratively to combine existing expertise while simultaneously building new capabilities
Job description
You will be working as an Install Move Add Change (IMAC) engineer. You will form part of the IMAC Team that sits under the Delivery Function of the organisation and works closely with the Delivery Managers. You will also work in partnership with the other functions of DaTT such as Cloud Service, Network Operations, End User Compute and the Business Operation Function which include the Commercial and Training teams.

This role is a unique opportunity within the DaTT function. As an IMAC Engineer you will support a variety of small, medium and large projects in close collaboration with the Delivery Managers. You will support the IMAC Operations Managers on office relocation/setups working alongside Cabinet Office Estates and Government Property Agency championing DaTT values.

We currently support over 15,000 users across a range of sites based nationwide and there will be occasions where you will travel to our regional sites with some overnight stays to assist with office relocations and other wider projects.

Responsibilities
As an IMAC Engineer you will be:

• Supporting the delivery of projects; installations, building Windows laptops, Macbook, android and apple phones, creating accounts, arranging deployments; delivering remote and classroom training and support for users. This includes installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop

• Working in a fast paced environment managing rapid delivery of business unit moves for high profile stakeholders working alongside a variety of multi-disciplined teams which requires discretion and confidentiality. This will include survey of office space, decommissioning IT from vacated buildings and installing IT in new locations from infrastructure/cabling, through to video conferencing equipment, printing and desktop devices.

• A good understanding of standard IT technologies and have a strong desire to deliver high quality service

• Able to understand and identify problems, analysing and help identify appropriate solutions, taking ownership of problems and proactively resolving technical issues, ensuring you meet business requirements by troubleshooting and diagnosing or escalating faults as appropriate

• Following standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams via the IMAC Operations Managers.

• In this ever changing environment the production and accurate maintenance of documentation is essential to the success of the team and sharing knowledge is encouraged to ensure the team is able to fulfil its objectives.

A combination of service provision and change management knowledge, as an IMAC Engineer you must have:

• Proven and detailed experience working in deskside support with experience of Windows, Mac OS devices, iOS and Android phones. Able to build these devices, configure and remotely deploy to users in a timely manner, creating guidance where appropriate.

• Able to demonstrate skills and experience installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop

• Hands on experience in device management such as Active Directory, Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SSCM), Casper (JAMF) and Airwatch.

• Proven ability to multitask and prioritise a busy workload allowing effective delivery of change

• Able to demonstrate good customer service and relationship management, can identify stakeholder needs based on evidence using a range of communications skills

• Able to demonstrates proactively taking ownership of problems and the ability to solve complex logical faults to resolution

• Proven ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team and demonstrates excellent ability to share/transfer knowledge within a team
Benefits
• Access to learning and development tailored to your role
• 25 days annual leave + an extra day off for the Queen's birthday
• flexible working options to enable you to achieve the work life balance that right for you
• civil service pension with an average employer contribution of 22%
• training and development opportunities
• interest free season ticket, tenancy deposits and holiday advances
• an in-year bonus scheme
• bike loans
• eye care vouchers
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.

In the Civil Service we use our success profiles to outline expected behaviours and we will use these as part of our wider assessment during the interview process.

For this role, the following behaviours are the most relevant:

• Working Together
• Delivering at Pace
• Making Effective Decisions
• Managing a Quality Service
• CV Experience

Please note that this role requires a minimum SC clearance, which would normally require 5 years UK residency in the past 5 years. This is not an absolute requirement but supplementary checks may be required where individuals have not lived in the UK for the required period. This may mean that your security clearance (and therefore your appointment) will take longer or, in some cases, not be possible.

How to apply

My client is a specialist `Internet Of Things` Communications Company headquartered in Guildford (UK), with offices in India, USA and Australia. They operate global mobile data networks for connecting many thousands of remote machines to the internet. Their customers use their networks for securely communicating with their own products in real time 24 / 7 all over the world.
Typical applications include security alarm systems, health monitoring devices, utility meter reading, vending machines and CCTV. Our networks are designed to manage these connections in a device specific way throughout their lifetime which is often many years.
As an end to end service provider they get involved in all aspects of delivering connected devices; from product design and embedded firmware, through global mobile networks, to big data collection and cloud based web portals.
The business is experiencing continued rapid growth, which means that they are looking for exceptional people to join their team.
Role:
My client has an opportunity to join their existing Core Network and Infrastructure Team based in Guildford. Working closely with the development and support teams, responsibilities will include the day to day management and maintenance of existing infrastructure covering development, staging and live environments. These services are deployed across their multiple international data centres and increasingly expanding into the cloud. Part of the role is to ensure 24/7 service availability and up-time as well as optimising performance and input towards architectural improvements.
The role also includes being part of the systems team on-call rota that provides out of hours network cover one week in five.
The successful candidate will be a pragmatic problem solver, who has some exposure to high availability services for a variety of applications. They are likely to have a very broad range of skills and be able to apply them to come up with the most appropriate solutions.
Skills:
Technical skills will include managing Cisco ASA Firewalls, switches and routers.
Core skills:
Hands on experience of setup, administration and troubleshooting of Cisco managed switches, ASA devices and routers.
Knowledge and experience of VRF's, VLANs, GRE, IPSec, MPLS, BGP, OSPF, HSRP, VRRP, Etherchannels and PBR
General Routing, Switching and Security within a Cisco environment

Our office

You will be working as an Install Move Add Change (IMAC) engineer. You will also work in partnership with the other functions of DaTT such as Cloud Service, Network Operations, End User Compute and the Business Operation Function which include the Commercial and Training teams.

This role is a unique opportunity within the DaTT function. As an IMAC Engineer you will support a variety of small, medium and large projects in close collaboration with the Delivery Managers. You will support the IMAC Operations Managers on office relocation/setups working alongside Cabinet Office Estates and Government Property Agency championing DaTT values.

We currently support over 15,000 users across a range of sites based nationwide and there will be occasions where you will travel to our regional sites with some overnight stays to assist with office relocations and other wider projects.
Responsibilities
As an IMAC Engineer you will be:

Supporting the delivery of projects; installations, building Windows laptops, Macbook, android and apple phones, creating accounts, arranging deployments; delivering remote and classroom training and support for users. This includes installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop

Working in a fast paced environment managing rapid delivery of business unit moves for high profile stakeholders working alongside a variety of multi-disciplined teams which requires discretion and confidentiality. This will include survey of office space, decommissioning IT from vacated buildings and installing IT in new locations from infrastructure/cabling, through to video conferencing equipment, printing and desktop devices.

A good understanding of standard IT technologies and have a strong desire to deliver high quality service

Able to understand and identify problems, analysing and help identify appropriate solutions, taking ownership of problems and proactively resolving technical issues, ensuring you meet business requirements by troubleshooting and diagnosing or escalating faults as appropriate

Following standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams via the IMAC Operations Managers.

In this ever changing environment the production and accurate maintenance of documentation is essential to the success of the team and sharing knowledge is encouraged to ensure the team is able to fulfil its objectives.

A combination of service provision and change management knowledge, as an IMAC Engineer you must have:

Proven and detailed experience working in deskside support with experience of Windows, Mac OS devices, iOS and Android phones. Able to build these devices, configure and remotely deploy to users in a timely manner, creating guidance where appropriate.

Able to demonstrate skills and experience installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop

Hands on experience in device management such as Active Directory, Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SSCM), Casper (JAMF) and Airwatch.

Proven ability to multitask and prioritise a busy workload allowing effective delivery of change

Able to demonstrate good customer service and relationship management, can identify stakeholder needs based on evidence using a range of communications skills

Able to demonstrates proactively taking ownership of problems and the ability to solve complex logical faults to resolution

Proven ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team and demonstrates excellent ability to share/transfer knowledge within a team

Role Purpose

The Azure Cloud Security Engineer is a change agent and ambassador for cyber security. Their primary focus will be to drive the delivery of cyber security controls for the Azure cloud platform and services identifying and assessing security threats and risks, defining and enabling secure configuration, and leading security automation.

Key Accountabilities
Enable and enhance security configuration and DevOps practices through close collaboration with Azure DevOps and by providing secure design patterns, and a hands on security engineering capability. Supports the definition and implementation of security requirements.
Deliver security automation in the CI/CD pipeline via leadership, process automation and tooling.
Implement continuous security control testing, and improvements to monitoring of Azure security events and alerts through optimisation and automation.
Increase visibility of security threats and configuration weaknesses by optimising the configuration of cloud native security tools, e.g. Azure Security Center, SQL Server Advanced Data Security, and Azure Sentinel.
Reduce security vulnerabilities and configuration weaknesses through standards and increased awareness.
Use security risk metrics to enable DevOps and security to report on threats and the cyber security controls.
Additional responsibilities
Security Operations and Assurance requirements are enabled through Azure event alerting, and controls testing
ESSENTIAL
Deep understanding of Azure data protection and security architecture, and features including Security Center and Secure Score, Ddos attack mitigation, Azure Front Door / Web Application Firewall, Azure Key Vault, Network Security Groups, Azure AD Identity Protection and Privileged Identity Management
Good understanding of Azure Iaas, serverless architecture and Azure Cloud Platform services, Application Service Environments, Service Fabric, Azure functions, Azure API Management
Hands on Azure security configuration and scripting skills.
Experience with build and deploy technologies such as TeamCity, Octopus, Bamboo
Demonstrable experience and execution of security automation, and configuration of Azure cloud native tools to maximise their effectiveness
Ability to apply security principles and good practice to manage risk, e.g. authentication, role-based access, encryption
Collaborates to develop close working relationships with DevOps teams to build/deploy secure solutions and automate security in the CI/CD pipeline
Able to communicate complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Microsoft Azure certifications, e.g. Azure Security Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, Azure Solutions Architect.
DESIRABLE
Understanding of FCA and PCI data security control requirements
Developer background can code and understands development methodologies and frameworks
Hands on experience of technical security vulnerability assessments and penetration testing using Burp Suite, Kali Linux or similar
AWS cloud platform skills and knowledge, e.g. AWS Config configuration.
Personal Attributes
Builds partnerships through collaboration and being part of the solution
Able to influence peers focuses on risk and the why, and communicates complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Challenges conventional thinking and demonstrates a continuous improvement mindset

Summary:
Mitsubishi Hitachi Power Systems Europe Ltd (MHPS-EU) are providing end to end services to Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Controls systems and Accessory systems of OEM and OOEM (Other OEM) products to increase efficiency, reliability and availability throughout the entire lifecycle of the assets. MHPS is a pioneer on delivering latest technology to modernize upgrades, remote monitoring, and lifetime extension, digital solution (TOMONI) to optimize power plant performance and make the plant competitive in the ever changing dynamic marketing environment.
The Repair Engineer will bring experience and relevant knowledge to expand a solid foundation and enhance capability for a wide range of power turbine product repair and development activities, across the EMEA region.
Job Description:
Support the operation and maintenance of large gas turbines, steam turbines including accessory systems from major manufacturers.
To develop repair procedures for Gas and Steam turbine forgings,castings and fabrications and prepare technical spec RFQs and POs to supplier and partners.
Preparation of drawings, designs and procedures for welding or tooling to facilitate any repair and improvement or countermeasure as required.
Define repair and production processes to meet specification in fabrication, forging, casting and finishing of components to meet product requirements.
Assure component durability and process quality by designing testing methods; testing finished- product and process capabilities; establishing standards; confirming manufacturing processes.
Provides solid decision-making through collating production, material and manufacturing, and interpretation as required to support.
Build productive relationships with vendors, managing information; reviewing production schedules meeting project want dates.
The preparation of product and process reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing inspection , manufacturing and operating data as required ensuring the timely communication of significant issues or developments.
Evaluate mechanical GT and ST design by developing and conducting research programs including scanning and modelling and document review.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing objectives and requests as needed.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.
Travel to customer or site locations to support unplanned/forced outages or inspect and evaluate components requiring repair and to attend review meetings.
Person Specification:
Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering with Materials and/or Welding Engineering qualification being advantageous.
Strong knowledge and experience relevant to large and small industrial gas turbines from major manufacturers.
Development of proactive working procedures in business English (WPS,WPQR,NCR, RFA,OR) for future work efficiency.
Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary team with people with different cultures and nationalities. Knowledge of Japanese would be an advantage but not essential.
Conversant in CAD Software eg SolidWorks or Creo. (Knowledge of computational modelling would be an advantage).
Must be able to work autonomously on sites with limited supervision for short periods of time.
Behaviours:
The successful applicant will display the following behaviours;
A questioning attitude, to understand the processes and associated applications.
Planning and preparation to ensure production and Continuing Professional Development goals are achieved.
Intervention, to challenge poor practices and channel feedback to the appropriate authorities to implement change.
Reliability and dependability to consistently deliver expectations in production, quality, work ethics and self-development.
Accountability, to follow the specified procedures and controls and be personally responsible for their production work.
Customer Focus, working to develop a positive and lasting relationship with both internal and external customers.
