Job Title: Network Architect EMEA - Telecom Systems Business
Job Description:
Network Architect, EMEA - Telecom Systems Business
An exciting opportunity for an experienced Telecom Network Architecture to join a growing team with a charter to sell, and deploy solutions to the rapidly growing 5G Telecom market segment .
Showcasing excellence and innovation at every stage, Product Management is responsible for the cross-functional management of products or solutions through their entire lifecycle. Using a wealth of technical and industry experience, we work across functional areas to implement our products or solutions. We undertake thorough analysis of the markets to ensure we maximize profitability and adjust our product strategies to respond to competition. Our role also involves acting as subject matter experts for internal and external product events or partner meetings.

Join us as a Network Architect in our Telecom Systems Business team in the UK to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you will achieve:
The Network Architect role combines Telco industry knowledge and technical expertise, a broad range of consulting capabilities, and innovative business and technology solutions to drive co-innovation and network transformation initiatives with Tier 1 Telecom Operators. The Telco Network Architect provides innovative thought, strategic guidance and technology expertise to enable new business opportunities. The Network Architect will lead client technical engagement and accelerate their transformation journey by positioning Dell Technologies Telco solutions and services capabilities.
Lead technical aspects of new business development with Tier 1 Telecom Operators across EMEA. Develop, propose and coordinate co-innovation projects in close alignment with the Telco BU strategic product & services roadmap and regional/account level client executives.
An evangelist for the client’s specific business and technical issues and demands and translate them into architectures & solutions delivered by Dell Technologies
Develops, maintains and cultivates strong customer relationships at all levels, with special emphasis on architects & Executive level Network/IT leaders
Develops trusted and meaningful client relationships through a deep understanding of Key Business Issues within their account base and alignment to key Dell Technology Solutions
Is the lead technical expert with an emphasis on pre-sales motions and scoping of the customers vision through Dell Technologies Solution development
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
10+ years of technical pre-sales and architecture experience for large enterprises and Telecom Operators working with global clients on multi-year Network/IT transformational engagements that scale over $50M+ in investment value
10 years in technical role, as an architect, R&D systems, product management and/or related area. Experience with 4G and 5G Networks including radio access network (RAN) technologies and solutions
Strong technical background in Mobile Networks architecture include 3GPP core and radio access network. Working knowledge and direct experience with 5G 3GPP standard (Release 15-17) and 5G O-RAN Alliance and TIP architecture, ecosystem, market dynamics and solutions
Solid understanding or practical experience with data center technologies including: Virtualization, Cloud-Computing, Storage, Networking, IT Operations Management, etc.
Strong understanding of financial aspects of Network/IT which include but is not limited to; planning, capital & operating expenses, and asset capitalization.
DESIRED SKILLS
Desirable to have expertise related to business applications, business process management, application integration, database management, application development, data analytics or converged/virtualized IT infrastructure as an architect, systems engineer or consultant in Telecom or related industries
Ability to deliver business outcomes and provide Influential leadership of virtual, matrix and cross-functional team
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.
Application closing date: 29th November 2020

What you'll do
The Team
The Cabinet Office is undergoing a significant Digital Transformation. Over the next three years we aspire to make UK Government digital services the best in the world, meeting or exceeding the benchmark set globally by the best public or private sector standards. For us to meet this ambition we are aiming to further improve the conditions, processes and expertise we have in place to be set up for success. This means we need to go much further and faster, and strengthen delivery of DDaT in government.
To support these ambitions we have established a new Chief Digital Information Office (CDIO) directorate for the Cabinet Office to build on existing strengths. The Cabinet Office CDIO directorate is based on six principles to:
Build trust by stabilising services and getting the basics right.
Be the gateway for all non-GDS digital, data and technology services delivered by Cabinet Office.
Provide impeccable service to our users
Drive digital, data and technology thought leadership
Transform ways of working
Build sustainable capabilities
The directorate is organised and led by six teams who work collaboratively to combine existing expertise while simultaneously building new capabilities
The Role
You will be working as an Install Move Add Change (IMAC) engineer. You will form part of the IMAC Team that sits under the Delivery Function of the organisation and works closely with the Delivery Managers. You will also work in partnership with the other functions of DaTT such as Cloud Service, Network Operations, End User Compute and the Business Operation Function which include the Commercial and Training teams.
This role is a unique opportunity within the DaTT function. As an IMAC Engineer you will support a variety of small, medium and large projects in close collaboration with the Delivery Managers. You will support the IMAC Operations Managers on office relocation/setups working alongside Cabinet Office Estates and Government Property Agency championing DaTT values.
We currently support over 15,000 users across a range of sites based nationwide and there will be occasions where you will travel to our regional sites with some overnight stays to assist with office relocations and other wider projects.
Who you are
As an IMAC Engineer you will be:
Supporting the delivery of projects; installations, building Windows laptops, Macbook, android and apple phones, creating accounts, arranging deployments; delivering remote and classroom training and support for users. This includes installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop
Working in a fast paced environment managing rapid delivery of business unit moves for high profile stakeholders working alongside a variety of multi-disciplined teams which requires discretion and confidentiality. This will include survey of office space, decommissioning IT from vacated buildings and installing IT in new locations from infrastructure/cabling, through to video conferencing equipment, printing and desktop devices.
A good understanding of standard IT technologies and have a strong desire to deliver high quality service
Able to understand and identify problems, analysing and help identify appropriate solutions, taking ownership of problems and proactively resolving technical issues, ensuring you meet business requirements by troubleshooting and diagnosing or escalating faults as appropriate
Following standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams via the IMAC Operations Managers.
In this ever changing environment the production and accurate maintenance of documentation is essential to the success of the team and sharing knowledge is encouraged to ensure the team is able to fulfil its objectives.
Skills and Experience
A combination of service provision and change management knowledge, as an IMAC Engineer you must have:
Proven and detailed experience working in deskside support with experience of Windows, Mac OS devices, iOS and Android phones. Able to build these devices, configure and remotely deploy to users in a timely manner, creating guidance where appropriate.
Able to demonstrate skills and experience installing active Infrastructure components (e.g switches, routers) and the network connectivity skills required to present the IT services to an end users desktop
Hands on experience in device management such as Active Directory, Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SSCM), Casper (JAMF) and Airwatch.
Proven ability to multitask and prioritise a busy workload allowing effective delivery of change
Able to demonstrate good customer service and relationship management, can identify stakeholder needs based on evidence using a range of communications skills
Able to demonstrates proactively taking ownership of problems and the ability to solve complex logical faults to resolution
Proven ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team and demonstrates excellent ability to share/transfer knowledge within a team
How you'll be assessed
In the Civil Service, we use our Success Profiles. For each role we advertise we consider what you will need to demonstrate to be successful. This gives us the best possible chance of finding the right person for the job, drives up performance and improves diversity and inclusivity. We will be looking at your experience, career history and achievements that are relevant to the specific job role.
For this role we will be assessing your ability, strength, experience, technical/specialist skills and behaviours, the following behaviours are the most relevant:
-
working together
-
delivering at pace
-
making effective decisions
-
managing a quality service
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Job Title: Field Service Engineer - Reading or Guildford
Job Description:
The Zonal group are one of the UKs largest technology providers to the hospitality industry. Our products are used by over 11,000 pubs, restaurants and hotels. Customers include national brands like Pizza Express, JD Wetherspoons and All Bar One.

We provide our customers with the solutions they need to make their business a success. These solutions include mobile apps for ordering and web apps for engaging with consumers either through loyalty or reservations. By linking these solutions to Zonals EPoS (till) system, we help hospitality brands to understand their customers behaviour and preferences, enabling them to excel in an increasingly competitive market.

If you have booked a table or hotel room, ordered, and paid for food and drinks, received loyalty offers, or downloaded your favourite hang outs app, you will likely have used a Zonal product.

We are a family business with Scottish roots. We operate from our modern head office in Edinburgh to our Marketing Technologies Division in Staffordshire, or our Innovation Centre in Abingdon and hotel management solutions base in Cardiff.

What youll do

Maintain Zonal products at sites around the UK and abroad according to Company standards of customer service, Service Level Agreements, and Health and Safety requirements.

The Technical Service Department consists of the Technical Support, Technical Consultancy, Repair Centre, Production, Warehouse and Service Engineer teams (reporting ultimately to the Operations Director).

Support is provided based upon the SLAs in place with the customers. These are monitored on a daily basis and reported back to the customer at regular intervals.

Responsibilities will involve:-
Daily liaison with the Engineering Scheduler. Close calls with the Engineering Scheduler as soon as these are completed.
Provide the Engineering Scheduler with regular updates on progress, details of any other relevant issues, or further action to be taken.
Diagnose and/or repair faults on site or remove to workshop for more thorough repair.
Carry out programme upgrades on site.
Carry out Data copies if required to preserve critical data.
Liaise with the R&D department during product trials: report any problems that occur during installation, usage or removal to ensure which require further attention.
Full and detailed completion of all appropriate paperwork.
Present a positive Company image.
Provide a timely, polite and efficient service.
Provide on-call cover on evenings and weekends on a rotational basis.
Ensuring the delivery of product features into product releases at the required level of quality
Pro-actively participating in the full development lifecycle
Monitoring and reporting on the production usage of the product to help identify areas of weakness/risk
Championing expertise to ensure quality of product throughout all stages of the development lifecycle
Who you are

Essential:-
You will live within a 10 mile radius of either Reading or Guildford
Minimum 18 months experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally in the hospitality/leisure industry.
Background knowledge in computer hardware (pc's, IP networks and WIFI)
The ability to provide 5 years of continuous past work history and satisfactory references to enable the candidate to obtain an airport pass successfully.
Clean driving licence is essential.
PC literate (all MS Office suite) and aptitude to pick up new software packages quickly.
Planning and organisational skills; able to establish efficient and appropriate plans for self and others and adapt quickly and effectively to unexpected changes whilst still ensuring objectives are met. Customer service; understands and responds to customer needs (internal and external) and exceeds expectations where possible.
Communication and team working; works co-operatively with others to achieve a common goal and communicates information in a clear, concise and accurate manner.
Problem solving and decision making; analyses information appropriately in order to find best solutions and takes a balanced view to reach logical conclusions and make relevant decisions. Commercial and organisational focus; demonstrates understanding of overall business and commercial issues facing company.
Commitment to results; is committed to obtaining results through taking responsibility, demonstrating a positive attitude and ensuring quality is built into work.
Desirable:-
EPoS background
Experience of maintaining and installing EPoS equipment
3 years or more experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally within the hospitality/leisure industry
What we value

Passion, Teamwork, Innovation and Professionalism are the values we believe make us the company we are. Were looking for someone who understands great culture and will help us shape it as it evolves.

The Hut Group aims to be the World’s leading Online Health & Beauty Destination. We are currently the UK’s leading multi-website online retailer with rapidly growing global operations and a unique proprietary technology platform. With over 16 million customers worldwide and 400 million visits to our sites annually, we understand the importance of reliable technology and a data-driven expertise.

Our software is the core of our business and enables the company to continue to grow and thrive. The Group’s industry leading and proprietary technology platform powers its own consumer sites plus global media partners and brand owners, including: Unilever, Nintendo and the Daily Mail Group. We develop all of our own applications in-house with our Development Delivery Teams. In order to enable our Delivery Teams to continue to achieve, we are always looking for bright and intellectual people who are happy to push boundaries and really challenge the status quo.

Led by world-class technologists with a diverse range of backgrounds ranging from Silicon Valley tech giants (Google, Amazon) through to Hedge funds and Algorithmic Trading Firms. You will be surrounded by highly intellectual and passionate colleagues, all with the common goal to help us grow this business globally, fast.

UK2 @ THG

Backed by global giants KKR and Blackrock, The Hut Group’s acquisition of UK2 was a strategic opportunity to develop the existing proprietary technology platform behind our health and beauty brands. It also enhances the server infrastructure, programmatic development and platform security.

As veterans in the hosting industry, UK2 Group have been providing internet services on a global scale for over 15 years, pioneering the mass adoption of many breakthrough technologies. With experience which spans two decades, we have seen the online landscape alter beyond recognition, and have adapted our service offering in accordance with the rapid developments in hardware capabilities, data transfer speeds and global business demands.

The role is datacentre based with hands on work, dealing with hardware in a datacentre environment. The successful applicant will be providing support directly to customers and internal departments via email, ticketing system and phone calls. Additional roles will involve planning and carrying out website migrations and provisioning new servers. The ideal candidate will have a technical background and great people skills to assist our needs. Our ideal candidate will meet many of the requirements below, although we can provide training for the right candidate with suitable attitude and aptitude.

Requirements

Core Technical Skills Required:
Microsoft Windows
Linux - CentOS/Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora
Knowledge of networking concepts
An understanding of DNS
Working knowledge of internet services and software including:
Mail Servers, Web Servers, DNS Servers, SQL Servers, Firewall configuration
Working knowledge of commonly used web hosting control panels (Webmin, Cpanel, Plesk)
Experience of remote administration of servers using SSH/VNC/Remote Desktop
Full UK Driving Licence
Core Competencies/Requirements
Strong service orientation
Excellent time keeping
Provide sound 1st, 2nd and 3rd level support
Ability to analyze existing systems to identify weaknesses and inefficiencies
Ability to handle multiple tasks
Working knowledge of internet concepts
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to maintain a high degree of confidentiality
Good attention to detail
Willing to travel to other sites to carry out deployments
Benefits
Competitive Salary, plus a bonus
You’ll be joining a growing, intelligent team that will drive business change
You’ll have the opportunity to make an impact within the team, applying the skills and methodologies you’ve learnt
You’ll be working for a company with an excellent culture, in a friendly and fast paced environment
You’ll be able to react to change with backing from the business
You'll have the opportunity to solve complex business/technical problems

A Financial Services client of mine, based in London, are looking for a Lead Network Engineer to join their growing team. This role will be reporting into the Network Manager.
About the Lead Security Engineer Role:
The Lead Network Engineer role reports directly to the Network Manager within the IT Operation and Engineering team for Networks. The Networks team is responsible for all networking within the client in relation to both Data Center and Enterprise including Firewalls, Routers, Switches, Load Balancers and Wireless.
The Lead Network Engineer provides non-managerial leadership within the Network team, taking responsibility for promoting technical excellence and consistent implementation to provide a high performing and stable network for the client's needs. The Lead Network Engineer has oversight of the implementations through reviewing and contributing to HLDs and LLDs as well as ensuring that the delivered solutions are fit for purpose and consistent with the intentions of the design. The Lead Network Engineer also has oversight of the operational incident process, highlighting issues that need more attention and taking ownership when escalation is required. The Lead Network Engineer represents the Network team during the technical review of changes. The Lead Network Engineer also represents the team in the absence of the Network Manager
Responsibilities:
The Lead Network Engineer has the following responsibilities:
Reviewing and contributing to HLDs and LLDs
Reviewing and approving Changes including running the Network TRB
Responding to Incidents and providing escalation as necessary
Identifying issues within the network and recommending appropriate remediation/solutions
Identifying and tracking software versions and recommending upgrades
Identifying potential for improvements within the network and recommending appropriate steps.
Encouraging the use of automation and scripting to streamline build/delivery
Encourage knowledge sharing within the team
Produce, maintain and review operational documentation.
Required knowledge and level of experience:
Career history and work experience within financial services or similar environment is a critical requirement for this role.
The successful candidate should have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a large financial organisation
Expert knowledge of the following
Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, Routers
BGP, OSPF, STP, vPC, Port-Channels, IP
Solid knowledge of the following: Arista Low Latency Switching and Tap Aggregation, Fortinet Firewalls and Management, Cisco ASA Firewalls, Check Point Firewalls
VXLAN, DNS, HSRP, VRF, Multicast, VPN
Knowledge of the following desirable:
A10 Load Balancers, F5 DNS, Cisco Wireless, Riverbed AppResponse, Corvil
Strong understanding of network enterprise monitoring solutions and associated operational support processes, preferably Solarwinds, Arista CloudVision
Strong understanding of integrating network devices with Security Incident and Event Management tools, preferably HP Arcsight
Ability to identify automation opportunities and have hands-on experience of tools such as Ansible Tower and Python to deliver efficiencies for the network team and dependent stakeholders.
Significant exposure of working within an ITIL governed environment
Note: The role requires participation on an on-call rota for escalation and resolution of out-of-hours incidents, for which overtime is paid.
If the above is of interest please call me on 0207 509 8040 to find out more (if you cannot get through to me please email darius.goodarzi@Robertwalters.com). Alternatively please apply to this ad and I will come back to you within 24-48 hours.

A Financial Services client of mine, based in London, are looking for a Lead Network Engineer to join their growing team. This role will be reporting into the Network Manager.

Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.
Check out our team Life at Nuance!
Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.

The Site Reliability Center (SRC) team within Nuance Communications is an engineering discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run cloud-scale, distributed, fault-tolerant systems. Our team ensures that Nuance services have reliability and uptime to meet the needs of our ever-growing customer base. The SRC team focuses on practices such as event response, major incident management, minimizing operational work, deep post-mortem exercises, and prevention of potential outages factoring into the iterative improvement work.
In this role you will be a central point of contact in the SRC team with correspondence through phone based, direct contact support, as well as through ticketing systems. You will be supporting the products and customers directly. This role maintains a unique position to see the entire division and interact across all international teams as well as hold an important structural part of the team.
The successful applicant must be able to obtain Security Clearance once employed.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Resolution of all incidents which have been escalated from Support teams or identified through events and alerts.
Responsible for all server and network related support issues, ensuring support issues are resolved within the SLA and to the satisfaction of the customer.
Support 24x7x365 SRC operations.
Administration of Event Management rules in Nagios, SCOM, and other monitoring tools.
Monitor alerts mailbox and Event Management systems for Events and follow KB articles for resolution actions, performing functional escalations to on-call resources as needed
Monitor Application dashboards for indications of incidents
Invoke Incident Management process for Incidents that cannot be resolved within this team (Open the conference Bridge if needed)
Execute routine checklists to validate system functionality and batch process completion (backups, scheduled tasks, etc.)
Defining monthly and weekly activities such as systems patching, vulnerability management and standard changes.
Document and communicate system status per process definitions.
Perform tasks related to securing and keeping the products, tools, and processes that you are responsible for securing
Work Experience: 2 or more years of experience in IT operations.
Required Skills:
Solid Linux Server and/or Windows Server administration & operational support skills in a production environment
Active Directory / SSO setup & troubleshooting
Knowledge of database technologies with experience with MySQL and/or Microsoft SQL Server.
Knowledge of monitoring tools such as Zabbix, Nagios, SCOM, Solar winds, etc.
TCP/IP networking knowledge and troubleshooting
Preferred Skills:
Basic knowledge of public cloud deployment architecture & administration (ideally Azure)
Experience with any automation tools.
Scripting language experience. Any of the following: Bash / PowerShell / Python / Pearl / UI Path (RPA).

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

IT Support Engineer
Salary: £23,500-£28,000 per annum, based on experience
20 days holiday + bank holidays. Monday to Friday 9:00-5:30
About F8 IT Solutions:
Our business has grown steadily over the last 10 years, then accelerated by Covid-19 and the changes to customers working needs. The appetite for cloud has dramatically increased and we are looking for a passionate and experienced support engineer to help implement and support day to day. We want to be able maintain the levels of service that our valued clients deserve, and are looking for someone with the same passion we have, to help us stay on top of workloads.
Based in Aylesbury, we are a small team supporting small to medium sized businesses within the Aylesbury Vale and beyond. With a strong ethical ethos, and a desire to provide the best customer service, our customers value us as much as they would their own staff members.
About the role:
We are looking for team members to work with us long term, on a full time basis. You will work standard office hours of 9am – 5.30pm Monday to Friday, but will need the flexibility to do additional planned work on occasional evenings or weekends, according to business needs. Team member will handle basic password resets through to complex IT projects, due to the small nature of our team we do not have a strict first through to third line escalation.
You will be expected to share the day to day responsibilities for providing our clients with highest level of service. This will require approximately 70% remote and phone support from our office in Aylesbury and 30% field work at customer premises. During Covid-19, this looks a lot more like 90% remote and phone, 7% workshop and 3% clients site (drop off or quick job in server room).
Responsibilities:
Supporting clients on Windows 7, 8, 10 and OSX operating systems.
Supporting clients on Server 2008/2012/2016 operating systems.
Supporting Android, Windows Mobile and particularly iOS operating systems.
Email support on POP3, IMAP & MAPI systems from Exchange Server 10, web based hosting provider and Office 365.
Visiting clients at their premises to perform regular maintenance visits – a series of checks on IT equipment and solutions. (temporarily on hold with Covid-19)
Workshop work including PC and laptop repairs, testing parts and providing clients with estimates for work required to resolve particular issues.
Troubleshooting problems over the phone, remotely, in the workshop and on site.
Troubleshooting Office Suites on Windows and OSX.
Troubleshooting OneDrive for Business
About you:
We are looking for someone with experience of working with a range of different customer needs, who is able to form a rapport easily and be a valuable member to our team. You need to be able to demonstrate good organisational skills, time management and the ability to multi-task and prioritise your own workload.
You will need to be reliable and responsible as you will be expected to take ownership of your own work for clients, and to work largely unsupervised, keeping accurate records of the work you have completed and why.
You will need to have excellent communication skills, including excellent verbal and written English, and be confident in providing support over the phone.
Initial shadowing of team members and on the job training will be provided, though an eagerness to learn new solutions will be critical. We provide up to 5 in-service training days every year, so we want someone with a passion to grow their skills and experience, who will look to expand their own knowledge.
Required Skills & Experience:
At least 5 year experience providing 1st/2nd line support to businesses working on a Windows Server domain. Including complete setup of user from un-boxing to ready.
At least 5 year experience supporting businesses on desktop operating systems from Windows XP to Windows 10. Including advanced troubleshooting of issues.
You will be experienced in installing network printers, either on a wired or wireless network.
Experience working with wired and wireless networks, troubleshooting and understanding basic TCP/IP.
Router setup and configuration knowledge, including wireless security and basic port forwarding.
Full UK driving license and use of own car with business insurance.
Experience supporting various mobile operating systems (Android, iOS etc).
Experience with DNS.
Windows Server 2003, 2008, 2012 or 2016 setup and configuration experience.
Exchange 2003, 2007, or 2010 and 365 setup and configuration experience.
Experience Group Policy editing.
Experience writing scripts or batch files.
Experience with various brands of routers.
Proficient with hard drive cloning and partitioning tools.
Skills and experience that would be beneficial:
Experience working with Powershell command line.
Microsoft 365 AAD Setup & Support.
MDM and/or Intune deployment experience.
Apple Business Manager administrator
Microsoft Teams administration.
Microsoft Sharepoint administration.
Backup and restore experience of desktop and server operating systems.
Experience setting up virtualisation technologies.
Microsoft certification or equivalent in desktop or server operating systems.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: £23,500.00-£28,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company pension
On-site parking
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Overtime
COVID-19 considerations:
Working from home with full functionality, masks, wipes and gels provided to ensure no transfer when working in workshop (extremely rare with Covid-19)
Experience:
On-site (Client) IT Support: 3 years (Preferred)
Business IT Support: 3 years (Required)
Location:
Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire (Preferred)
Licence:
Full UK Driving (Required)
Language:
Fluent English (Required)
Flexible Working Options Available:
Work from home
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Desktop Support Engineer | London | £30,000 – £35,000

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are currently looking for an experienced On-site Desktop Support Engineer to be based on customer site in London

As Desktop Support Engineer you will be the customer lead for a major customer with the London office being your primary place of work.

You will be fully supported and work closely with the technical support teams in other locations.

You will work well with remote colleagues, but you will also need to work with end users, from office Managers, Director to CEO’s.

About the job role:

You will manage a list of calls escalated from the 1st Line Team, whilst taking calls from customers, users and logging the calls.

You’ll perform maintenance and technical tasks to include computer and laptop builds and diagnosis of problems.

Perform testing and other investigative work.

Windows 7/8/10 OS, Mac OS (ideally) & the MS Office suite for both

Windows 2008/2012 Server, active directory, group policy

WiredScore is looking for a sharp and talented communications engineer to join our Operations Team in London. Working with our partners, which include some of the world's top landlords and agents as well as local and central government, you will be at the forefront of shaping how digital infrastructure is built across the UK and Ireland.

We use our unique perspective to ensure the properties we work with are best positioned to serve the needs of today's and tomorrow's tenants. This opportunity will be of interest to you if you want to join a high growth start up with a group of talented team members.

Responsibilities:

The primary responsibility will be to drive the completion of Wired Certifications across the UK and Ireland. This will include:
Auditing the infrastructure and connectivity of buildings being Wired Certified
Creating and developing clear reports detailing a buildings infrastructure and connectivity
Working with and training our third-party engineers to audit buildings and produce reports
Engaging with our clients' engineers, architects and advisors to undertake Development & Redevelopment Certifications
Advising our clients (landlords and agents) on cutting-edge advancements in telecommunications and opportunities for improvement
Driving partnerships with telecommunications companies across the UK and Ireland, with the ultimate goal of strengthening both the Wired Certification programme and future business lines. This will involve forming relationships with fibre providers and ISPs
Supporting Business Development work from a technical perspective
Helping shape the future of WiredScore by being an active participant in strategy with regards to innovative future business lines
Qualifications:

We are looking for someone with the perfect balance of industry and technical knowledge, communication and analytical skills. The best candidates will exhibit some or all of the following:
At least 2 years of experience in telecommunications engineering, where you will have developed the project management skills to be able to balance multiple activities and clients at the same time
Relevant telecommunications and network engineering know-how:
Familiarity with outside plant and in-building network design
Ability to interpret building floor plans and telecom diagrams
Wireless knowledge a plus
Electrical knowledge a plus
Strong verbal and written communication skills, the ability to identify/define and solve problems
Desire to work in high-growth, start-up-like culture and a passion for innovating in the property connectivity space
Attention to detail is an absolute must as we pride ourselves on delivering high quality and reliable reports to our clients
We value relationship builders. We value thoughtfulness and determination. And above all, we value bright, creative thinkers and team players who can work independently and lead no matter what challenges appear.

Location:

Based in London, United Kingdom. There will be an occasional requirement to travel across the UK and Ireland, Europe and the USA as required.

Diversity & Inclusion:

WiredScore celebrates and supports diversity for the benefit of our employees, our business, and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and a workplace which thrives on the diversity and inclusion of everyone in the team.

We are eager to hear from a diverse range of candidates. If this opportunity is interesting as a permanent role with a degree of flexibility please discuss this with us.

Disabilities are not a barrier to employment at WiredScore.

BidFX is a FinTech start-up on a mission to disrupt the foreign exchange market, applying innovative technology to tap FX liquidity. Foreign exchange is the largest financial market in the world, with $5 trillion traded every day. We are a small but fast-growing company with big, global aspirations. We aim to connect the world of finance. We operate a successful core trading platform, with direct connectivity to all major banks, fronted by a sophisticated trading user interface. We seek candidates who wish to help us fulfil our vision and share in our success. We value diversity and offer equal opportunities to all.
BidFX engineers are responsible for solving some of the world’s most interesting technical problems. Quality cuts across every aspect of our being. Together we commit to providing an excellent user experience. Client service takes priority, but we also value our free time and appreciate that staff have commitments to friends and family. So, we cooperate to complete tasks during normal office hours. We incorporate instrumentation into all of our systems and trust in automation to provide operational efficiency.
The successful candidate will receive a generous salary that compares well with the best in our sector. A full benefits package covering pension, private health care and dental cover. Participation in an annual bonus scheme that rewards performance with a mix of cash and shares.
We recognise that the best engineers thrive on continuous skills improvement. BidFX commit to investment in your future. In addition to training and mentoring, we will allocate a budget for your personal career development.
You’ll get 25 days of annual leave (rising to 30 with service) and 3 personal days, on top of national holidays. Small perks include free breakfast and fresh fruit, office lunches, Friday drinks and regular social activities. Our technical team is located in the heart of London’s Theatre Land, near Covent Garden. The area is well connected, is pleasant with a cool vibe, has lots of good eateries and plenty of shopping opportunities.

As a Desktop Support Engineer in the BidFX Infrastructure Team, you will be responsible for supporting BidFX’s global desktop environment, which is a typical blend of Microsoft and some supplementary systems from other providers.
BidFX runs modern desktop solutions and cloud-based services for its staff who support a globally distributed, high-available, cloud-hosted SAAS platform which processes 5 billion messages per day. You will have the opportunity to help shape the future success of BidFX’s mission-critical corporate IT services function in this fast growing fintech.
You will interface with all levels of the business and have a global responsibility (UK, US, Asia). You will excel in an internal support role and be able to troubleshoot issues and handle incident escalations (sometimes out-of-hours) while promoting production change management processes and procedures.

You will have at least 5 years’ experience in a Windows desktop support role and, more recently, modern cloud technology.
You will be enthusiastic, organised and adaptable; a quick learner, who is able to adopt new technology with ease. You will have self-confidence, good interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to integrate seamlessly with other IT professionals. BidFX will give you the opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary team.
You will have a major bias towards achieving total internal customer satisfaction. You will have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and be able to operate effectively in a team environment with both technical and non-technical team members.
You will be responsible for managing a variety of operating systems, tools, processes and technologies including:
Microsoft, including on-premise AD, Azure AD, Office 365 and Windows10
Exchange and Outlook
Enterprise Anti-Virus, Spyware and Encryption Applications, DLP, Email Secure Gateways and website filtering
Microsoft PowerShell
Remote access technology and multi factor authentication
IIS and Certificate management
Working technical knowledge of DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP
General cloud office SaaS solutions
Desktops, laptops, servers and printers, Android and iPhone
Systems patching
Joiners, Movers, Leavers processes
Computer and software asset and licence tracking
User ID and application access control
Incident management ticketing system (e.g. JIRA)
Monitoring
Experience in or knowledge of any of the following would also be an advantage:
MCSE, MCSA or any relevant Windows Server Certifications
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS)
System Centre Configuration Management (SCCM)
Microsoft Azure WVD
ManageEngine
Slack
Google G-Suite
Active Directory Configuration and management
Group and Network Policy configuration
Apple MacBook
Linux/Unix
Supporting platforms for Java applications
Experience of working in the financial sector could also be beneficial. However, we will offer relevant financial training to the successful candidate.

Do you have in depth understanding of Cyber Security Methodologies? Are you familiar with the information security threats facing aerospace defence contractors or Government systems?
Northrop Grumman is seeking a Cyber Systems Engineer to provide solutions designed to enhance the overall security posture of our internal and customer systems.
This is a permanent position based in our Cheltenham office but with a requirement for overseas travel

Different thinking for a Different world
Northrop Grumman Information Security supporting the Mission Systems sector is seeking a Cyber Systems Engineer to support non US locations, providing Information Security engineering services.
This individual will join our team of qualified and diverse individuals to support digital transformation. Become part of a fully engaged high performance team providing Information Security for Northrop Grumman. The qualified applicant will serve as the Northrop Grumman’s Missions Sector InfoSec Engineer, providing Information Security engineering services.
Application of system security engineering principles is required to provide realistic solutions designed to enhance the overall security posture of internal and customer systems, to include identifying threats, developing appropriate protection measures, reviewing security implications of system changes, recommending solutions and providing support for resolution of complex technical challenges.
How you will make a difference
Key responsibilities

Research and draft Cybersecurity white papers as required, presenting findings to both technical teams and management

Network Engineer - DV Cleared

A growing Technology business with an already significant UK presence and fantastic reputation is looking for experienced Network Engineers in the Cheltenham area to join their already established team of specialists.

The team work closely with Government clients to provide bespoke, forward thinking network solutions and transformations of secure critical infrastructures.

The role

As a Network Engineer you will provide guidance and be involved in the design, support and implementation issues of routing, switching, security and network management.

You will have experience of supporting, troubleshooting, fault diagnosis and network administration of Cisco networks.

Essential skills

· CCNA certification

· Hands on experience of LAN/WAN security

· Solid understanding of networking and networking technologies

· Strong team player

This is a great opportunity to join a business that despite the current climate is growing and investing in its people. You will receive a competitive salary which is reviewed regularly, bonuses, private medical, health insurance and the chance to progress your career should you wish to.

Please note that applicants must hold a current High-level UK Government security clearance

Who are Opensignal?

Opensignal, a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, we analyse real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. We believe measuring how the network performs directly through users’ eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Our insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. We have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.

Founded in 2010, Opensignal is a high-growth global company harnessing the power of mobile technologies and big data analytics to redefine how the mobile industry measures network performance. We’re part of the Global Telecoms ‘Power 100’, TechCity Future Fifty, and backed by an impressive portfolio of investors.

We're headquartered in London, UK, where you’ll find most of our employees, but the teams you'll work with are global. A truly international team, our ‘Opensignalers’ work across four continents, and represent over 25 nationalities.

Find out more by visiting our website.

Purpose of the role

We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our Metrics Squad in transforming our real-world raw data into valuable and credible industry leading metrics that provide insights to our analysts and our customers. You would be joining the team at a critical time as 5G begins to roll out across the globe and we lead the analysis into what this experience really looks like for customers.

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for:

The creation and computation of our metrics. Working closely with our data scientists and our data engineers to create the metrics that are responsible for the pipeline that translates our raw data into usable insights that drive our business.

As well as driving the creation of new 5G metrics, we are also looking at ways to optimise our pipeline and keep our tech stack fresh.

We expect our Data Engineers to:
Own and improve our data pipeline. Assemble large, complex data sets that meet business requirements, with engineering best practices in mind.
Champion building scalable and resilient data infrastructure, as well as tools to extract and transform data used by stakeholders and customers.
Be sensitive to GDPR concerns for data within the platform.
Have a continuous improvement mindset when it comes to both the platform and the process.
Work efficiently, automate manual processes where possible and take a test driven approach to engineering.
Take a keen interest in improving the platform’s scalability while understanding the cost.
Be a good team player, with an agile approach and a can do attitude.
Keep yourself current and make sure we follow best practices and engineering standards.
Be an advocate for the platform and its health. Take ownership of your work from conception through to support.
Be detail orientated and understand the importance of the credibility of our metrics. Document and communicate with stakeholders in a language understood by all.
Requirements

What we need from you

As a Data Engineer we would expect you to have previous experience in manipulating, processing, storing and extracting value from big data.
Experience with big data tools, specifically Apache Spark.
Experience with relational SQL databases. Prior experience with Postgres or desirably, AWS Athena (Presto).
Experience with SQL query authoring.
Experience with data pipeline / workflow tools i.e. Apache Airflow.
Experience with AWS cloud services like EC2, S3, managed Kubernetes and Aurora.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python and desirably Scala.
Experience in writing tests, especially in BDD style and working with Git.
Strong analytic skills in working with unstructured datasets.
Experience in root cause analysis of data when asked to answer specific business questions.
Experience building and optimising 'big data' data pipelines.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams.
Strong self-organisational skills
Experience being part of a cross functional team, using agile methodologies.

Competitive salary and stock options to share our growth
Matched-contribution based pension scheme, company-wide bonus, private healthcare (including wellbeing subscriptions and discounted gym membership), life insurance, cycle to work scheme and MacBook
Constant exposure to learning opportunities in your role and the ability to make an impact from day one
£1000 learning budget with access to a learning platform providing access to thousands of opportunities to spend it on – from conferences to courses and training, and regular 'Opensessions' (internal learning talks)

25 days holiday per year, enhanced parental leave, and generous flexible working culture
